I have had trouble dealing with the front desk people, checking in people and even the manager. I know there are "CORPORATE RULES" and you have to "FOLLOW PROCEDURES" but what ever happened with going above and beyong expectation to help your guest??? Last night I knew my wife was going to beat me to the hotel by at least an hour so I called to see if she could check in with my credit card, I was told NO, ok what about letting me give you my CC over the phone. I was told NO, ok what about giving me a CC authorizatong form I can send back to you. I was told NO. ok what about letting
Manager Response: Dear thexman98,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your experience at our hotel. While I am grateful for your continued patronage, I would like to apologize for any inconveniences and lapses in being provided exceptional service that you recieved. It is inexcusable that our policy was not thoroughly explained to you. I will certainly speak to our entire front desk team to ensure this does not reoccur in the future. I hope we have the opportunity to improve your opinion of our hotel and the service we are fondly known for providing.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: My family enjoyed 3 nights here recently.  We were in town for a convention but also managed to sneak some fun in.  The rooms are large, newly remodeled and very clean.  The bathroom area was a little small but the tub was huge!   Pool area was great too.  Best things to note are location:very convenient to the beach cities of Huntington and Newport.  A variety of places to eat in the area.  Also, the staff are amazing.  Everyone was friendly and helpful.  The breakfast room was swamped all 3 mornings and the attendants were working VERY hard to cook and clean for everyone.  And the breakfast is delicious.  I don't normally eat hotel eggs but they were very good.  Potatoes and sausage, eggs and your normal continental fair every morning.  Plus waffles and pancakes or French

Friendly greeting and very helpful at the front desk, esp Shelley.  Nice lobby.  Very comfortable and clean.  The parking is limited and full.  Nice clean rooms.  Fwy friendly and close to gas, fast food and restaurants.  Also close to Sprouts and Costco.  Walk to El Torito. Nice breakfast selections included with room.

My wife and I loved almost everything about our 4 night stay at Ayres in Yorba Linda.  The staff was very friendly, even provided us details to an awesome sushi place nearby called Sai Sushi.  The hotel was clean in the areas that we walked through.  The room was very spacious. The bathroom had the largest non jacuzzi tub I have ever seen.  Very nice finishes in the room.  The room was clean and had no odd smells.  It had one of the biggest TV's in a hotel room at 49".  The wifi in the hotel wasn't bad either!  The only reason this review wasn't a 5 star was because of the terrible mattress and pillows.  Those 4 nights for us were some of the worst slept nights in years.  Any little bit of movement was transferred across the bed.  The pillows were the flattest pillows and no

Stayed at the Ayers this week to work a technical conference at one of our field offices. I though this was a great hotel ( and I live out of hotels ) rooms were clean, breakfast was good and the bartenders were friendly. My new home when I am in Yorba Linda.

Weekend stay was quiet and comfortable. King room with sofa-bed. Rooms were clean, with larger than normal tub/shower. TV size was also on the plus side. If your a light sleeper you may want to request a room away from the elevator/icemaker room as it can be heard through the wall. Great experience overall and will stay again if in the area.

One of the best hotels I’ve visited in a long time. Although a bit tricky to locate, the hotel is well worth the wait of a couple missed turns. Checkin was seamless with a very pleasant front desk staff. The room boasted a king size bed, leather sleeping sofa, dining table, microwave, refrigerator, writing desk, and large flat screen tv. The room was immaculate with stylish features making it look comfortable and well cared for AND the bathroom was spotless! My room had a large arched window with a beautiful view of the mountains. The room was very quiet with no hallway or neighboring noise. The free breakfast buffet was well stocked with many tasty options and very clean! The charge for a one night stay was moderate and well worth the cost.

Our accountant is in savi ranch . We love staying here. Staff is great . Manager Stephanie always remembers us. Beautiful remodel to rooms . We are happy here. Costco is walking distance. Lots of shopping is close . You can go to fanatics gym around the corner for free.

Summary Heading: Very clean and breakfast was good too!
Summary: Nice room very clean would stay here again.  Free breakfast was better than most! Close drive to the Nixon Library and other shopping and restaurants.  Nice area 20 minutes to the beach. Would stay here again.

The reason for my trip was unfortunate as I was traveling because of an illness in the family. However, this hotel made a difficult situation so much easier. The rooms are spacious and clean. The hotel is well-maintained and the staff is friendly and helpful. I appreciated the hot breakfast in a very clean breakfast room where staff was on top of clearing dishes and cleaning the area. From start to finish it was a wonderful stay and I was very impressed!

It was a very nice, clean, hotel and room. breakfast was very good. Checking in and out was very easy Staff was awesome. Getting to the places we need to be at was very easy.  Hotel was right off the freeway which was really nice.

From the moment you drive up the hill you know you are staying somewhere special! The front desk staff is very warm and friendly, explaining how the Ayres Suites line is a step above all other hotels without the exaggerated price tag! The rooms are HUGE, the beds are heavenly to sleep on and the breakfast is fabulous! There was a large group of Travel Softball girls that all stayed here for a tournament and this location made the grade with all the 14 year olds and their parents. Great place to stay :)

I was very impressed with the Ayres in Yorba Linda. The staff was great. The facility was clean and our room was spacious and clean. The continental breakfast had a lot of options and we enjoyed eating in the Ayres dining room.  I generally stay at the Marriot when visiting my family in Anaheim Hills but plan to stay at the Ayres in Yorba Linda from now on.

My Husband and I stayed here for a family event. I am from this area and there was not enough room to stay with family like we usually do. We often see the hotel from the freeway and have wanted to stay here. We hada view of the the mountain and not the freeway, but would assume you still can't hear the freeway noise from the other side. The staff was helpful and friendly. Room was what I expected and clean. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear daisies4,  Thank you for your thoughtful review! We are delighted to see that you found our hotel to be a clean and quiet place to stay near your family. We look forward to seeing you again whenever you are back in town!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: 3rd stay at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda
Summary: The staff has always been quick and welcoming.  On our last visit, I had messed up the reservations.  In the morning I approached the manager with my problem.  It was my mistake, but she quickly said no problem and refunded me for a night stay.   We will be going back there and praising Ayres Suites to all
Manager Response: Dear Brigitte B,  Thank you for your kind review! We are pleased to see that you found our team to be welcoming and efficient. In addition, I am glad that I was able to assist you with resolving the error on your reservation. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Front desk not helpful.  Wanted to add another room , as sofa bed horribly uncomfortable. Front desk would not match the online price of the other two rooms we booked. .  Pool not opened. Said it was too windy. Not sure why they charge so much for two queen beds compared to other hotels.
Manager Response: Dear Margaret M,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on your recent stay! I would like to send my sincere apologies for any inconsistencies and discomfort you have experienced during your visit with us. We highly value the safety and comfort our guests experience and we are truly sorry if we have fallen short in any way during your stay. We appreciate your feedback and hope to welcome you back again for a five-star experience.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice, clean and quiet hotel. Would have been perfect if FOX news wasn't on all the time
Summary: Great remodeled hotel. Room was super clean and comfortable. Nice large soaking tub with shower. Bed and pillows were exceptional. Breakfast was okay, a slight cut above most free breakfasts. Biggest problem with the stay was FOX news was on all the televisions everyday in the eating areas. Maybe some people want to watch that, but many others don't. Thanksgiving day, with plenty of kids in the room, and they opt for FOX News instead of the MACY's parade.  Give me a break!
Manager Response: Dear patfromkona,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on your most recent stay with us. We are pleased to see that you were satisfied with our clean and comfortable accommodations. We appreciate your feedback on the programs shown on the televisions in the dining area. Your feedback helps us to better serve our valued guests in the future. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: great hotel, quiet and close to where i needed to be....competitive price....clean and quiet....I definitely would stay here again....breakfast was pretty good too which was a bonus....close to restaurants and shopping

Made my reservations early via phone call.  The person was very nice and was very accommodating when I said I had a medical service dog.  While I was on the road they tried contacting me several times to find out if I needed a handicap room which I didn't. The room was very large, comfortable and quiet.  There was a party next door and I never heard them.  The staff was very helpful when I needed two bowls for soup I purchased at a Vietnamese Restaurant they recommended.  In the morning the breakfast was delightful.  Unlike many other places  they had fresh made eggs, pancakes, french toast and biscuits and gravy. (not prepaid eggs from frozen packages or soggy pancakes from a machine.)    An excellent range of fruit, fruit juices, cold and hot cereals, and good yogurt.  Think I
Manager Response: Dear Iamalwayslost,  I am glad to know that you found the room to be very comfortable and that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for taking the time to provide a detailed review of our breakfast offerings and the services our team members assisted you with. If you are ever back in the area, we would love to see you again!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay, large room and quiet
Summary: This was my first time with Ayres, and it was excellent, all around.  I found a great value from their website and therefore, booked direct.  The staff provided an email confirmation, and then another confirmation the week of my visit.  I called ahead of check in, as I was early, and was pleased that they could accommodate my early arrival.  The room was large with a spacious closet.  I also enjoyed  the large bathroom and shower/tub.  The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and the air conditioning was good and cold.  I enjoyed the breakfast, and helpful front desk staff. Also, the El Torito restaurant was right next door, so it was easy to access.  I am sure I will book again in the future!
Manager Response: Dear Clay,  We are so glad that you had a pleasant stay at our hotel and that you truly enjoyed our amenities. Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and for taking the time to provide us with such lovely compliments. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The rooms are big, nicely decorated with comfortable bed and big oval tub.  Breakfast buffet changes a little each day.  One day offering French toast, the next pancakes along with eggs, fruits and a great selection of bread

The staff members were ever so grateful to accomodate me these past ten days while I had a broken air conditioner at home. I loved the view of the hills from my room, the comfortable bed and pool area.
Manager Response: Dear Laurin P.,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and for your rating and review. We are delighted to see that you enjoyed your stay and hope to welcome you back in the near future.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: First time I've stayed at an Ayres Hotel and the room was so quiet. You can't hear people next door or above getting up, water running, or anything!  The bed was nice and firm, breakfast was really good. Very nice stay!

I was pleasantly surprised when I entered my room, as it had recently been renovated.  It went from an older style, dark room, to one that is clean, fresh, bright and modern.    So nice to have a real shower head in a bathroom, and not a rain mist type!  My only complaint on this stay was that the hot water was tepid, at best.  A brisk way to start the day, but with all the other pluses, I let it go.
Manager Response: Dear TPM329,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review following your stay at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda. I am delighted to see that you enjoyed your experience and hope you will join us again, should you ever require accommodations in Yorba Linda or Anaheim Hills in the future.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Lots of pros but no internet service in my room during my stay
Summary: Pros: A few minutes from a Riverside Freeway (91) on/off ramp          Has a El Torito next door if you're into Mexican food.          Clean, modern  Cons: A few no-maintenance items e.g., the fire alarm in my room was hanging down on it's wire.           There was no internet service in my room (108). I asked the afternoon clerk about it. She couldn't believe it, so she came with her phone and couldn't connect either. "I don't know why" she said, and that was that. The next day I asked the manager about it. "Oh, yes, we've had several calls so we know there was a problem" Isn't one enough?
Manager Response: Dear Paul S.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your experience with us. While I appreciate your kind compliments regarding our optimal location and accommodations, I would like to sincerely apologize for any issues you encountered with our WiFi service. Thank you for your review and we hope to welcome you back in the near future.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Northern Orange County
Summary: I needed a place to stay that was centrally located for my travel plans while in SoCal.  The Ayers Suites in Yorba Linda could not be more perfect.  It was clean and quiet.  The Breakfast was outstanding and their happy hour made it convenient too.  The staff was helpful and every effort was made to ensure we had a pleasant stay.  I would recommend staying here... as I will do so on my future visits.
Manager Response: Dear David K.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay with us. I truly appreciate your kind compliments on our optimal location, well-appointed accommodations, and exceptional team members. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The room was very clean, comfortable, quiet and everyone was so nice.  I am looking forward to my next stay which I hope will be real soon!  We always stay at this hotel when we come into town to visit friends.   Wouldn't stay any where else.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel I Stay in While Traveling
Summary: Eleanor and all of the staff are excellent. They go out of their way to accommodate your needs and the rooms are always clean. They have recently remodeled their facility and it is now much better. Eleanor is the best manager at any location I have ever met in 25 years of traveling.

Thoroughly enjoyed our 3 day stay.  The staff was courteous and helpful.  Some thing we are not finding at other hotel chains.   We found the room very clean and comfortable.    If you have a choice, this is the best place to stay.  Breakfast is included and was better than most.  This is our new must stay when traveling through.

Summary Heading: Friendly Professional Staff, Large Comfortable Room
Summary: Stayed at the Ayres Suites Yorba Linda for business and was impressed with the friendly staff. My room was large and my stay was comfortable. The free breakfast was better than most and the attentive staff kept it well provisioned.
Manager Response: Dear SocalRichard,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your time with us. I truly appreciate your kind compliments regarding our accommodations, full American breakfast, and exceptional team members' service. Thank you again for your review. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Rooms are clean, quiet and spacious. Beds and pillows are comfortable. Staff is friendly and helpful. The free breakfast is exceptional. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub. My husband and I have been staying here for many years everytime we visit the area. I love this hotel.

My wife and I stayed here overnight.  Room was outdated and we had a view of their air conditioning unit(room 219).  Front desk employees were very nice and they have a free breakfast that is better than most hotels.  There is an El Torino next door if you don't want to drive anywhere for food.  They are currently remodeling so I would wait a couple of months if you want to stay here.  This hotel has a lot of potential.  I was just disappointed that I got a crappy room for my first stay.
Manager Response: Dear Cuaman,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your time with us. While I am glad to see that you enjoyed our complimentary full American breakfast and friendly team members, I would like to apologize for your room and the view you had. Thank you for your review and we hope to give you a better impression of the hotel upon your next visit!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The rooms are large, clean and comfortable. The mattress could be a bit softer. For a 'free' breakfast, the buffet is plentiful and good quality. We've stayed in other hotels in the area but this is by far our favorite.

The room was nice and clean but the bed was not comfortable. Couldn't sleep because the mattress was hard. The breakfast was just okay (Didn't care for the eggs, potatoes, or chocolate pancakes) so I had a hard boiled egg with a bagel. We also were not told all the amenities the hotel had to offer or where the pool was. One plus side was, we were able to watch the dodger game!
Manager Response: Dear Monica G.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your time with us. While I am glad you enjoyed the room, I would like to apologize for any inconsistency you experienced with the bed, breakfast, and not being advised what amenities we offered, as well as where they were located. Thank you for your review and we hope to welcome you back for a more enjoyable stay in the future.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: This is a great hotel in a semi-central location for a southern CA stay.  It is my second time to stay and I will always choose this hotel when possible. The staff could not be more friendly or helpful.  Smiles abound even in the breakfast room! It is clean, efficient and a great value! Accolades to the staff who make this place so great!

Delicious breakfast provided daily! The highlight of my stay.  The rooms are a little outdated.    The front desk receptionist Brittany was very helpful. I had left my Ipad after checking out and she ensured my Ipad was located and agreed to send it to me after I provided a Fedex label.    Upon checking in, the receptionist didn't go over the amenities (Pool, fitness center, etc) or their timing.
Manager Response: Dear Millimil21,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay with us. While I am glad you enjoyed the breakfast and found our front desk team to be helpful, I would like to apologize regarding the decor of the room and that the front desk did not go over amenities with you properly. Thank you for your review and wonderful insight. We hope to welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: clean hotel, newly remodeled.  My only concern was that I was on the 4th floor over the pool.  The windows had the ability to fully open.  I was concern because my niece and nephew came to visit and I worried about them opening the window.  It is low and someone can easily fall.
Manager Response: Dear Johncarithers,  Thank you for your review regarding your time with us. While I really appreciate your kind compliments regarding our newly renovated rooms, I would like to apologize for any issues you had with our windows. Thank you for your review and we hope to welcome you back in the near future.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Found this gem of a hotel on TripAdvisor and completely agree with others’ positive reviews. We stayed in this area for a wedding and it was nice place to come back to as the room was well appointed, clean, and comfortable. We got a renovated room overlooking the pool and garden area. Bathroom and shower/tub are considerably large. Complimentary hot breakfast was delicious and had a decent selection of fresh fruits, baked goods, eggs, etc. Lobby and lounge area with pool table are clean and inviting. Above all, the service was great and always with a smile. I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope others enjoy it as much as I did!

An exceptional location. Right off the freeway with great access to Yorba Linda, Placentia and Fullerton.    Wonderful accommodations! Great reception counter staff, kitchen crew for morning breakfast and friendly hotel room staff.  Clean, quiet, and very nice.  I would be glad to stay here or at another Ayres Suites location.  Close to many things and a great Mexican restaurant just a few steps across the parking lot.  Highly recommend this location!

Thank God for places & people like those at Ayres Suites. We were desperate for a room and found Ayers online with a direct connect to book (no middle man). When we arrived (very late at night) we got the best treatment from the man on duty, helped with everything, and price was good too! And it just kept getting better and better the whole time: Very excellent room; spacious, lovely, roomy and impressive -  We got down to breakfast at 9:50 AM (cut off is 10) - but they kept the food coming and even extended for another group who came in at 15 after! Check out is noon (not 11 AM like others) Again, no problem for extension for another 30 minutes. Gracious, polite, concerned - the staff was better than some family members (you know what I mean) And it was very INEXPENSIVE! Thanks

My husband had business in Santa Ana and remembering what a great experience we had the last time, we decided to stay here again. This time we were able to partake in breakfast which was better than most hotel chains that serve breakfast.  The chef prepared fresh scrambled eggs and cheese right before us and everything is laid out neatly and clean...waffle bar...fruit bar...etc!  Chocolate chip cookies are available at 7pm which is a nice bonus when coming in from work.  The bed is extremely comfortable...added a third night!  Don't hesitate staying here! It's meticulously well maintained!

One night stay only. Everything efficient, breakfast fine, checkout easy. When we had a little down time, watched the nice size TV from the comfortable couch in the room. Everything clean, service just right. Bed comfortable.

The hotel overall is nice and in a good location with restaurants and shops within walking distance. The staff was friendly and helpful and the room was clean. There were just a couple of things that would of made my stay better. 1) Offer a couple of free bottled waters in the room. It makes a big difference. I felt ripped off having to pay $2.50 at the vending machine. 2). Open the windows to air out the rooms. The minute I stepped in the room there was a strong musty odor. Not sure if I would stay there again for $175/ night.
Manager Response: Dear Dionne R,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your recent stay with us. While I appreciate your kind compliments regarding the location of our hotel, I would like to apologize regarding the aroma in your room. We hope that this isolated incident does not deter you from returning.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Another great stay at Ayers YL
Summary: I can't say enough about this hotel. We have been staying here for years on our trips to Orange County. Upscale accommodations, friendly staff, great fresh cooked breakfast ( not the powdered egg and soggy sausage other places offer as part of the stay),  and QUIET.    There is nothing to complain about and no other place t that compares in the area.

Excellent accommodations, very spacious, clean newly renovated rooms. Safe location. Great place for athletes, large soaking tub, a full free breakfast and many nearby restaurants.  One of the young ladies staying in our room was asked to sign her NLI while we were there and the ladies at the front desk helped her with downloading and printing of the paperwork.  Very courteous and helpful!
Manager Response: Dear Lori P,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda during your recent travels to the area. We are thrilled to know that you enjoyed our oversized tubs, complimentary full American breakfast, and convenient location. I am happy to see you folks were able to utilize our business center and the exceptional service from our front desk agents made all the difference. We hope to welcome you antime you need accommodations in Yorba Linda or Anaheim Hills!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: We recently stayed at the Ayrers Suites in Yorba Linda, CA.  And we loved it.  Our room was big, beautiful, clean, perfect.  Hotel staff very nice.  Be sure and book thru the actual hotel if you want to get Rewards.  If you book thru a 3rd party you won't get Rewards.  We found that out the hard way.  714 921 8688.  We will for sure stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Susie Russell,  Thank you for your kind review and rating. I am delighted to know that you loved our atmosphere and accommodations. We strive to provide each guest with exceptional service and I am pleased to see that we did just that during your visit. We hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: There were insects in the bed when we got to the hotel at night to go to bed. Hotel was fully booked and they couldn't offer us another room. We left immediately and did not stay the night there. Yet they charged us for the room and only offered a small discount (%15)!! The staff are very rude. I called the manager the day after to complain and ask for a refund. He was even more rude.
Manager Response: Dear Ali S.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your recent visit to our hotel. I would like to apologize for any inconsistencies you encountered. As was stated by our team members during the incident, you were booked in the room all afternoon, had the window open, and declined to move to a new room. We kept your insight in mind when speaking and seemed to come to an agreement with a 15% discount for the inconvenience. Please accept our sincere apologies as it seems this was not the solution you were looking for. If you would like to speak further on the matter, please do not hesitate to reach out to me directly at 714-921-8688 ext.0. Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your stay with us.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Great staff,everyone is very helpful & acknowledges your presence, great accommodations & amenities. Was a pleasant stay, highly recommend. There is a variety of restaurants surrounding the hotel. Walking distance to retail stores.

Stayed here before and the experience was the same-Great!  Love staying here. First the staff is extremely friendly, helpful & courteous. My original reservation was for  one king bed,  I later requested 2 Queens but was told they were sold out. They  offered to make up the sofa bed before I arrived but when I checked it 2 queens were available.  They checked me in to the newly renovated part of the hotel.  It's so quiet there we hardly heard any other guests.
Manager Response: Dear Adrienne R,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your recent visit to Ayres Suites Yorba Linda. We truly appreciate your kind comments concerning our comfortable accommodations, hotel, and friendly team members. Thank you for your review and we hope to welcome you back very soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The staff at the Ayers Yorba Linda are wonderful. The hotel is always clean and the rooms are great. I enjoy the variety of breakfast options in the morning. This hotel is close to restaurants, shopping and easy freeway access.

Summary Heading: Great staff who is very accomodating
Summary: Great staff, rooms and breakfast.  I would stay at this location again. Also close to John Wayne airport.  Stayed their for a business/museum board meeting.  The rooms are being redone.  I stayed in a refurbished room and one of the originals.  Both were in great shape.

My Stay at this Hotel was a great  and  comfortable  experience, Room was very clean and quiet  second floor, The Breakfast was Awsome fresh and hot meal ,love that.Staff was very nice and heplfull.Overall excellent stay.

Hotel is very comfortable. Currently renovating some of the rooms. We stayed in a king suite which had just been decorated, very nicely Celtic done and spacious. Buffet breakfast is very good. Hotel staff very friendly

We had very positive experiences with Ayres Hotels & Suites. First time staying in this hotel, really liked It.  Room was very nice, accommodations were excellent. Breakfast was very good. Front desk staff was very polite, professional  and helpful. Will definitely stay there again.

Was in the area for a memorial service. Sad reason but our room was lively. Very welcoming staff. And great hot breakfast. Love that there was a sink outside the toilet/tub area. Makes getting ready when there are two of you so much easier.
Manager Response: Dear Diane S.,  Thank you for your wonderful review and rating. We are happy to know that we helped make your difficult stay a bit easier with lovely room accommodations and our welcoming service. Our separate vanity and complimentary breakfast are certainly a pleasure to offer our guests and it is great to see that those items made a difference for you. Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and we wish you and yours the absolute best.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Very well appointed rooms with refrigerator and microwave.  Very helpful and friendly staff. Close to D-land and many other attractions in the area. Can hardly wait to return and see what the newly remodeled rooms will look like.

We stayed here both before and after our day at the Nixon Presidential Library and Museum. It is located just off CA-91 and a conveniently short drive from the museum.  Our room was large with comfortable bed and linens, great sofa and coffee table, two side chairs and small table, and a desk with business chair. We also had a large jetted tub in the bathroom and a small bar area with refrigerator and microwave.   Thursday night we enjoyed complimentary wine and/or beer with light snacks. Each morning we ate well at the complimentary breakfast where the cheesy scrambled eggs were cooked just behind the buffet itself.  Ample seating for guests.  Several restaurants in the immediate area for other meals.  We absolutely would choose Ayers Suites again!
Manager Response: Dear Mary E.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your experience at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda. We appreciate your kind compliments concerning our optimal location, comfortable accommodations, full American breakfast, as well as our evening reception. We hope your next visit is very soon!  Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: This hotel offers both a happy hour with wine, beer and chips as well as hot breakfast. It was conveniently located to a Mexican restaurant next door where we were able to meet out of town friends. The hotel offered a 20% off coupon to the Mexican restaurant next door where we met our friends. Good breakfast and friendly staff. Free wifi and parking. Other restaurants and shopping close by.

We stay here every time we visit SoCali.  Currently being remodeled.  I look forward to seeing the new look.  Good location, close enough to Disney and major highways.  Restaurants nearby.  Friendly staff and a great breakfast every morning.

The room was comfortable and quiet.  The hot tub was wonderfully hot! The evening snack and the morning breakfast were great. The people were friendly and efficient.  The parking was plentiful. All that and the price was great.

This hotel was comfy with just a couple of exceptions.  Their was an odor similar to sweet almonds when we arrived to our room.  We assumed that this was due to something used in cleaning.  When we saw the housekeeping staff we told them about it and asked that no chemicals be used for cleaning.  They complied and we didn't have any more problems with that.  Happy to see that the rooms are being remodeled.  Our room was good but needed some updating.  The toilet sat very low and that was uncomfortable.  Thankful that the room was quiet and close to our family.
Manager Response: Dear Marsha K.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay with us. While I was glad you enjoyed your time with us I wanted to apologize for any inconsistencies you had with the smell in the room but was happy to see that it was fixed in a timely manner. Thank you for your review and we can only hope to welcome you back in the near future.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Check-in was quick and easy. Location was perfect, and  even though the hotel faces a very busy freeway, our room was very quiet. The bed was very comfortable, and the complementary breakfast was quite good. Although hotel renovations were underway, it wasn't particularly noisy or even obvious. We would stay here again.

This hotel is close to a lot of food and shopping. It's a little outdated on the inside but they are doing construction to make it look beautiful! The pool and hot tub are looking out on the gorgeous hill side too.   The shuttle only takes you 5 miles due to "liability insurance" ... whatever that means, but the receptionist were always so helpful and kind. I'll definitely be staying here again!
Manager Response: Dear Jessica B.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your experience at our hotel. I truly appreciate all of your kind comments regarding our hotel, location, and friendly team members. I would like to apologize for any inconsistencies you faced with the shuttle only going a short distance, however, I am glad that did not hamper your stay. Thank you again for your review and we hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: We have stayed for years @ Ayres Yorba Linda.  We love the comfortable clean rooms & the delicious hot breakfast! We just stayed this last week & the breakfast is even BETTER!!  Everyone is so kind!! The Ayres does have a loyalty point program!
Manager Response: Dear Bev B.,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you recently. We are thrilled to know that you enjoy our location time and time again. We appreciate your loyalty to our collection and Ayres Rewards. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Convenient to family we needed to visit. Comfortable bed, clean room, helpful and friendly staff. Hot breakfast included good variety and happy to have the fresh melon/citrus fruit. Microwave and fridge in room.

Loved this location. First time staying at this location and it was great. Room was clean and well kept and I made a special request while traveling with my handicap parent and they accommodated my needs perfect. Breakfast buffet was great and the workers worked very hard to keep everything stocked. Dining are was clean and well kept. In the area are a handful of eateries and gas station, so it is a convenient location. Front desk staff was nice and helpful at checkin, will definitely stay here again and recommend to any one.

We decided to get down to Orange County for the weekend and could not have been more pleased. We started off with a very friendly and efficient check-in. Our room was wonderful and very nicely appointed and comfortable. The hotel's location was in a great spot to get to everything we wanted to do. The complimentary breakfast was the best we have ever had from a hotel - the staff and atmosphere was very friendly, the food was well prepared and attractively set out, and was served on actual dinnerware, not divided foam plates and plastic utensils. The Wi-Fi coverage was robust no matter where we were in the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Jazzmike,  Thank you for reviewing your perfect weekend getaway! We are delighted to know that you enjoyed our convenient location, accommodations, and exclusive complimentary amenities. It is our pleasure to provide a friendly and comfortable atmosphere. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Stay, would stay here again!
Summary: This hotel was perfect for our vacation to Disneyland. It was easy to get to and from the park. Check in was easy. Room was nice, cozy and very big! We loved all the extra space! Beds were a little old but still slept well.  Air conditioning worked well and there is even a ceiling fan to help with air flow. There is a jacuzzi tub, but we did not us it. The shower was good. Breakfast was good, something for everyone (fruit salad was not good). There are also plenty of places to eat walking distance from the hotel of just a short drive. I would definitely stay here again.

Great value and a short 10 minute drive to the Nixon Presidential Library.  Love the lobby.  It's like someone's library.  Spacious and comfortable room.  Friendly staff.  Very good hot and cold buffet breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear Roy F.,  Thank you for your wonderful review and rating. We hope you will return anytime you are visiting Yorba Linda and the Nixon Presidential Library!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Such a cozy and comfy room!
Summary: We checked in so very late thinking we'd get a badly located room, but the night desk person checked us into a corner room on the third floor with wonderful light and big windows. We couldn't hear the traffic from the street and slept soundly. The beds were super comfy. The jacuzzi tub was a nice luxury to have when we missed the hours of the hot tub and pool at night. The hotel is surrounded by so many great food choices from a health food store to fast food to commercial franchise restaurants, whatever your eating preference. If you like nightcaps, El Torito shares the parking lot and is open til 1 am I think on the weekends. Parking is plenty and a close, safe walk to the lobby. It was by far one of the best continental breakfasts (when it comes to free food) and coffee is
Manager Response: Dear WanderlustVeeves,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay. We are humbled by your compliments and wonderful rating. We hope you will return soon to enjoy the same great value and exceptional service that is synonymous with our hotel!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: What a wonderful hotel!!  The rooms are spacious, luxurious and extremely clean.  I live in Northern California and when I told a friend that I was going down, she asked where we were staying.  I told her the Ayres Suits and she couldn't stop raving about it.  I can honestly say that she was correct.  Great hotel!!
Manager Response: Dear Aralday,  Thank you for reviewing your recent stay at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda. We are delighted to know that we exceeded your expectations and hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Loved everything this hotel had to offer. Check in was a breeze, helpful friendly staff. Was surprised at the luxurious rooms. The beds and pillows were absolutely comfortable. Clean. Great A/C. Jacuzzi tub too!  Walked to dinner at the El Torito restaurant where we had a delicious meal and great service. Will definitley come back to this hotel again even tho it is farther away from where our convention was than other Ayres hotels weve stayed at.
Manager Response: Dear Adrienne R.,  Thank you for taking the time to detail your "perfect stay"! We are humbled by your kind compliments and hope you will return soon.   Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: There are not many hotels in the Yorba Linda area so this one is exceptional.  The staff is wonderful and very helpful. The accommodations are very nice.  The beds and pillows are to die for!! They have a workout room and a  pool/jacuzzi/ BBQ area that is really nice.  There is a superb buffet breakfast with eggs and sausage and Belgian waffles.  They usually have another item like French toast or biscuits and gravy as well and all the other usual Continental breakfast items. During the week they have happy hour with a wine and cheese type reception and chocolate cookies in the evening.   Its about 15 minutes from hot spots like Disneyland, the Honda center and Angels stadium and have shopping and restaurants close by.  I highly recommend this hotel!!

Summary Heading: Only four stars because I haven't stayed yet...
Summary: ...but that doesn't slow my enthusiasm because I just booked three nights this weekend!  I stayed in the Diamond Bar Ayres earlier this year and LOVED it!  But, when I began checking on the Yorba Linda location, it showed already booked.  I've spent a frantic two weeks trying to find a hotel that fit my, admittedly, very picky requirements for location, quality, and value.  Uggh!  I didn't want near Disney - prices way too high for even the 2-star places, and I wanted to stay in CA-91 corridor, and I like a nicer hotel and, of course, I don't want to pay a couple-hundred bucks for a bed (even in a nice room) if I'm without my family.    A few days ago, mostly out of frustration, I called the Ayres, Yorba Linda on the chance that they might have a cancellation or something else

Thank you to everyone for making our stay very comfortable.  We traveled with our service dogs to visit husband's sick mother.  Everyone was friendly and accommodating.  We were all very comfortable and the large suite provided us room to move around with two dogs and two humans.  Super convenient with a hot breakfast every morning and restaurants and fast food close enough to walk to.

Summary Heading: Fantastic hotel for visiting Yorba Linda, Placentia, Anaheim Hills
Summary: The room had a great bed, very comfortable with lots of pillows, the Jacuzzi tub was a nice surprise and wonderful. The wet bar had a dorm size refrigerator and microwave, my only complaint is that they only gave us two little pod things of regular coffee for the coffee maker. But then we went down to a wonderful breakfast with fresh waffles and french toast, eggs, bacon, lots of pastries and plenty of tables and chairs. They also had a wine and cheese reception in the early evening in the lobby. The staff was all very friendly and helpful and even all the people staying there were always cheerful so they must have been having a good time also.
Manager Response: Dear AZman8tee,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda for your recent visit to the area. It is a delight to know that you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast, evening reception, as well as our world-class accommodations and service. We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Wonderful bed!  CHEERS to the young gentleman that came to our rescue when my daughter got sick and made the couch bed up quickly, brought xtra pillows...very accommodating. Good location for us. The breakfast was a typical continental breakfast with scrambled eggs and sausage, chocolate  chip pancakes were a bonus for the kids.  Would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear ThePuraVidaChef,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you recently. I am delighted to know that you enjoyed our amenities and accommodations. We look forward to your return!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Hotel it was very relaxing for my parents. They are very hard to please.
Summary: The room was what my parents needed. They were there for my son wedding and wanted to find a great hotel for two nights. The whole staff and even all the guest were very polite. Anything they needed they were helped. The room was like being at home with the desk, couch, sitting area even the view was so relaxing. My daughter and I showed up to see them and they were having a lot of fun. I live in Yorba Linda I told them I would stay there to get away that's how relaxing it was. Thank You to the staff for everything I did not have to be worried about my parents only my son wedding.  Sincerely Melessia Messina
Manager Response: Dear mmessina2016,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your parents' recent stay with us. It is a pleasure to read of their enjoyment at our hotel. We are honored to provide the high level of service that is synonymous with the Ayres name. We hope to welcome you and yours back soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Comfortable, well appointed, will be back
Summary: Quiet, clean, spacious rooms and common areas with comfortable beds. In the shower, there is very good water pressure and a jet tub in the king suite rooms, which I really appreciated!  The hotel is next to a shopping mall with Costco, Sprouts Market, Best Buy, others, and many restaurants.  Room includes very good self-serve breakfast. They cook the food in front of you, so it smells and tastes yummy!  They have billiards in the afternoon available in the dining area.

Love this boutique hotel and thank you to Stephanie and front desk for accommodating us. Very clean room and property very well maintained and love that it is close to so many places. The lobby is beautiful and the kitchen where breakfast is served of course spotless which I appreciate. The bed is perfect and feather pillows ☺️
Manager Response: Dear schmidtable,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent birthday celebration with us. We truly appreciate the kind compliments you have shared regarding our clean and well-maintained property, accommodating front desk team, as well as our comfortable Celestial Sleepers and bedding. Thank you for your review and we hope to welcome you back in the near future.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: as in REALLY REALLY NICE!  My wife and I came down for the weekend to watch the Angels play.  We typically use Hotwire and "roll the dice" on where to stay and it picked this hotel.  When I read the reviews, I decided to add another day and was happy I did.  Great hotel and great staff..nothing but good things to say about this place.
Manager Response: Dear Steven Z.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay with us. We truly appreciate your kind compliments regarding our hotel and exceptional team. Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you back soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: As I mentioned in the title, the staff I was in contact with were very nice.  My room however, needed a bit of tlc.  The TV would go in and out out of working properly.  The lamp by the bed had a short or something.  It would turn on and off on it's own and the switch was wonky.  I am used to staying at hotels where you have the option of not having daily "maid" service.  So, with this daily service, I noticed that not every surface was wiped down. They do fold a mean towel though.  It was nice to have breakfast available but it is the same every day.  The free wine and beer each evening was my favorite :)
Manager Response: Dear Hayley B.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your time with us. While I was glad to read that you found our team was welcoming and that you enjoyed our evening reception, I would like to extend my sincere apologies for any inconsistencies you experienced with your accommodations. We will certainly look into the points you have noted and hope to welcome you back in the future for a more enjoyable stay. Thank you for your review.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: So before coming here I had never heard of this hotel. My friends told me it was really nice, clean and good prices. I was actually here for a convention and I have to say, it was a very good stay. The room was very clean and each day we were provided with everything I needed. If I needed something I would call the lobby and they would help me at whichever time I called. We had 2 beds a microwave, small refrigerator and a small sink. My favorite part was the continental breakfast, we had everything. Every day there was eggs, waffles, potatoes, sausage, fresh fruit, yogurt cottage cheese and each day we would get a different treat like chocolate chip pancakes, french toast. And like every other continental breakfast milk, juice, coffee, toast, muffins, oatmeal, granola and

Summary Heading: my stay at Ayres last Tuesday
Summary: Hotel was very clean staff ok nfor service . My only problem was they even do not give you a bottle of water in the room you have to get from vending machine outside. The breakfast was very nice . I have good checkout experince there .

Summary Heading: Convention Stay Welcoming & Wonderful w/ Ayres Suites
Summary: We've had nothing but positive experiences with Ayres Hotels & Suites, a family-owned CA chain. We travel yearly to this area for an annual convention and large numbers arrive & use the breakfast area all around the same time, which is challenging for any hotel. Our group is always made to feel welcome, and we've experienced no issues related to missing or broken items in the rooms. Check-in is seamless; they know who you are & have your reservation & room ready. Many amenities including larger rooms (420 s.f. for 2 queens), whirlpool tub, micro, fridge & sink, plus closet doors are mirrored and there's a large mirror over the kitchen area, too. This is very helpful when a family is getting ready all at once for a dress up occasion. We could've used extra hangars, but didn't
Manager Response: Dear 3NWnatives,  Thank you for taking the time to write a glowing review based on your experience at our hotel. I appreciate your kind compliments you provided concerning our world-class service and front desk team, as well as our complimentary full American breakfast and exclusive amenities. Thank you again for your review and we hope to welcome you back in the near future.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: First time to this hotel, really liked the room decor. Room was very nice, accomadations were excellent. Will definitely stay there again. Breakfast was very good as well. Check in was very quick with good reception.

My stay at this location was as expected, wonderful. The front desk is very friendly and helpful, the hotel was clean, my room was clean, and the room is beautiful. I love that this hotel has a refrigerator and microwave with a separate counter inside the room. The breakfast is simple, but the attendants were very pleasant and helpful.

Summary Heading: It felt more like a resort than a hotel.
Summary: Everything about the hotel had an old school hotel/resort feel to it.  Nothing like a chain hotel.  Good breakfast and then good food, cookies, and free beer during evening happy hour.  Friendly and accommodating staff as well.

My experience with other Ayres hotels has been favorable and this one is even better. The large room held two queen beds and plenty of room for luggage storage. The wet bar counter with microwave and 'fridge is a helpful use of space. The sink and mirror combo is outside of the toilet and tub which is good for multiple people. I found the whirlpool tub a little difficult to get in and out of as a shower, but it's a nice feature. The breakfast area has a decent amount of seating and is comfortable. The food served is good with hot and cold items including sliced fruit, yogurt and a variety of cereals. The buffet line could be better organized; the plates and utensils are hard to find and the waffle stand blocks the bowls. The staff was friendly and helpful, and, unlike other

This hotel is the absolute best. All the employees were extremely nice. Especially Brittany and Myra! Stephanie and Eleanor, the managers, were also extremely professional and nice. Everything was fantastic. There is a full hot buffet and I newly remodeled (gorgeous) kitchen. A pool, and spa. I just can't say enough good things about Ayres. It's the place to be in this city.

Stayed at this hotel for two days when visiting friends and doing car shows. The facility is very clean and well maintained. Beds are very comfortable, and lots of room in the suites. Small room refrigerators did not cool effectively. Ice is available for personal ice chests. Breakfast was very good, but scrambled eggs had egg shells after being cooked. Hotel priced above others in the area, however the stay was very relaxing.

My first impression of how my stay would be was very good. The front desk clerk made checking in pleasurable; she was warm and welcoming with her smile and demeanor. My room was beautiful and well kept. The cleaning service gave me fresh towels daily even though I hung them up for re-use. Breakfast had a nice variety of things to choose from and was served complimentary daily.

Beautiful, comfortable, and peaceful. These  are the three words I would use to describe this hotel. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable, and breakfast was yummy. The staff were all gracious and helpful. I would definitely stay there again!

Nice big rooms, beautiful decor, and especially very clean. Loved the small wet bar, fridge and microwave. Great breakfast (although I would recommend they open it at 6:00 AM instead of 6:30 AM so a business traveler like me can beat the traffic), I will be staying here again.

Our family has stayed at this location many,  many times, we love the Ayres Yorba Linda property.  They have just remodeled their breakfast room, it is excellent and the staff are very friendly and personable.  Anytime we are in the area this is our 1st choice in accomodations

The Ayres family has entered the niche hotel business in Southern California in a big way. During our stay we ate the breakfast buffet in the lobby on cast-iron patio furniture while the breakfast area was being remodeled. The last morning we were ushered into the spacious and welll designed finished room sans the cast-iron.  The breakfast is not spectacular, but is standard 21/2 star fare.   The decor strives to create an atmosphere of 18th-19th century English countryside manors through copied paintings and statuary. Rooms are well decorate and comfortable. The only downside is lighting in the very dim lighting in the room due to the scarcity of fixtures and less than adequate wattage--perhaps to capture the feeling of candlelight! This property provides great access to the 91
Manager Response: Dear Jerry B.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay with us. I truly appreciate your warm compliments concerning our team members, décor, and convenient access to the freeway. I would like to apologize for the lighting in your accommodations and assure you that we do our best to light our guest rooms optimally with an array of fixtures. Thank you for your review and we would be thrilled to welcome you again.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Our experience was great here. Room was very nice and clean, pool was fun for the kids, and the breakfast was one of the best I have had in a hotel. Very quite as well and the front desk were very friendly. This was the second time our softball team has stayed here and we all agreed we would love to stay here again.

We stayed here with 11 other familes for a softball tournament and the rooms were spacious and clean. Breakfast tasted great and there was a good variety. We loved the close restaurants and having a sprouts down the street. The only issue we had is the ice makers weren't working on our floor and we had to find another one. Other than that our stay was good and we would definitely stay again.

Excellent room, good breakfast, clean bathroom and room, people very nice and the bed is awesome. They have pool and fitting room, but I did not use it. The only problem is the long distance to LA (approx 1 drive hour to hollywood and Santa Monic, if there is no traffic).

Summary Heading: My buisness trip to Anahiem, CA.
Summary: I would suggest this place for a stay, wheather be buisness or family trip.  The place is very rightly located with plenty of good eatries arround, shopping options and very well connected to rest part of the city.  The staff and services are very excellent.

What a surprise!  This hotel was stunningly beautiful, meticulously clean and relaxing.  The hotel is decorated with reproduction masterpiece art and a timeless look.  The room was very large well appointed.  We stayed 3-days and didn't want to leave. Very classy for a hotel in Yorba Linda!  Thank you for making everything so enjoyable!

I always stay here when I am in Orange County. Just can not find a better place! They are remodelling and even with that, had a great stay. Close to everything and set in the hills so it is quiet too!

This hotel was recommended for wedding guests as being close to the reception site. The rate was so reasonable, I was a bit suspicious about how nice the room would be. What a pleasant surprise! It was big, had a couch and coffee table, and a bar/kitchenette, as well. Even though there is some remodeling going on, my stay was very pleasant.  The staff was efficient and friendly, too.

Every quarter i need to travel to Yorba Linda for Business purpose & its the best hotel to stay.. clean, good ambiance, yummy breakfast & near to my office.. are couple of reasons for me putting up here...

Yorba Linda 5 minutes from near Richard Nixon Library. Visiting from Canada and had repeated problems establishing my Wi-Fi. Each girl on the front desk patiently re-set it and couldn't be more helpful. Hospitality hour was incredible with free refreshments and snacks. The rooms were spotless and it was our pleasure to leave the maid a generous gratuity each day!!

Not our first time at Ayers and definitely not our last. Ayers properties are top notch. Clean and comfortable. Also like the fact that on the beds are REAL SIZE pillows not the "miniature marshmallows" other hotels provide.The things travelers are looking for. Not to mention staff has always been so very nice. K.C. checked us in and she was personality plus! My only complaint was the T.V. had been made so "source" couldn't be changed so we couldn't us our portable d.v.d. player and watch movies we brought BUT that does not reflect on our stay we'll just bring games next time :-) Sure wish there was an Ayers in Pasadena (hint hint hint). I always look for Ayers first when in the Los Angeles area.
Manager Response: Dear Dianna B,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda as your home away from home recently. I am delighted to read that we have made such an impression on you with our lux accommodations and world-class service. You might try visiting either location in Manhattan Beach or Diamond Bar next time, though we would love to be the ones to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel and very accomidating staff.
Summary: Our room was on the 3rd floor.  It was quiet and restful despite the fact the hotel seemed full of guests.  Beautifully decorated room and very comfortable bed.  We liked having a refrigerator as we took our own lunch to the event we attended.
Manager Response: Dear Janeen C.,  I am contented to see that you were able to have a restful sleep. Our exceptional accommodations certainly set us apart from our competition and I am happy to see that you agree. Come back soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Good hotel in a decent location.  My room was big and the bed was extremely comfortable.    Check in staff could have been a bit more friendly.  Young lady might want to consider a change of career - to one that does not involve interaction with members of the public.  Only other criticism is that although overall cleanliness standards were good, the carpets and tiled areas could do with a deep clean.  Made the mistake of walking barefoot in my room and literally had to scrub the dirt off.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for choosing our hotel and for reviewing your stay for fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am glad you enjoyed your stay and would like to thank you for bringing the floors in your room to my attention. This is not typical of our hotel and I do apologize for this inconsistency. Thank you again for your review and rating.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: When we are in town to visit  family we choose to stay here. Everything about this hotel is top notch. The rooms are large and exceptionally clean. The breakfast is superior to many other continental breakfasts. The pool area and courtyard are beautiful.
Manager Response: Dear Deb C.,  Thank you for your outstanding rating and review of Ayres Suites Yorba Linda. I am glad you were able to stay with us during your family visit and that everything was to your liking. I do hope to welcome you back again soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Not a pleasure stay, however, a very pleasant stay.
Summary: We had to be out of our home from Sunday thru Tuesday for plumbing repairs.  Because we had had such pleasant  experiences on previous stays at the Ayres Suites in Yorba Linda, we didn't hesitate to book our stay there.  As on previous stays, we were not disapointed.  Our room was clean and quite, the breakfast was always good, and the staff was always cheerful and helpful.  Would we stay there again?  You Bet!

Rooms are large and comfortable. Towels are adult-sized and soft. Staff are knowledgable and helpful.A missing lightbulb was replaced quickly. Breakfast is delicious with a variety of hot and cold offerings.

Summary Heading: If I could give them a zero, I would
Summary: All the things done right, count little when they fail to give you the wake up call.     Room 201 , called the male on the desk between 10 pm and 11 pm  FEB. 6  for a wake up call for 6:30.   Clearly tells me it's all set.    Well, it wasn't set and I did not get the call  On Feb 7,  I told James at the front desk, I did not get the wake up call,  and When checking out, I told the 2 young  ladies at the front desk about the missed call..  All were sorry,  but that doesn't help.  Great corporate slogans mean little when your staff fail to follow through.  I wonder if they reported it to management liked I asked them to, or will this be the first they hear of it.

Looking for an incredible, elegant, formal and affordable stay for you and/or your family? The search should end with Ayres. Friendly staff and spacious, gorgeous rooms. Ayres is, "crème de la crème"!!  Big Wave Dave/David James Fish-KKLA radio
Manager Response: Dear BigWaveDaveFishLA,  Thank you so much for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and for taking the time to write us such an outstanding review. Our team is humbled by your kind compliments, as am I. We truly love all feedback but especially positive feedback such as your own. Please come see us again soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: For the price this cant be beat. The Breakfast is really good, Cooked in front of you, (Not like the powdered eggs and stale bagels at typical hotel in this price range). Room very clean, employees very friendly and professional. Great service!!  I recommend to anyone !

Though we had a late/early check in and very tired (New Years) haha! The front desk clerk was very proper and courteous. The rooms were spacious, clean and tidy. Beds were comfy, not to hard, not to soft. Great breakfast with real food! Haha! I mean the food was very good. Location was a big plus too! Our overall experience was above great. Though one post stated it was a "bit older," which may be true, this building is kept up and and in very good shape! They also mentioned it was a "bit pricier," I thought it was perfectly priced and with a free breakfast, who can complain.   We will be back! I just wish they had more locations!
Manager Response: Dear Derick M.,  Your excellent review is much appreciated by our entire team. It is always a pleasure to read when our guests are happy with our caring and professional service. I am equally delighted to read that you were able to taste our exclusive complimentary breakfast. Again​, thank you for your glowing review. We certainly hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: A Very Nice Place to Stay
Summary: We always stay at his hotel when visiting nearby family and are always pleased with the clean, comfortable accommodations; most recently we were fortunate to get an extra large room (#331).  The staff is very friendly and helpful, the place is always clean and well decorated, and the included breakfast buffet is a very nice plus, too.
Manager Response: Dear El_Suertudo,  Thank you kindly for your warm compliments regarding our exceptional team and accommodations! Our team works with our guest's comfort in mind and I am pleased to see you experienced the renowned service we are known for. I hope we will be seeing you again soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: bit on the older side, bit on the pricier side, but overall great stay
Summary: Yes, this hotel seems a bit on the older side, but the rooms are still comfortable and outfitted really well. I stayed in a king suite that came with a spacious "living room" outfitted with a mini fridge and microwave as well. The bathroom was clean, but a bit cramped.   The hotel itself is located on a little hill above the area, so the views are decent. The strip mall lower down the hill contains a variety of shops and dining places within walking distance.

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel for us and our wedding guests
Summary: We had a lot of out of town guests come in for our wedding and the rooms and staff were excellent. Every concern we had or request we made was accommodated quickly and professionally. We'd highly recommend Ayres Suites in Yorba Linda

Very happy staying here recently!!! Priceline picked this hotel for us, after a long fun day at Knott's Berry Farm, it was really nice winding down at this hotel. The front staff was very nice and friendly. The room was Huge! And having the jets in the bathtub, made it even better!!!! Pillows and bed were very comfortable, plenty of hot water, great water pressure, easy to find from the highway, we did not hear any freeway noise!!! Nice to have a fridge and microwave in the room, I wish more hotels would offer this. Parking is free as well is the Wi-Fi, which had pretty good speed. The free breakfast was the only let down, as it is very bland food, but there is a McDonalds close by for some good hotcakes!. I would stay here again, we had a very good nights rest and it was a nice

The front desk personnel are very unfriendly. Rooms are terribly outdated and the carpet is probably horse hair from the 1920's. It has the potential to be an outstanding hotel but it is not and probably hasn't been for a long time. The breakfast is the same thing everyday and poorly offered. The Pizza's from Costco down the street would be tastier than this breakfast. Actually on my last day i went to McDonalds. My room had a jacuzzi from the 80"s and when the room next to me turned it on at 7am, it was as if it was running in my room. THE ONLY THING THIS POOR EXCUSE FOR A HOTEL HAS GOING FOR IT IS THE LOCATION, LOCATION , LOCATION.
Manager Response: Dear Antonia C.,  I am deeply sorry that our hotel did not meet your expectations. Our team works diligently to ensure that your stay is comfortable and clean. I am saddened that the service you received did not meet yours, nor our own standards. We would like to thank you for your comments as they help us to improve our hotel. We do hope you give our hotel another chance in the future.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: This was an emergency visit for my best friends funeral and they were great'
Summary: I have stayed at the Ayres chain in Anaheim several times and for this trip I needed to be in the Yorba Linda area for a funeral. Check in was super simple along with check out. I stayed for two nights and while I was at the hotel I completely forgot why I was in the area. Thank you for helping make a comfortable situation out of a bad one.
Manager Response: Dear Tim W.,  We always love hearing from our loyal guests! The review you left was very kind and we would like to thank you for letting us know we are meeting your expectations as a hotel. We do hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Great location, nice and quiet, right off interstate. We read about it on Trip Advisor and I was concerned that the rooms couldn't be as huge as claimed. But the reviewers were right on! Probably the biggest room I've ever stayed in. It could have been made into a two-room suite. And this was an average room. Only problem was that the bathroom was so far away from the bed that it was a major trip in the middle of the night! Quality all the way around.

Summary Heading: Easy Access to Hwy 91, Near Costco with Gas, Several Eateries
Summary: This hotel is aging gracefully, not a bad place to stay at all.  I would say it would be better for work than a vacation stay with free WIFI, small reefer, micro and kitchen sink. The marble table in the room had a dirty top from a messy guest, but to be fair, you had to see it reflected in the window light to see it.  No ice on first floor.  Check in/check out was quick and easy.  Plenty of good, free parking.

The room was beautifully decorated in an antique look. It was clean, spacious, comfortable bed, large jetted tub, microwave, mini fridge, a wet bar and free wifi. However, the wifi only lasts about an hour. The staff are friendly, courteous, helpful and professional. Has a full complimentary breakfast also.

I have always enjoyed staying at the Yorba Linda Ayres  Hotel.  But this time I was very disappointed  .     The T.V wasn't  called to let them know they sent a front desk girl that did Nothing .   When I had checked in I had asked the front desk girl at the time named Stephanie if I  could have a plate 2 bowls and some spoon brought up to my room . Will we never got them . So we didn't have our romantic dessert.    When it was time to check out I had told another front desk girl now that makes 3 we had deal with all she said was oh sorry I'll tell my manager  . They Could at less take something off the room .   I was very very disappointed
Manager Response: Dear Sophia,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review concerning your recent experience at our hotel. I am saddened to read about the lapse in exceptional service during your stay. I certainly emphathize with your frustration regarding this isolated incident but do hope you consider staying with us again. Nevertheless, thank you for your candid review.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: My initial impression of this hotel was good, but things went downhill from there.  For starters, like many travelers, I used a 3rd party site to book my room, we were two adults traveling together, but not sleeping in one bed.  I have used 3rd party sites A LOT, this was the first time the hotel would not accommodate us with 2 actual beds.  We got one bed and one sofa, and we had to request bedding for the sofa.  The temperature of the room was way off, either hot or cold, not in between, and the ceiling fan did not work.  As we settled into the room, the electric circuit breaker blew, leaving us with no power, so again we had to contact the front desk to get this resolved.  To make matters worse, the staff we dealt with were anything but pleasant.  I don't see myself returning
Manager Response: Dear Denise,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your recent experience. Please accept my most sincere apologies for the inconvenience with your bedding. Our bed accommodations are based on the availability of our rooms. For our king suites, we typically offer a pull out sofa sleeper to accommodate additional guests. Our front desk team is always more than happy to help with additional bedding or getting your sofa sleeper made up. Concerning the service, or lack thereof, that you received, please know that this is unlike our team. Your review has served as a training platform to ensure we are providing only the highest level of guest service to each of our guests. Again, thank you for your honest review.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Providing calm in the midst of the storm.
Summary: As the purpose of our stay was for a funeral,  the overall ambience of the hotel lent itself to a quieter more reflective stay.  The cleanliness of the rooms and comfort of the beds helped to provide the needed rest we hoped for.  We commend the entire staff for their efforts to make our stay most enjoyable.  The Physical Fitness room was one of the best in quality and cleanliness.

We came here for a family wedding.  There was plenty of room for my family of 5 to stay in the room.  There was an extra sink and mirror which helped when we were all getting ready for the wedding.  Our room #312 overlooked the pool and rolling hills.  The bathroom was large and split into two separate sections (toilet/shower and sink/mirror). The breakfast buffet was quite a spread and the room was very large.  There are also tables outside to enjoy the CA sun.  The pool area was important for us because we have children.  This area was clean and safe. The staff was friendly and willing to help.  We needed a pair of scissors at one point and some bandaids at another.  They were also willing to give suggestions for driving and recommend places to visit and restaurants.  We were

I came here for a business trip and it sure was pleasant.  The service was excellent , the staff was very nice and willing to help out with any needs, questions and concerns.  The shuttle service was very convenient and the drivers nice and polite. My room was big and spacious the whirl pool was very relaxing.

If you must travel the Southern California freeways this is the place.  The hotel is modern, clean and most important with spacious elegant rooms.   Everything here is more than expected.  Large lobby,  pool, huge rooms with microwave and refrigerator. Excellent comp breakfast.

Summary Heading: What can I say? Peaceful, lovely, clean, relaxing, beautiful property with excellent staff!
Summary: I travel a LOT! And, I have my favorite properties. This IS ONE OF THEM. If I have to be in OC Metro or even outlying I will always stay HERE. This property is so clean and beautiful and located perfectly and the staff are so friendly and excellent. It's like home. The lobby/living room area is so beautiful and welcoming I actually took a picture of it so I could stare at it when I was stuck in an ugly place. The guests are peaceful and clean, highly business oriented. The breakfast is excellent, and on a beautiful clear day the pool area has a view of the Orange County hills that is so delightful. I can't wait to stay here again. I love it!

The Ayres is beautifully decorated. The rooms are large and very comfortable. The bridal suite was perfect for my daughter and her bridesmaids to get ready in. The waffles at breakfast were delicious! Would definitely stay there again!

Convenient location, good breakfast with varied options, lovely decor, friendly staff, clean. A good value.  My only suggestion would be for better lighting to put on makeup.  I would stay again and recommend.

Summary Heading: Best value, best rooms and best staff!
Summary: Beautiful and clean property. Quiet, spacious and comfortable rooms. Free hot breakfast and nightly social hour make you feel at home and add a lot of value for your money. Jetted bathtubs, HDTV with a clear picture and several channels to choose from, refrigerator, microwave and wet bar are nice touches. Staff is very accommodating and always have a smile on their face. This is the second time we stayed at this location, and plan to make it our destination for future travels to this area of California.

We slept so good in the beds, the down comforter and the pillows were so cozy and comfortable.  The room was clean and roomy.  The breakfast provided by the hotel was a hot breakfast of scrambled eggs, sausage, pancakes, hash browns, and waffles.  The staff was super friendly and helpful.

This is a good spot.  Nothing flashy.  Very Solid.  A couple of nice perks.   The young lady (Maria?) behind the counter took me to pick up some dinner one night.  She spoke highly of the company -- seems to treat the employees well.

Summary Heading: Comfortable, beautiful, friendly staff, and great value!
Summary: My husband and I recently got married and we chose Ayres Suites to host our out of town guests during the weekend of our wedding.  My husband and I also booked this hotel to be close to our wedding venue, which is at the Richard Nixon Library & Museum. Ayres Suites is conveniently less than 10 minutes to Richard Nixon and still within good distance to many attractions in Orange County.  We couldn't be any happier with the staff. They're all so friendly and accommodating. The rooms are so spacious and comfortable. The rooms are also nicely furnished and clean and our guests really enjoyed their stay very much.
