They all complimented how beautiful this hotel is.  We love the complimentary breakfast buffet that is located downstairs in the mornings. They have a selection of

Summary Heading: Good for our purpose of a family event nearby.
Summary: Overall adequate for our occasion.  Near to the place for our event.  Clean & comfortable room.  Breakfast was good and served the purpose.  The staff were helpful and friendly.  Overall had a pleasant time.

The room was clean and nicely furnished. The beds were comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast offerings were tasty and there was a good selection. The whirlpool tub was a nice surprise.

Great, friendly staff! Breakfast had lots of options, my 4 kids loved it!  We stayed for 2 nights while going to Disneyland, only about 15 minute drive to the park.  Rooms were very nicely appointed and very spacious!  Definitely will keep this on the top of this for our next stay!

Was great! The bed mattress was so comfortable was difficult to get out of bed and attend meeting nearby. The breakfast was great and tasty. Everyone was so friendly and check in was a breeze. It was like staying with best friends! I will be back!

Our youth soccer team recently stayed at Ayres over the weekend for a soccer tournament. All our team members and parents were pleased during our entire stay. The staff is impecable in every aspect. The rooms are beautiful, spacious and clean. The free breakfast was delicious with lots of fresh foods,  not your typical continental breakfast. Overall I would recommend Ayres to everyone! My first choice for now on when choosing a place to stay during any outing :-D

We stayed at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda last weekend for a short visit to the area and found the hotel to be one of great value.  I requested during booking for a quiet, upstairs room facing away from the freeway and that was exactly what we got.  The room was clean and spacious, and, most of all, had great sound insulation which enabled us to have a very good night of sleep.  We did not hear the street or neighbors or the blasting ACs.  The complimentary breakfast buffet was good.  it has a reasonable variety of food including (real) scrambled eggs, sausages, fresh fruits, and several types of pastries/bread.  The hotel was easily accessible.  All these for $120 for a Saturday night (including tax and fees) and we thought it was a great value.  The only thing that could be better

Hotel is great very clean good breakfast the only thing I did not like is you could not take the stairs from one floor to the next. Staff was very professional and friendly. Grounds were very clean and close to restaurants and fast food. Right off freeway so easy to find as well.

Summary Heading: A Hotel retreat while doing business in the OC.
Summary: Great OC location, clean comfortable rooms, great bed, private pool facing the hillside landscape, a beautiful Lobby to meet clients and gathering with you associates, and a happy snack hour that beats any hotel in the area. Worth every penny to stay in this awesome Ayres Hotel and Inn.

We were afraid to try this non big name brand hotel because we've been disappointed in others. Boy were we pleasantly surprised!!! The rooms are spacious and CLEAN! The breakfast is delicious and there are many items to choose from. All good. We saw people enjoying the pool though we didn't try it ourselves. The evening chocolate chip cookies were awesome. All in all a great SoCal hotel!

Summary Heading: Stayed 10 days and was happy to come "home" each night!
Summary: Large comfortable rooms, good beds, quiet, clean. Excellent breakfast with scratch cooked food. Good value, no extra add ons for parking or internet. Excellent air conditioning on 98 degree days. No complaints!
Manager Response: Dear westseattlefoodie,  Thank you for writing a review of our hotel on TripAdvisor. We truly appreciate your feedback regarding your recent stay. We appreciate your kind compliments regarding our comfortable and luxurious accommodations. We thank you again for your review of our hotel and we hope to see you again in the near future.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: *My son and I had a relaxing stay here after many games of water polo.  The jetted tub was a highlight of the room. *My 13 year old loved having his own large bed to himself. *The continental breakfast the next day was a welcome surprise and much needed to replenish his belly. *We enjoyed the El Torito Restaurant next door for dinner.  Nearby are several restaurants including Chick-fil-A as well as a Sprouts grocery store to restock healthy snacks.

The hotel staff were very helpful and polite. I can only day good things about my experience and I hope to return there soon. The only issue is I think the pool could be somewhat bigger, to accommodate the amount of people/kids staying there.
Manager Response: Dear Janie G.,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and for your time in writing a review concerning your recent stay with us! We deeply appreciate your positive feedback and suggestions. We hope to see you in the near future!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The location was perfect to have as base when doing some sightseeing after work. The location of the hotel was not far from our plant, so I could combine business with some sightseeing after work. The breakfast was ok, would do have the possibility too choose some fibers as cereal (for example, bran-flakes). Both overall the breakfast was to my satisfactory. The gym and pool was just enough and the cookies served at the afternoon at the reception was delicious.

I stayed in this hotel because I had research to do at the Nixon Presidential Library. It was a 10 minute drive there from the hotel and I was able to arrange a shuttle from the hotel to the library, which was a bonus. They have a full, hot breakfast with lots of options. The rooms are spacious (we had a king room). I also used the fitness center, which was clean and offered options (weights and different exercise machines). It had an outdoor pool, but didn't get around to using it. The hotel also offers a "happy hour" to its guests in the form of a light snack and usually beer, which we found to be a nice touch. This hotel is located in the suburbs so there's not much going on and not really walkable to other places (there is a Mexican restaurant right next door, though). Great

Summary Heading: Room With a View of a Wall
Summary: Our room was located on the 2nd floor, in the front of the hotel, near the center, and we had a view of a wall!  So the view was disappointing.  However, it was nice and dark at night!  We had problems one night with a loud group of teenage girls in the room next to us, requiring us to call and complain about the noise at 11:20 p.m.  This revealed that the walls were thin.  Other than that, no complaints.  We were there for a wedding, and the location was convenient for all the events we had to attend for the wedding.  We enjoyed the hot breakfasts and enjoyed the workout room and pool.
Manager Response: Dear Jane S.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor regarding your recent stay with us. Please accept my most sincere apologies for the noise which occurred during your stay. I am glad to see that you enjoyed the full American breakfast, our relaxing pool, as well as our fitness center. Thank you again for your review. We certainly hope to see you again in the near future!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: The Ayres Suite was perfect for the wedding party
Summary: We visited Yorba Linda for a wedding last weekend & a bunch of us stayed at the Ayres Suites.  It was great!  The hotel is very nice & super comfortable.  Plus the staff is super.  I'd stay there again, for sure.  Tom G Atlanta, GA

Summary Heading: Ayres a lot of noise here
Summary: We stayed overnight because we were going to a baby shower the next day.  We thought this was going to be a lot better than it was.  It looks ok from the outside, but when  you get to the room it's nothing special.  The bed was not comfortable and there was a lot of noise coming in from the halls and outside.  Children in the halls talking loud and also playing in the pool and screaming until10 that night.  Of course we weren't far from the pool, but it would have been nice if they got out earlier.  It wasn't real inexpensive either.  You are definitely not going to have a fun couples night there because you feel like everyone is in your room with you...  When we were waiting to get a receipt in the morning the girl at the desk ignored us and then helped someone who just walked
Manager Response: Dear Heat31,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor regarding your recent stay with us. Your feedback is vitally important to us as we always strive to meet all of our guests' expectations. Please accept my most sincere apologies for the inconsistencies that occurred during your stay. I regret that your time at our property was not enjoyable and even uncomfortable. I certainly empathize with your frustration. We hope to be given a chance to redeem our name with you in the future.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: I used to live in Y.L. and stayed here on a trip back. The hotel is in Savi Ranch, a big shopping and dining location next to the 91 freeway. Yorba Linda is an upscale town known for little except the Nixon Library (worth a visit). The hotel turns out to be excellent. I have always favored Ayres Inns and Suites given the opportunity but this one is outstanding. In brief, a large and comfortable lobby, beautifully appointed rooms, excellent service from the staff, good complimentary breakfast, clean as a pin. The kind of atmosphere you could find in the old downtown grand hotels at a vastly cheaper price. Don't ask for room service or a shoe shine though.  I stayed during the week when the customer traffic is much quieter, a little more rowdy at the weekend. I would go back there
Manager Response: Dear Bob B.,  Thank you for your generous compliments regarding your recent stay at our hotel. We strive each day to provide the best stay possible for all of our guests and are delighted that we were able to exceed your expectations regarding the our world class rooms and our team members. We look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: We have stayed here many times.  Always a clean, quiet room...perfect for winding down after a busy day.  Prices are reasonable and the complimentary breakfast is pretty good also!  Location is very close to the 91 and easy to access Orange County's attractions.

It was a little more than we wanted to spend so I gave it 4 stars. Nothing wrong with the room. Nice comfy bed great pillows. Bathroom had a jetted tub- cool. Thank goodness they provided breakfast and a pretty darn good one at that. More choices than some places; French toast , waffles, fresh hot eggs and salsa.  Convenient location just off the 91

Was hoping to take advantage of more of its amenities, such as the fitness room and pool, but not enough time. Staff was courteous and helpful. No linen was provided in the room for the sleeper sofa, but easily remedied. Next day, no washcloths or coffee in room; desk clerk alone and we were in a hurry, do we had to do without. Breakfast delicious assortment. Great decor in lobby, hallways, rooms, even elevator. Quiet, in spite of being near elevator and laundry room on second floor. Vending machine pricier than most. Convenient fridge and microwave. Crummy cable options and no menu access. Wi-Fi.

Summary Heading: Was good for one night stay
Summary: We were going to Beverly Hills and on a way stayed one night at these suites. Totally it's ok. Amazing view, ok free breakfast, nice bed, big room. I am not a designer , but I didn't like the round stone tables between wooden chairs. Also coffee machine wasn't good quality. And some dust on window. But totally ok. Thanks .
Manager Response: Dear Mauigirl86,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor informing others about your recent experience. I am disappointed to see that your expectations regarding the coffee maker in the room and the cleanliness of the window. We are, however, delighted to read that you enjoyed our overall accommodations. Thank you again for your feedback as it is vital for our continued improvements!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Unpleasant stay, Hot room, Unmade sleeper sofa, sticky floors
Summary: I booked a King suite for myself and my two daughters.  When we arrived around 6:30 in the evening we were given a the key cards to room 317.  We entered the room and were hit with a wave of hot air.  It was 100 degrees outside and the cooler was not on in our room.  It was miserable.  Then, though we had 3 people on our reservation, and the pullout sofa had to be used, it was not made up.  When I called the front desk and asked for someone to come up and make up the bed for us, I was told that she would bring up the bedding but that we had to make the bed ourselves.  When I pay $160 a night for a hotel, I really expect the room to be made up and cool when I arrive.   Also, the floors in the bathroom and in front of the sink were very tacky and sticky.  Everytime we walked on
Manager Response: Dear TchrDodd,  Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay with us for fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We are disappointed to read that several inconsistencies occurred during your stay and that your expectations were not met. Please do know that I have spoken with the front desk team so as not to have this occur again in the future. We certainly hope to redeem our name with you in the future. Thank you again for allowing us the opportunity to serve you.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: I love the classic decor and the comfortable rooms, and we had a pretty good stay for the price, however, there are no roll-away beds (we were traveling with children and needed a roll-away bed for one).  The hotel is called "Ayers Suites" so we thought that we could, at least, get a couch that converted into a bed in the room. The front desk staff were fairly professional, but did not make us feel very welcome.  Kind of disappointing-won't stay again.
Manager Response: Dear A K,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor informing others about your recent experience at our hotel. I am disappointed to see that your expectations regarding the lack of additional beds and service were not met. We are, however, delighted to read that you enjoyed our overall accommodations. Thank you again for your feedback as it is vitally important to us.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: A friend told us about this family owned hotel chain, and we have stayed exclusively with Ayres anytime we are in California. The Yorba Linda hotel has very comfortable and roomy suites which offers refrigerators and a microwave,convenient for keeping drinks and snacks cold. The breakfast is very generous with many options to choose from. The pool was enjoyable when a few adults sat around, but with a family of 4 children in the pool, it was a bit crowded. The staff are very professional and helpful and appear to really enjoy their work. I would recommend Ayres to all my friends.

We were pleasantly surprised by the hotel atmosphere and decor. The room was large and well equipped, the bed was very comfortable, everything worked well, including the shower, a/c, fridge, hair dryer, and coffeemaker. Breakfast was hot, tasty, and plentiful. Decor is English country, so quite unusual for California. A very welcoming lobby area and a lovely outdoor pool and jacuzzi. Do be aware this hotel does not welcome pets. If you reserve through a partner service, it may say pets are allowed, but they aren't. It's an error they are planning to correct. We definitely would stay here again if the family pet isn't with us. It's near lots of restaurants and some shopping in an upscale residential area near the 91 (but isn't noisy at all).
Manager Response: Dear miznovember,  Thank you for your kind compliments regarding our signature boutique décor. I am delighted to see that you enjoyed our complimentary full American breakfast buffet. Our team members work diligently to ensure that each guest has a memorable and enjoyable stay and I am thrilled to see that they went above and beyond! Thank you for your recommendation and we hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: We stay here when we visit family in Yorba Linda.  I love it because the rooms are so spacious and super clean and staff is friendly.  We haven't eaten there so I can not comment on breakfast and/or any other amenities the hotel has to offer.  But I do like going to the Mexican restaurant next door for cocktails, and you don't have to worry about driving home.  Now have another family member staying there as well when we go for our family reunions and they love it too.

Summary Heading: I keep coming back to this hotel, for both, business and leisure
Summary: This hotel is conveniently located more or less in the heart of Orange County, with easy access to major highways. Hotel condition is great and staff very friendly. Breakfast gets a little crowded but the hotel as opened an adjacent room.

We needed a place for family from out-of-town for a night. Felt bad not having room for them here in our home so wanted to be sure they were in more than satisfying accommodations. they were impressed and very happy with their night. I'll use this facility again...

Summary Heading: Nice decor, Friendly Staff, Nice Breakfast
Summary: We arrived on Friday of Memorial Day weekend.  We were welcomed by a friendly smiling face.  Our check-in was fast and we were asked if we need info about the area.  We politely declined as we had lived in OC most of our lives.  We were there for  an 80th birthday party of a dear friend.  The room was spacious and clean.  The AC was quiet.  The bed was comfortable.   Even though there was girl's softball teams there for playoffs.  We never heard them in our room.    A very good stay

I stayed here for one night during a business trip in May 2015.  This was my first time staying at a Ayers Suites, and this chain is now one of my top 3 hotel chains.  The hotel is located just off the 91 freeway, and is right next door to El Toritos Restaurant and the Palms Bar and Grill.  Just down the hill is a Denny's, McDonalds, Taco Bell, Chick-fil-A, and gas stations.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful, and made you feel welcomed.  The hotel has a lot of no-cost extras;  they have a managers reception, which is pretty basic.  They have beer and wine, a hot dish (Meatballs when I was there) and chips. The also provide a breakfast, which is pretty good.  They served; scrambled eggs, breakfast meats, potatoes, waffle maker, breads/pastries, fruit, yogurt, juice,

Everything about our stay here was great. We had very friendly young women who checked us in and gave us information on the area. Our room was surprisingly large and everything was comfortable. We liked the decor with embossed wallpaper, chair rails, big bedstead and leather couch. The room had a small area with refrigerator and microwave built in and a bar sink. Bed was super comfortable. Everything spotless.  Surprise; happy hour from 5 to 7 with free beer, wine and munchies. Surprise: large selection at breakfast with real china and flatware and a woman making French toast right there with good warm items as well as cold. Fresh fruit galore and good coffee.  We also appreciated the washing machine and dryer at $1.50 a load (and all were spotless and worked well).  Did not
Manager Response: Dear Torte_Sue,  Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda! We sincerely appreciate your kind compliments regarding the front desk team as well as the décor of your room. Thank you again for the kind compliments and we certainly look forward to serving you again in the near future!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The hotel has a welcoming lobby, and clean, spacious rooms. It has a pleasant pool area in the rear of the property. The staff was friendly and helpful. Monday through Thursday they had "happy hour" refreshments and evening cookies for guests. There is a breakfast buffet daily. It seemed very suitable for business travelers and meetings, as well as housing out-of-town visitors.

Summary Heading: Great price.  Nice room.  Friendly staff.  Good breakfast.
Summary: The rooms were large, clean, and had plenty of room (they are suites after all).  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was not amazing but better than most, if not all, other breakfast buffets included with a hotel.  Amazing bang for the buck.
Manager Response: Dear Austin J.,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and for taking the time to review your recent stay! I appreciate your kind compliments regarding our friendly and professional team as well as our luxurious accommodations. Thank you for your glowing feedback regarding our complimentary full American breakfast. We are truly honored to be held in such a high regard to you. We look forward to serving you when you return to the area!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The hotel was nice. Close to many things. The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were clean enough.  The carpets need a good cleaning and the tub did backed up when showereing but it wasn't horrible at all.  Breakfasts were excellent.  I would recommend this hotel.  I will stay here again on my next visit.

Summary Heading: Decent value hotel - adding warmth could dramatically improve it
Summary: So many hotel operators forget the basic concept -  hospitality.  I arrived with family in tow - we were extending a business conference to take our son to Disneyland and looked for a quiet place to stay that would not bust the budget - but would allow us to work (we run a small biz) and take the kid to Disneyland for a day or two. We found the hotels promise, directly from page one of their website "Guests of our family owned and operated hotel will discover luxury studios and suites," Since our reservation specified SUITE we assumed that's what we'd have for our Sunday and Monday night stay.  In fact, we got a studio.  Or, as is honestly referred to as a "junior suite"  ie - one room with a pull out couch off to the side.  I made a polite inquiry on check in -  I explained

Last month, I stayed here for my business trip for 8 nights. EXCELLENT Service!  Staffs are friendly and helpful. They provided a driver who kindly drives me to the office every morning.  When I needed to send a package, I asked the front office and they indicated the direction of the road. But when they knew I don't have a car, they made an offer to take me there, even waited for me and brought me back to the hotel. They also had  washing machines on 2nd floor, right next to the elevator, if you want to do  laundry by yourself.  On late afternoons, from 5 to 7 p.m, they had a happy hour. In the lobby, they provded snacks, food, drinks (beer and wine), just for hotel guests for free.  I really enjoyed sitting in the lobby while talking with the other guests. After 7  p.m, I can

Room was wallpapered, bath tub was amazing...in fact a true retreat after a stressful day. Our room did not have any moisture. The best thing about the hotel was that breakfast, parking and internet were included in the hotel rate. They served continental breakfast with adequate variety. If you like dewy grass in the morning, this is not the best place for you since it is near the highway in a commercial area. The manager was not very friendly but she allowed for a late check-out for one hour.
Manager Response: Dear gnzm,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. I apologize on behalf of our entire management team for the lack of guest service. This is certainly uncharacteristic and we will be working to improve guest interaction moving forward as this is of the utmost importance to our team at Ayres Hotels. Your feedback is deeply appreciated. We are, however, delighted to read that you enjoyed our accommodations, signature full American breakfast, as well as our tranquil courtyard area. In regards to your comments about the decor and restroom, we will absolutely keep your comments in mind when we are renovating again. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to see you return whenever you are in the area!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: I love Ayres Suites in Yorba Linda!!!!!
Summary: My friends and I stated at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda during the 3/20/15 weekend and.....we soon enjoyed our stay as always. The room was spacious,  the jetted tub- amazing,  and the breakfast buffet - simply delicious!!! I  can't wait for our next girls weekend, where we'll definitely spend it at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda!!

Summary Heading: Perfect mix of family and business
Summary: Like a Hilton family that didn't quite grow up. Good vibe, clean, great staff and a light-handed approach to management. If you are a serious A-type, find some other place. This place (Yorba Linda location) has a perfect balance of cozy and business. I come down from SF for work semi-regularly and I always stay here. The rooms are spacious and updated enough. They could almost use an upgrade but they have a few years left. It would be nice if something other than El Torito was next door but if you have a car, no worries. I haven't used their room service but you do get a blue collar happy hour and warm cookies in the lobby.

The room was beautiful had a mircowave and refrigator.  Had a leather couch and looked good lots of TV channels.  Only bad thing was a Air Conditioner which had no therostat and which continued to turn on and off and I had to turn it off to be able to sleep.
Manager Response: Dear Roger F.,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor as your feedback is deeply appreciated. We are delighted to read that you enjoyed our luxurious room accommodations. We will absolutely keep your comments in mind, regarding our air conditioning, when we are renovating again. Thank you again for your honest feedback.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The affluent, well-manicured community of Yorba Linda, in North Orange County, CA, calls itself "The Land of Gracious Living." It's also "The Land of Few Hotels," which is interesting for a town just a mouse's throw away from Disneyland and a doable drive to the beach. So my husband and I, along with a business associate, had very few choices when business brought us to this inviting corner of the OC. Our business contact in town suggested the Ayres, and overall we found the hotel, part of a family-run chain in SoCal, cordial and comfortable. Staff are uniformly friendly and helpful; it does not feel cold and corporate. Neither does the decor, which, as others have pointed out, is dated, and not in a retro/ironic way, but in a fussy, grandma-with-bad-taste way. (Think rows of
Manager Response: Dear Elizabeth103,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. Your feedback is deeply appreciated. We are delighted to read that you enjoyed the room, breakfast, and our patio area. In regards to your comments about the decor and bathroom, we will absolutely keep your comments in mind when we are renovating again. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to see you return whenever you are in the area next!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: I stayed here 4 nights on business. It was convenient-walkable to my worksite, although there is no sidewalk on the semicircle road the hotel is on. The room was spacious and clean; bed was too firm for me but pillows were comfy. The decor is a bit outdated but the tv, lighting, desk area all met my needs. Liked the small microwave and fridge. Pool was shaded by the building and cold, hot tub was clean and hot and relaxing. The buffet breakfast was very good, better than most. The managers reception is a nice thought but kind of sad, there's a bucket of cold beers and really bad wine, and chips or something. The hotel was sold out, maybe that's why I was told the first day that the free local shuttle was going to be busy most of the time I was there. I took it to see a movie
Manager Response: Dear Laura287,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to share about your recent experience at our hotel. Your feedback is greatly appreciated as it helps us to better serve our guests in the future. While we were glad you enjoyed our luxurious accommodations, please accept my most sincere apologies for your stay being anything less than remarkable. We are deeply saddened to read about the inconveniences you experienced and thank you for bringing them to our attention.Thank you again for your candid review and we hope to see you in the near future!  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: This location has an old world feel to it particularly the décor.  The room was dark, the halls had a really bad odor similar to a rotten egg.  The power went out briefly on the last night there.  Oh, and be aware there is a $125 incidentals charge whether your book through priceline or not.  This hotel was taunted as on the level of a Hilton, Marriott, etc.  I beg to differ.
Manager Response: Dear Barbara D.,  Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay with us. We are disappointed to read that several inconsistencies occurred and that your expectations were not met. We will take your criticism constructively as we appreciate every positive and negative comment that we receive and they are taken into account when looking to improve our services and accommodations. Please keep in mind that we do not charge for incidentals, we merely authorize the card and it is release in 5-10 business days. The incidentals authorization could be released sooner or later than that window, that all depends on your credit card company or bank. We certainly hope to redeem our name with you in the future. Thank you again for allowing us the opportunity to serve you.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Usually many know that Yorba Linda Hotels are just average and not glitzy or extra ordinary but when you walk into here you feel welcome. I never actually stayed here but for a third grade school project I interviewed the manager and took pictures for the report. While on the other hand, Stay America declined the offer and said it violated privacy policies ( although Ayres was my first choice ) if you want to feel welcome at reasonable prices in a luxury atmosphere with well trained staff Ayres is my personal recommendation.
Manager Response: Dear Shana H.,  Thank you for your time in reviewing your stay at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda! We sincerely appreciate your warm compliments and are delighted that we were able to assist you with your project.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: I recently spent 4 nights at Ayres Suites.  I went for a wedding.  The wedding party reserved a room to dress for pictures with this lovely building and surroundings as a photo backdrop.  My favorite part was the bed. I slept better than I do at home!  The next best thing was the complete breakfast that was waiting for me every morning which was included in the price.  It was a bit more than I prefer to pay but the location was perfect for me and for the wedding photos.  The staff was wonderful as well.  They have guest laundry services available, but I didn't use them. I highly recommend .

Relaxing environment, near shops and good food, close to highway. Beautiful old school decor, lots of dark wood. Lovely place to stay! Beautiful view! Awesome continental breakfast! You can dine in or take it to your room!

We had a fine stay at this hotel but experienced terrible customer service. I left a pair of expensive sandals in the room and called the following day, only to be told that nothing was found and they'd double check and call back. I never got another call so called again and asked to speak to the manager. She never offered any reparation but instead continued to repeat that they weren't found. I have never experienced anything like this before! Who would take someone else's shoes? I'd expect the hotel to offer some sort of compensation or at least apologize in this type of case. I never wore the sandals outside the hotel and know exactly where they were left. Make sure not to leave any valuables in your room if you stay here! To management: whatever happened to the customer is
Manager Response: Dear Angela D.,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to share about your recent experience at our hotel. Your feedback is greatly appreciated as it helps us to better serve our guests. In regards to your recent visit, please accept my most sincere apologies for your stay being anything less than remarkable. We are very sorry to hear about the inconveniences you experienced and thank you for bringing these issues to our attention. Please know that we did launch an investigation regarding the lost and found item and it was not found. Please feel free to contact us further should you wish.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: This is my fourth stay at Ayers Suites. I have come to expect an excellent, comfortable room, helpful staff, and a great breakfast to start the day. I was not disappointed; it is classic and elegant The area has filled in with more restaurants, shopping, and a Costco. I will be back next January.

Pros : Big rooms, that are quite clean Many places to eat nearby Wonderful staff There is a self laundry machine.  Cons : Not really a fresh breakfast, esp the cut fruits, muffins and bread. The waffles are good. Pretty much same menu daily ,and we stayed for nearly 7 days, so...yeah!   Lower floors, the rooms smell.  The pool was awful. Heard that they were renovating.  No locker safe in the room.  I did not like their soaps and shampoos. But, there is sprouts nearby and has gr8 soaps and stuff.  Not much public transport,but there is one bus that comes every 20 minutes. You have to walk a little.  Tip:Try tacos at taco bells ,esp for vegetarians.   Tip:

This is my second time at Ayers Suites in Yorba Linda, and it was great, the staff is great, very friendly and attentive. The rooms always very clean, and great size. Breakfast is very good, and the locations is great, next to Costco.

Super friendly and helpful staff. Went out their way to help us with directions and transportation. Large comfortable rooms, The heating & air system is a bit noisy, but not a major nuisance. A very good buffett breakfast and comfortable bed. Very nice, overall!

I did not expect more than a Best Western from them when I booked a room for two nights last year. But I was pleasantly surprised with the decor, service, size of rooms and staff interactions. Breakfast bar was also quite nice. Well located too.  Don't be fooled by the affordable rates and think it is about a 3 or 3.5 star type of a place. Go here instead. It is a relatively upscale place to stay on a good budget! I'll give the decor and condition of the place 4 or 4.5 stars but the staff and experience a 5 star.

Staff is helpful and friendly. Despite the location along the freeway, the rooms facing the hills were quiet and the railroad is sufficiently far that those rattling double deckers never registered. Rooms come with breakfast which had excellent scrambled eggs but all else was very standard fare. With Denny's next door I was tempted to go there. Clearly sub-par were the window air conditioning units. This was winter but the cooling units were essential to keep ambient heat generation and humidity in my comfort zone. My unit really needed more coolant so the fan was blowing over coils that were anything but cooling. Not sure that this would measure up in other weather than my January days. We had to open the windows after showering each day. WiFi was excellent and logging on easy

Stayed here on Christmas eve. Rooms are very nice and comfortable, with typical Ayres Hotel decor. Location is great, right off the 91 fwy. This hotel is surrounded by shopping and dining. El torito is just a quick walk next door...dinner?

We have stayed here the last two Christmases.  They rooms are clean and quiet. The hotel is always has holiday decorating which makes me feel more like home.  They serve a satisfying breakfast every morning and wine in the evening.  We have always found the staff to be friendly.  Bed is a little firm for my taste, but a lot of people like it that way.

Nice breakfast and great room , only thing missing was conditioner but you can request it! Nice housekeeping staff! Wifi didn't work! But hotel is great! Nice location, it's close to fast food places and shopping. Very helpful staff and live the complimentary breakfast! Rooms are clean and big! Tv needs more channels like show time! All in all I loved staying there! A bit pricy but worth it! Book in advance, gets sold out fast.

I visit my family in Yorba Linda regularly, always at Christmas. I did so again this year and stayed at Ayres. It's a warm, comfortable hotel, nicely decorated for the Holiday. Excellent staff, I'm always welcomed by Eleanor, very gracious host.
Manager Response: Dear Wood S.,   Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda! We sincerely appreciate your kind compliments and look forward to serving you again in the near future!   Warm Regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Booked this turd for a weekend soccer tournament. Drove 3 hours in the rain to get there. Upon arrival we find out that the tournament was cancelled. EVERY OTHER HOTEL in the area rebooked the patrons for the next weekend with NO FEES, but Ayres refused to do that and instead stuck all the guests with a $54 fee. Then they had the nerve to ask me if I wanted to book with them for the next weekend!  Terrible customer service. The manager Stephanie is soulless. Stay AWAY from this place. I would not book there if it was the last hotel on the planet.
Manager Response: Dear Doug S,  Thank you for your time in writing a review on your recent experience with Ayres Suites Yorba Linda. I am truly saddened that our policy has upset you in such a way. We do have a strict 24 hour cancellation policy, however, I am deeply apologetic that our service did not meet your standards. I would never want our service or policies to leave a negative impression in your mind. Again, I am very sorry that we have upset you and I thank you for your feedback.   Warm Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: I stayed the hotel for a week to attend a conference in our company. The room is clean and comfortable. Free wi-fi available.  In the evening, the hotel welcomes the guests with alcohol and warm foods for free, at the lobby.
Manager Response: Dear yamakenrc5,   Thank you for your kind compliments regarding our outstanding team and complimentary amenities. We hope you will return soon!   Best Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the Ayres suites in Yorba Linda for one nighT after a wedding reception and was very impressed with the cleanliness of the entire hotel and the professionalism of the employees.  This hotel is highly recommended to all.
Manager Response: Dear aajohnson2014,  Thank you for your recommendation and time in reviewing your recent stay with us! I am delighted to see that you will be returning in the future!   Kind Regards,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Convieniently located once  you figure out how to get there.  BIG room with a comfortable bed.  Very friendly staff.  The breakfast was as close to "cook to order" as  you can get.  Very quiet with a nice view.
Manager Response: Dear David Z.,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda. Your kind compliments are warmly welcomed and deeply appreciated.  Best Regards,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Always happy to stay at an Ayres
Summary: Stayed for work for a few days recently. Check in and out was a breeze. Room was quiet, spacious, and clean.  Didn't use the microwave, not sure the fridge works properly (water was gently chilled, so I was afraid to eat the food I had put in there). I would not recommend room 216 unless you like the aroma of breakfast sausages. It is directly above the kitchen where they begin breakfast prep around 5:30am, and there is the occasional kitchen noise and the sausage smell lingers in the bathroom/vanity area for hours.  The complimentary breakfast was tasty, breads varied from pancakes to french toast and the make-your-own waffle was available daily. Also served were scrambled eggs and potatoes/hash browns. I do wish there was a variety in the breakfast meat however-it was sausage

The hotel is well maintained with all the necessary comforts. Our family made use of the fitness center, heated pool & free breakfast. The beds were comfy & the rooms were nicely appointed.The hotel staff was friendly, & professional. I mentioned to the staff that the hair dryer in our room wasn't working & it was replaced immediately. Our rooms had a beautiful view of the Yorba Linda Hills. We would recommend staying at this Ayres hotel, we were very pleased!
Manager Response: Dear rjaber54,   Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda! I am thrilled to see that you and your family were able to make use of our fitness center, pool, and complimentary breakfast. Your compliments are warmly welcomed in regards to our top notch and attentive team! Thank you again for choosing Ayres Suites and we look forward to serving you in the future!   Warm Regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The lady at the front desk even tried to help me tie a tie i thought that was awesome. Beds were really nice, room was supper clean, I loved the breakfast they served was very delicious .  I would defiantly come back and stay at this hotel again.
Manager Response: Dear Krayzkris,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and for your time in writing this review! I am thrilled to see that our front desk team member was willing to assist you with your task and that you found our accommodations comfortable and luxurious. The breakfast is always an added bonus that we are more than happy to offer our guests. Thank you for your recommendation and we look forward to serving you in the future!   Warm Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: Extremely professional and personable staff. Rooms very quite and nicely appointed for business or pleasure. Would like some healthier snack choices for future stays. Breakfast was very good each day. Would like some individual yogurts or vanilla flavor and granola and protein bars available as a quick breakfast choice
Manager Response: Dear Tina B,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and for taking the time to review your recent stay! I appreciate your kind words regarding our friendly and professional team as well as our complimentary full American breakfast buffet. Thank you for your positive feedback and suggestions. We look forward to serving you when you return to the area!   Best Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: I stayed at this hotel recently for 2 day for work and we had about 30+ rooms. Upon arrival there was a group in front of us that the Assistant Manager Ms. E Acosta was helping. I was waiting for her to greet me but nothing. She wasn't smiling and didn't apologize for the wait, she actually acted like she didn't really want to be there. when I said who I was and the group and that this is our first time here, she looked at me like I was crazy. For the price we are paying for 30+ rooms I expected a little better service. Not sure if this chain has a rewards card wasn't asked about that either. The room was ok...The next day when room service came to clean the person only cleaned the bathroom, and she had forgot something and came back 5 minutes later and just walked in the room!
Manager Response: Dear Rjduran2,   Thank you for your time in writing this honest and candid review. I appreciate all guest feedback, good and bad. I apologize on behalf of my Assistant Manager for the lack of guest service upon your arrival. This is certainly not acceptable and we will be working to improve guest interaction upon check-in as this is of the utmost importance to our team at Ayres Hotels. I will also ensure that our housekeeping team is operating professionally and efficiently when working on guest rooms. I apologize that your stay was anything less than exceptional and hope you will allow us the chance to serve you again in the future. Thank you again for bringing this to my attention and for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda.   Warm Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: Arrived late and left early, so didn't get to sample the breakfast, but appreciated the free parking and free Wi-Fi.  Décor of the entire hotel is very classy. Room was huge. Staff was friendly. Restaurant next door. Fast-food in walking distance.
Manager Response: Dear Shirley A,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and for your time in reviewing your stay! I appreciate your kind compliments regarding our complimentary amenities and luxurious accommodations. We look forward to serving you again in the near future!   Warm Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: We stayed at Ayers for 3 nights because it was the closest hotel to our niece who was getting married . From  the moment you walk in the lobby (green ceramic tile) you know the hotel is going to be dated . Everyone who worked there was very nice and the rooms were large and clean .Shower heads were too low- had to bend down to wet /rinse my hair .( I am 6' tall) Overall , a good location , but Air conditioner did not work very well .
Manager Response: Dear David F,   Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay in Yorba Linda. I am disappointed to see that your expectations were not met. I will take your criticism constructively as we do appreciate every positive and negative comment into account when looking to improve our service and accommodations. I hope to redeem our brand with you in the future. Thank you again for allowing us the opportunity to serve you.   Kind Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: This has to be one of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed in. Our room overlooked the pool, the mountains and we had a view of the trains which was an added bonus! Tell me what other hotel offers free buffet breakfast, free parking and free wi-fi with your stay? The room was nicely furnished and the bed was very comfortable. I would stay here again in a heartbeat! Oh I forgot the chocolate chip cookies each nite... Thanks!
Manager Response: Dear CentralValleyFull,   Thank you for taking the time to review your enjoyable stay with us! I am overjoyed with your kind compliments and recommendation. Our complimentary amenities and luxurious accommodations are difficult to beat and I am delighted to see that you thought the same! We look forward to serving you again in the future!   Warm Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: Had to wait 5 minutes to check in, the Assistant Manager Ms. E Acosta didn't greet us, wasn't smiling and didn't apologize for the wait. For the price we are paying for 20+ rooms, I want better service. The only thing really nice about the room is the jet bath tub.
Manager Response: Dear independent1_noa,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda for your recent visit to the area. My most sincere apologies for your wait at check-in and for the lack of excellent customer service you received. This is not characteristic of our Assistant Manager or any other team members. I am glad you brought this to my attention and I can assure you that I will look further into this matter. Thank you for your honest review!   Warm Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary Heading: Lovely Hotel with nice upscale touches
Summary: I was very pleased with my stay.  The hotel has an upscale feel to it and one can see a lot of thought went into the decoration, which is very nice and has a homey feel.  Very good price and value.  The room was very spacious and immaculate.  The furnishings were in great shape and the maintenance of the marble was impressive.  The spa/hot tub/bath in the bathroom was very nice and the bath amentities were very good.  The breakfast was excellent-- lots to offer and all freshly made by a chef who was there.  I was very happy with the free high speed internet and the power outlets.  The staff was very nice and I'd definitely stay here or one of their other hotels again.  Apparently, it's a family-owned chain and I could see the love and care that goes into it.  I stayed on the
Manager Response: Dear Printer1215,   Thank you for your kind compliments regarding our signature European boutique style decor. I am delighted to see that you enjoyed our complimentary full American style breakfast buffet. Our team members work very hard to ensure that each guests has a memorable and enjoyable stay and I am thrilled to see that they did just that for you! Thank you for your recommendation and we hope to see you again soon!   Best Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: We love this hotel chain.This was our 2nd stay at Yorba Linda.We have stayed at others in Orange County.I emailed months before to ask for the same room as the year before;4th floor over looking  the canyon.They obliged,no problem. Friendly,professional staff,Very clean everywhere. Don't know   why some people moan about the breakfast,plenty of selection and all in with the  reasonable room rate.
Manager Response: Dear J M,   Thank you for being a loyal Ayres guest! I am delighted to see that we have exceeded your expectations once again. I appreciate your kind words in regards to our complimentary full American breakfast buffet. Thank you again for your time in writing this review and we look forward to seeing you in the near future.   Warm Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: Room: Large with very comfortable bed. Nice work desk, sitting area, single-cup coffee maker, wet bar, fridge and microwave.  Bathroom: sink separate from toilet and whirlpool tub/shower, good water pressure and plenty of hot water.  Breakfast: Hot and fresh each morning.  Staff: Professional and very courteous.  Location: Lots of dining options nearby (Wahoo's Fish Tacos is highly recommended!); easy access to everything in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear Patrick T.,   Thank you for taking the time to write this review regarding your stay. It is always a pleasure to offer comfortable accommodations and complimentary amenities like our breakfast, parking, and WiFi. I agree that our location is very convenient for local dining options and glad you were able to enjoy them. Thank you again for your generous recommendation.   Kind Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: Traveling with my daughter to Disney last minute we needed a place to stay.  We found this hotel on priceline at a great rate.  It was a little bit of a drive, but well worth it for us.  It was a great choice with a clean, quiet, and comfortable room, and the staff was very friendly.  It had free parking and a nice breakfast that you typically wont find with hotels next to Disney.  I will definitely stay there again.

All I can say is "Off the chain" Highly recommend this place. Staff was friendly, breakfast was good.great Mexican food place next store. Rates were very good and free parking.was a very enjoyable stay
Manager Response: Dear Michael C,   Thank you for your glowing review and for your kind compliments regarding our friendly team members and complimentary full breakfast buffet! It is our absolute pleasure to see that we exceed our guest's expectations in terms of value and service. We look forward to serving you again in the very near future!   Kind Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Yorba Linda
Summary: This hotel is great.  Breakfast is free and really good.  Property is clean and staff is very friendly.  The hotel is next to El Torito ( Olive Garden used to be next door also but closed down ). There is a number of great places to eat nearby.    The only thing which is missing compare to other brands they don't have small shop next to front desk.  There are vending machines on each floor so you can get drinks and snacks if you need.
Manager Response: Dear Michael B,   Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda. I am thrilled to see that you enjoyed our optimal location and our complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We look forward to serving you again when you return to the area!   Warm Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: We where given an excellent rate for the entire wedding party. Staff was extremely helpful and professional. Accommodations and service were excellent. Best complimentary breakfast ever. Great breakfast bar in the morning!
Manager Response: Dear Alex P,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda for your wedding accommodations! I am thrilled to see that you were pleased by our exceptional service and complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We hope to serve you again in the near future!   Best Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: Rooms here feel comfortable the minute upon your arrival; the ambiance in the rooms speak for themselves. Additionally, the beds are the most comfortable; you will get the best rest on these beds~ We Love Ayres Hotels!  K & B
Manager Response: Dear Kathleen R,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda for your recent visit to the area! I am thrilled to see that you enjoyed the ambiance of our signature European style rooms. I agree that our Ayres Dream Sleepers are some of the most comfortable beds that leave you feeling rejuvenated each morning. I look forward to serving you when you return to the area!   Best Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: I stay here a lot. Great staff, clean, nicely appointed rooms with great beds. Nice linen. Very quite even though it's right off the freeway. Even rooms facing the freeway are quite. The breakfast is included and is pretty good for a free hotel breakfast. Hot eggs, fruit options. The pool, though small, is quite nice as is the jacuzzi.
Manager Response: Dear Camron B,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and for your time in reviewing your recent stay! I am elated to see that you found our location quiet. We are one of the few locations in the area to offer a complimentary full American breakfast buffet and are happy when our guests are able to start their day off right! Again, thank you for choosing Ayres and we look forward to serving you when you return to the area.   Warm Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: Although the location was'nt the best, there is a MacDonald's, Dennys and Tacobell within walking distance. The room we were in,had a view of the highway(busy) and dry barren hills. The hotel itself was very good as far as value, cleanliness, service and free buffet breakfast was concerned.
Manager Response: Dear kevn55,   Thank you for your time in writing your candid review and for choosing to stay at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda. I apologize that our location did not suit your needs and that the view was less than pleasant. I am glad that you found our accommodations clean and comfortable and that you were able to enjoy our complimentary full American breakfast buffet. Value is important to us at Ayres and I am happy to see that you felt we met your standard of value. Thank you again for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda.   Warm Regards,  Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: The room was decorated nicely but smelled musty.  That was nice compared to being woken up to screaming at 4:30 am by a druggie that was yelling in the hallway. Very trashy clientele! You have been warned.  When I called the front desk there was a man who was barely understandable (sounded drugged) who was completely apathetic.  later on, after 45 more mins of yelling in the hallway woke up the kids (7,5, 16mos) my wife went down stairs to find the guy sleeping on the couch. Upon checkout, I was not even asked how our stay was. I called the hotel manager and left a detailed message about our experience.  I was never called back.
Manager Response: Dear Noemi C,   Please accept my most sincere apology for the noise that ensued in the hallway during your stay. I regret that your time at our property was not enjoyable and even uncomfortable and certainly empathize with your frustration. I can assure you that we do not tolerate our staff delivering anything less than attentive and exceptional customer service. With that being said, I sincerely apologize on behalf of our front desk agent for sounding apathetic when you made the necessary noise complaint. I have reached out to you concerning your experience and only hope that we can amend this together. Thank you again for your time.   Kind Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: We stayed in this hotel for our disneyland trip. Some of the great things about our stay here  Great and quiet location Room was clean and spacious. My kids loved bath tub :) Staff were friendly and pleasant  15 minute drive to Disneyland  Free breakfast   ** can be improved ** Breakfast variety can be improved. We pretty much ate almost same breakfast for three days   Overall we really liked our stay and it was very relaxing and refreshing.
Manager Response: Dear Shankar_Chidambaram,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and taking the time to write a detailed review regarding your stay. I am delighted to see that you enjoyed our ideal location and accommodations. I am saddened that you found our breakfast buffet did not have the variety of foods that you would have liked to see. With that being said, I would like to thank you again for taking the time to give your candid feedback concerning your stay. We hope to serve you again when you return to the area!   Kind Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: The hotel was clean. Theyhave a nice breakfast bar everyday.  The staff were courteous.  There is a small pool area with a spa.  There are several restaurants and shopping nearby.  Beaches are not too far away.
Manager Response: Dear AZSUN2014,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am delighted to see that you enjoyed our complimentary full-American breakfast buffet and that you found our location optimal for your stay. I look forward to serving you again in the next time you are in the area!   Kind Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: The hotel is well maintained, the rooms are clean, the beds very comfortable. The staff is helpful and friendly. The included breakfast is top notch. Real eggs ,good meats, real tableware, not plastic,real plates, nice outdoor seating area. One of the best values considering the service and breakfast.  Offer a Nixon library  package which includes gifts, shuttle service to and from and tickets.
Manager Response: Dear Larry H,   Thank you kindly for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and for your feedback regarding your recent stay. I am thrilled to see that you were able to enjoy the complimentary full breakfast buffet we offer each of our guests. We do take great pride in being able to offer this added complimentary amenity for our guests and are pleased when the feedback is nothing less than positive! We have a wonderful staff here and thank you for your kind words. I look forward to having you back in the near future!   Warm Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: This was our second stay in 2014 and we were very happy with this  hotel.  It was very clean, staff very courteous and everything as promised in advertising.  Would definitely stay here again.  Everything just as promised.
Manager Response: Dear Mary M,  I am thrilled to see that everything exceeded your expectations during your recent stay. I would like to extend my most sincere thank you for your time in writing this glowing review and giving your feedback to future guests and myself. I look forward to your continued loyalty to Ayres!  Best Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: If you're planning a trip to the Nixon museum and want a lovely pre or post stay, I highly recommend Ayres.   It's a classy place that includes a free buffet breakfast, free wifi, and a whirlpool tub in your room. If you purchase the NIxon package, you receive admission for 2 and a handful of souvenirs from the gift shop.  I also opted for the chilled btl of champagne and box of chocolates waiting for us upon arrival.  El Torito is right next door, and there are numerous chain restaurants in the area for all ages.  Great customer service, quiet floors, comfortable clean room - I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear c0rkd0rk,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and for leaving a detailed review regarding your recent stay! It is our pleasure to offer packages for the historical Richard Nixon Museum and Library. We are honored to be able to offer our guests this experience along with the amenities we include with the package. We hope to see you again when you return to the area!   Warm Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: the pillows were super comfy.  the room was very clean. it was quiet and the amenities were great. we had ample time to get around and checked out. we were pleased with the breakfast buffet. there was hot food and the coffee was good. the pool area was super clean and the jacuzzi was very clean too.
Manager Response: Dear ARMasters,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and for your outstanding feedback concerning your most recent stay! I am thrilled that you were highly satisfied with the amenities you were able to take advantage of during your stay. We always strive to provide a clean, peaceful, and comfortable stay for each of our guests and are always happy to see that we have done just that. Thank you again for your time in writing your review and for your loyalty to Ayres. We look forward to seeing you again!   Kind Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: We enjoyed this property for one night. It was nice, clean and quiet and we were on the freeway side. I would stay here again. It was a last minute booking and turned out to be a good choice. The Chino Hills site is nicer, but older.

This hotel has great customer service, really good breakfast and great location.  The decor is kind of a funny Victorian style, but overall very pleased. The pool area was clean, although a little small. We had no problems with the service, the pool, the food, the location. Would recommend for families. We stayed for a soccer tournament. Even though the hotel was completely sold out, service was still great.
Manager Response: Dear S.Q,   Thank you for your kind words concerning your recent stay here in Yorba Linda! We absolutely have a European-boutique style that is signature to all of our Ayres locations. I am pleased to see that your customer service expectations were met and that the accommodations exceeded your expectations. I sincerely appreciate the recommendation and hope you will return whenever you are in the area!   Warm Regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: I (selfishly) debated about telling the truth because I'd hate for this place to be booked the next (or every) time I'm in the area and want a room.  But seriously, the Ayres in Yorba Linda is an above average establishment; well run, with a professional, courteous staff.  Every room I have had has been very large, comfortably furnished, immaculately clean and quiet.
Manager Response: Dear patricia d,   Thank you so much for your honorable mention. We are so thrilled to hear that every aspect of your time with us was so smooth and relaxing and truly appreciate your exceptionally kind words about our hotel. Please come back and stay with us again very soon!   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary Heading: Uncle Gary meets great nephew Jackson
Summary: My oldest brother came to meet my grandson and since we had a lot of family in town... I put him up at the Ayres in Yorba Linda.  He told me that the hotel was great, bed was comfortable, breakfast was yummy overall a great trip.  And he's pretty picky.  I would put up any out of town guests here for sure.  And the price was very reasonable

I like this hotel chain. The decor is like a European boutique hotel--upscale and clean, with reproductions of classic paintings in the hallways, bookshelves and overstuffed couches in the entry, with a fireplace, etc and friendly, efficient service. The room was big and the bathtub was a oval, large whirlpool tub that was great! We liked the microwave and small fridge area. We were on the first floor, but all was quiet. They have laundry facilities on the second floor, and the outdoor pool area was small and pleasant, with a place to have a bbq. It is attached by a driveway to the next-door El Torito Mexican restaurant, which we ate at, and enjoyed, although it was quite crowded. There is also a Denny's within walking distance, but we had breakfast at the free buffet which was

We've recently had to get one-day get-aways in Orange County for personal reasons.  Normally I like to book Hilton or related hotels.  BUT I found a great alternative to Hilton or other properties -- Ayres Hotels.  First we stayed at Ayres Suites in Mission Viejo, which was very good.  Second was Ayres Inn in Orange, a big disappointment.  This week was Ayres Suites in Yorba Linda which was the best of all.  They have the nicest rooms, a little larger than the Mission Viejo property -- even jetted tubs!  The pool area is very nice, with the water being the perfect temperature for comfortable swimming.  The breakfast room was large and the breakfast was very good.  On top of that the price was right.  As an added bonus, there's an El Torito restaurant right next door.  We didn't

what more can you ask?  great location near restaurants, stores and attractions.  free breakfast.  free wifi! friendly staff.  refridg and microwave in every room.  nice little workout room.  and very competitive rates

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay, for a picky family :)
Summary: We needed to stay over night so that our son would be near to the hockey rink for his team tryouts. The staff could not have been nicer!! They were kindly able to accommodate our request to have a room on the top floor away from the highway so that it would be very quiet. The breakfast was a typical hot hotel breakfast, with all of the fixings including waffles and sausage. We wish there had been some organic offerings because our family eats organic, but I have not seen such foods offered in any hotel...yet. The room was very comfortable and the staff had even made up the pull-out bed for our arrival so that our son could go straight to bed. It was lovely. The room had a jacuzzi tub. If I had to nit pick, I would say that the carpeting could have been changed, but other than
Manager Response: Dear 949mommo,   Thank you very much for your positive review and we're so thrilled that you decided to stay with us for your trip! We're thrilled that you and your family enjoyed our hotel and truly appreciate your kind words. Our staff members always strive to provide the best service for all of our guests and we're thrilled that they were able to accommodate to your needs. In addition, we loved hearing that you enjoyed our continental American breakfast, spacious guest rooms, and our world class hospitality. Once again, we thank you for your kind compliments and we hope to see you soon!   Best regards,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable, the room was very, very clean, a must for me, service was outstanding, the overall hotel was beautiful. Breakfast & afternoon snaks outstanding. Just enjoyed my stay, my second time, this time my husband & mother-law came too, and they loved it. Will definetly will come again, outstanding  overall.

The property was very clean with a pleasant staff.  We came in at 1 a.m. to discover that our prepaid booking with Book.It had not been confirmed with Ayres.  (If you book a room with Bookit make sure you confirm with the Hotel that they got your reservation).  In spite of this, the staff was able to get us into a room.  Our bed was comfy and the breakfast included a "hot item" section with eggs, pancakes or french toast, potatoes and sausages.  Two out of the three days we were there for breakfast within 30 minutes of closing time and they had run out of sausages.  Come early if you want them.  Also, their housekeeping staff was chincy with the soap.  We stayed for three days and they did not replenish our soaps...we had to ask for additional ones.  All in all we would come

We had over 100 people from our softball league stay over the busy Memorial Weekend and we all had a great time!  The BBQ area was a great place for all of us to unwind after 2-3 games in a day.  The rooms were beautiful and the Jacuzzi tubs were just the added incentive we needed to get the girls clean every night!  Many commented on how comfortable the beds were.  We were all on the same schedule for our games so we all converged on the breakfast area at the same time.  The staff kept it well stocked with a wide variety of items and it was delicious!  The staff handled all of our needs and the location could not have been better.  Anything we needed was within 1 mile.  Other teams that stayed elsewhere were jealous! My family and I had gone to Disneyland the day before the

First time staying at an Ayers hotel and was very pleased.  The room was very clean and comfortable and the hotel staff was very helpful and friendly.  I will definitely stay at an Ayers property again.
Manager Response: Dear Dolores R,   Thank you so much for your positive review and we're thrilled that your first time at our hotel was so wonderful! We love hearing that our friendly hospitality, attentive staff, and our comfortable hotel rooms made your trip so relaxing. We are grateful for your glowing recommendation and we hope to see you again.   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: Very impressed with the suite I got for the price. I could even order champagne to the room which is a big plus. Room clean and like new.  I also like that they put thought into the design and look of the hotel. Very classy feel for a good price.
Manager Response: Dear OC_One,   Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your stay and for your glowing review on our suite! We're happy to hear that you found our European boutique inspired ambiance and world class amenities suitable to your expectations. We greatly appreciate your thoughts and we hope to see you again soon.   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: This was our first time staying at an Ayers hotel. Although we were downstairs just off the lobby, adjacent to the elevators and down the hall from the dining room, our room was extremely quiet. The AC was effective and not noisy at all. The king bed and bedding were wonderful! One of the reasons I chose Ayers was because of its reputation for cleanliness, and we were not disappointed. Moreover, the housekeeping staff was immediately responsive to our request to make-up the room during the brief window of time we weren't using it. The breakfast was delicious and I can't imagine anyone being disappointed in the wide selection. The only negatives to speak of concern the bathroom: (1) The hairdryer didn't work. Fortunately, I'd brought my own. (2) For the most part, it's simply a
Manager Response: Dear Kathryn O,   Thank you so much for your kindhearted review and we're so happy that you chose our hotel for your stay. We are thrilled to hear that our world class hospitality, American breakfast, and our clean and spacious guestrooms made such an impression! At our hotel, we strive to provide the best of everything for our guests and we're glad to hear that you enjoyed our amenities. Once again, thank you so much for your recommendation and we hope to see you soon!   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: Traveled there for business everything from check in to check out was super staff was friendly and always willing to help. Room was quiet clean and comfortable, grounds and pool area very neat and tidy. I used the exercise room it was well lit had sanitizing wipes (which I love!) a bathroom TV and self controlled A/c/Heat unit a plus. The breakfast and staff awesome evening reception I could take or leave but the wine/beer was a nice touch especially after a long day-much appreciated! Great location close to one major chain and highway.

Summary Heading: For the money there are better options.
Summary: I was disappointed in the room. It needs an interior decorator or someone who has a flair for it to redo the decor. The evening snack and cocktails was really lacking. Compared to Embassy Suites, there's no comparison. The breakfast is pretty basic also. The staff is friendly and professional though. The rooms were also very hot and I had to run the AC all night. The decor is very drab and not well thought out. The room size is large but the furniture is barely functional. I think they were striving for an old world French look!
Manager Response: Dear Templeton52,   Thank you so much for your candid review. I apologize that the room amenities, ambiance, and complimentary breakfast didn't satisfy your needs and expectations. Our hotel strives to provide the best experience possible for our guests, so it saddens us when we are not able to do so. Our hotel is lucky enough to be in line for some renovations in the near future, so we hope you will visit us again to see the updates.   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: I have stayed at numerous Ayers around southern California and I always do my best to stay here. This location usually has the best rates for the chain and makes a decent hot breakfast to boot. The staff is always helpful and friendly and are always kind to my children. I have two young boys ages 4 and 6 and they love this motel. They act like it's a second home when we are here and I like that they get that feeling. I appreciate a good, clean hotel chain with the home feel and this location gives that to us. There are time where I could have chosen another hotel closer to my destination but I choose to stay here because I know what I am getting and I know I won't be disappointed.

Summary Heading: my 2 day stay at Ayres Suites in Yorba Linda
Summary: I booked only one night but liked the comfortable dreamy bed soooo much we decided to stay an additional night instead of staying with relatives. The price point was such an outstanding value and the room was elegant, the breakfast was very good included in the room rate that if we travel in  southern California again we will check with Ayres Suites first before other hotel chains. Ayres has established a very high bar of standards that is difficult to surpass unless you want to pay a LOT more money. This place is affordable luxury and my wife had nothing but good comments to say about our stay. Thank you for making our 2 day stay the best!

I have stayed @ this property many times.... it NEVER lets me down!!! The minute you check in at the Ayres Suites, the front desk is so very kind & helpful! The rooms are gorgeous & spacious. Very clean rooms with microwave & frig. The morning breakfast is wonderful!! Lorena cooks our made to order eggs over medium PERFECT & delivers them to our table with a smile!!!  Every holiday the hotel decorates so beautifully. Monday through Thursday there is a managers reception of beer, wine & soft drinks. This property has AAA rates & a😄Stash rewards club for free night stays.

I go to Southern California every 45 days for business and I always stay at Ayres Hotel, It's close to a few major freeways and easy in and out access. The staff is friendly, they serve complimentary breakfast every morning and have complimentary drinks in the evening for the guest. The rooms are very cozy and they all have a small kitchenette for heating or cooling your food. I cant find a good hotel in that area for the price.

The counter Host was great, made me feel very welcome. My first experiences with your employee was a good one. The rooms where very nice. I'm looking forward for my next stay. I feels like a newly owed Hotel.

Great experience, close to my workplace but big issue with ventilation in the breakfast area. Difficult to breathe without them opening up the doors. Had to ask twice during the week for them to open up the doors.

Comfortable place to stay, the bedroom is very big, the gym is open 24hours...the breakfast is quite all day the same but it is good...I didn't try the pool becouse of the weather but I feel it will be great..
Manager Response: Dear Marco,   Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your business trip and taking the time to write your review. Providing a comfortable, worry free stay is very important to us. I am glad we could provide a great breakfast for you to start your day off right. We hope will have the chance to visit us again very soon, and hopefully the weather will permit you to enjoy the pool!   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: I travel a lot but I love my Tuesdays only because of stay in Ayres suites, Nicest and warmest servise that you can't imagine. If you want to stay in a wonderful place and have a great experience I definitely recommend Ayres suites.
Manager Response: Dear Bashir-Azami,   Thank you for continuing to choose us during your travels. I am so glad to hear that our service is satisfactory during your stays. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and look forward to the next time you stay with us!   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: We loved the hotel.  Breakfast was outstanding and plenty of towels at the pool.  Clean and comfortable everywhere.  We were there while 5.1 earthquake happened in the near by area around 9pm and felt it very clearly.  The whole hotel shook for few seconds.  I would have liked the staff to call or visit the rooms to ensure everything is well with us guest and also to let us know the building is fine.  I felt safe and ok, but not used to such a thing being from Vegas so addressing the issue from the staff would have been appreciated.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel of our 10 Day Excursion
Summary: We recently traveled throughout Sothern California and this, by far, was THE most comfortable and enjoyable hotel of our trip.
