The breakfast variety was absolutely delicious - the best scrambled eggs I've ever tasted.  I can't wait to travel again as this is the hotel I will select as often as possible!

I visited Orange County and was looking for a nice hotel centrally located between Riverside and Orange County. Ayres  Suites was outstanding!!! Everything from the staff from booking the room to housekeeping was five star plus. The hotel ambiance was wonderful and the amenities were great.  Very clean and well maintained with several retail outlets and restaurants nearby.  The morning breakfast was great with a nice buffet of great tasting food. The location is convenient to use the freeway and is 15 minutes from Disneyland without the traffic and crowds. I am very critical of customer service and value but I have to say I will return here again. The only negative was the mattress was not that comfortable but the positives overshadowed that issue.  I would and will strongly

We stayed for a weekend at the Ayres. The room was very clean, comfortable and spacious. They provide a hot breakfast with eggs, toasts, waffles, fresh fruit, etc.  They have free wifi and also a computer in the lobby for guest use. We stayed on the 4th floor facing the back. The only negative comment that I have is that we were notified by phone at 9:45AM that the water was being shut off at 10AM for the rest of the day, not giving us enough notice. They should have had signs posted that morning for the guests to know what was going on.

Lets start at the begining:   My husband came down here for business so we went down with him. When we got there we checked in expecting to get bottom floor because I don't like elevators. Even though we called a month before to make sure to get a bottom floor and 2 beds, we got on the second floor and only 1 bed so my husband called immediately to get what we wanted. Then we got on the same 2nd floor and 2 beds. The room seemed very dirty specially in the bathroom ( stains on towels). We found very scary stuff in our room. The breakfast is ok but the room compared to hotels in the area that we have stayed before is very small. The "happy hour" is very cheap, budweiser and gross meatballs. The pool area was shaded and the hot tub was look warm I didn't go in but that was what my
Manager Response: Dear Kiki D,  Please accept our deepest apologies that you were not completely satisfied during your stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and will definitely use it to make improvements to the hotel. We are so very sorry to see that you found your accommodations to be unclean, we truly take pride in our hotel's cleanliness and are disappointed to see you found it to be otherwise. Rest assured, the housekeeping team will be spoken to so as to prevent future issues such as this. While we are pleased to see that you thought the hotel was in a good and quiet location, we are saddened to see that your stay was anything less than exceptional. We hope you will reconsider staying with us another time in the near future and thank you for taking the time to leave a review to let us know areas of which we can improve on.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Ayres Suites in Yorba Linda delivered a great experience on my recent business trip to CA.THey provide all of the amenities business people want: spacious rooms, free wireless, HBO, fitness center, hot breakfast, and even a fitness center. I particularly enjoyed the replicas of classical paintings liberally distributed throughout the hotel vs. the typical boring, department store art that hotels usually slap up. Thank you for the pleasant experience. I will be back for sure.
Manager Response: Dear Steve L,  We were so very honored to have you as our guest recently during your business trip to the Southern California area. Thank you for the compliments on the hotel's art, it is truly appreciated. It is also nice to see that you enjoyed the extra amenities such as the complimentary full American breakfast buffet and complimentary WiFi. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience here and we hope to see you another time in the near future.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: This is my first choice for a hotel to stay at when I visit family in Orange, CA.  We normally travel in our motor home cause we just like having our "own" home to sleep in but the Ayers Suites has always been so comfortable and that morning complimentary breakfast is quite nice too.   It's a quiet hotel as well as always, always very clean.  And I am one picky lady..!
Manager Response: Dear SegwayKate,  Thank you very much for leaving such a kind review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent stay at our hotel. We are so very pleased you choose to stay with us when visiting family in Orange, CA. It is nice to know that you find our hotel to be comfortable and clean. We are also delighted to know you enjoy the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review and we hope you will visit another time soon.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Stayed a week for training class. The staff were very friendly,service were good,room is very spacious with microwave,sink...There is happy hour everyday with free wine,beer and snacks..Free shuttle witheen 5 miles. I will go back if visit the same area.

We live in the area, so we looked for a nice place to spend a Sat. night away from the kids.  The location was perfect. It was easy to find off of the fwy, yet remote enough to avoid unwanted traffic. I inadvertently booked the wrong package. So I advise anyone booking a reservation, to double check their itinerary. Regardless, we had a very nice stay. The room was clean and well organized. It was easy to find the room, ice and vending. As stated before, since there is no through traffic, area was nice and quiet. We had a wonderful stay and will most likely return again.

Decor is a bit cheap looking, even though its supposed to be colonial. The wallpaper is very dated. Bed was a bit hard. Wireless network was spotty and slow.  Staff was friendly , if not unhelpful (wireless problems were referred to off site support...). Security personnel was sleeping in the lobby.  I will avoid in the future. Its not a bad hotel, but it's not great for the price.

My husband and I were in Yorba Linda for the SoCal Comic Con. We stayed here last year and loved the hotel, so we wanted to repeat the experience. We weren't disappointed. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The location is convenient. The rooms are spacious, clean, nicely decorated, and comfortable. Breakfast is excellent.
Manager Response: Dear Patricia K,  We cannot thank you enough for the glowing review on TripAdvisor, it is much appreciated. We are so pleased to see that you and your husband came back for a repeat experience, it is truly what we strive for. It is nice to know that you enjoyed our friendly service, the convenient location and your accommodations. We cannot wait to welcome you for another SoCal Comic Con and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: This hotel was well maintained, tasteful decor and very accommodating staff. I accidentally left my laptop behind when I left for the airport. The staff had it FedEx back to me in 2 days and was pleased to help me with it.
Manager Response: Dear Susan-Randy,  We are so very pleased to see that you thoroughly enjoyed your recent visit to our hotel. We appreciate you taking the time to let others know about how pleasant a stay with us can be on TripAdvisor. We truly strive to be accommodating as possible and offer the highest quality of service, it is a pleasure to see that we were able to succeed in that goal with your stay. We hope to see you again and thank you once more.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent stay, most accommodating staff, wonderful breakfasts - best deal.
Summary: I was here for a family celebration (brother's 90th birthday).  My niece chose this place for us, and I am glad she did.  One of the nicest stays we have had.  Rooms most clean, comfortable, quiet, etc.  breakfast outstanding, but most impressive - the staff was accommodating to everyone's needs.  Helped in delightful ways.  Made the event wonderful for all.
Manager Response: Dear Steve L,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a flattering review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. It was truly an honor to have you for your brother's 90th birthday. We are so pleased to see that you found your accommodations to be clean, comfortable, and quiet. Thank you for the compliments on the helpful service, it is truly what we strive for. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for two nights this past weekend. It was clean, friendly and in a good location. There were restaurants and stores near by. Easy to get to the Nixon Presidental Library and Museum.  Conveniently located to visit the surrounding area of Yorba Linda. We had to attend a funeral in LA and it was easy to get there and back to the hotel. Request rooms with view of the mountains. The complimentary full breakfast is a great way to start your day and is a great value. This was our first time at an Ayres Suites, but would stay at one again if we were back in Southern California.

Usually stay at nearby Residence Inn but never again!  Great location, great value, great service....and the best......FREE WiFi!!!!  and GOOD WiFi at that!  Very quiet and not a bad fitness center either.

Good value, good location. Comfy bed.  Room could use some updating - specially the bathroom counter-sink area, need some light there!.  Nice bath-shower-toilet room.  Recommend top floor facing shopping area for quiet night.  Cleaning staff starts talking outside the rooms at 8 AM, you won't need an alarm!
Manager Response: Dear SerneMarine,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel, your feedback is greatly appreciated. We will definitely keep your comments in mind about the bathroom lighting when making improvements to the hotel. I will  also be sure to share your observations with the housekeeping team so that they may keep it down in consideration of our valued guests when starting to work in the morning. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to see you another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: This was our second year to spend a week over Christmas at the Ayres Suites in Yorba Linda and both weeks were a very good experience.  The staff is very friendly and very willing to accommodate.  The breakfast and afternoon treats are excellent.  But what I like most is how clean and fresh the whole hotel is, especially our rooms.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable option for business travelers
Summary: This hotel is a solid option for business travelers.  The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast in the morning and is conveniently located to several restaurants for dinner.  The rooms are generously sized and comfortable.  I was very pleased with my accommodations.  And the staff is friendly.  After I scorched a shirt using the iron in my room, someone at the front desk offered to send it out to be cleaned.  Unfortunately, the shirt was ruined but I appreciated the effort.  And I learned an important lesson ... Always pack an extra dress shirt; just in case.
Manager Response: Dear Jason S,  We were so very honored to have you as our guest recently for your business travels. Thank you for your kind words about the hotel's location and accommodations. We are also pleased to see that you enjoyed the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We apologize about your ruined shirt but are delighted to see that you appreciate our team's service and effort. Thank you again for the kindly worded review and we hope to see you another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: This Hotel works on all levels. Convenient to I95. Comfy beds, good TV, Good internet and a breakfast that will carry you through the day. This is a business hotel. No frills bt does what it should without compromise. If you have work in the area it is great.
Manager Response: Dear RegularOZTraveller,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a straight forward review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent visit to our hotel. We are very pleased to see that you found our hotel to be convenient and practical. Thank you for the compliments on our comfortable Ayres Dream Sleeper beds, flat screen televisions, complimentary Wi-Fi and full American breakfast buffet, they are greatly appreciated. We only hope when you come to stay with us in the future you will be more impressed with the cleanliness and service. Thank you again and we look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely, Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The lobby is cozy and offers heavy snacks with beer and wine during the work week.  The reception staff is very accommodating.  The kitchen staff is friendly and helpful with a good variety for breakfast. They even make omelets!  The hotel is as fresh and clean as when we stayed there two years ago.  It is conveniently located near a freeway and there is shopping and good restaurants nearby.  The rooms are well appointed with elegant features.
Manager Response: Dear LeitaLuetta,  We cannot thank you enough for the flattering review of our hotel. It was truly an honor to welcome you back; we thank you for taking the time to let others know how pleasant your stay was by leaving a review on TripAdvisor. Thank you for the compliments on our array of options for our complimentary full American breakfast buffet, we are so pleased to see you enjoyed it. We truly strive to make every one of our guest's stays as pleasant as possible and are so delighted to see that you thought our service was friendly and accommodating, it truly shows that our goals have been met. Thank you again and we hope to see you another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Excellent hotel for business travel. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. My room had all the capabilities needed to do some work while at the hotel. A very nice breakfast was offered with convienent times do get a good start on the days business
Manager Response: Dear jwseaz1,  Thank you very much for leaving a review on TripAdvisor to let others know that you found our hotel to be a "home on the road." We greatly appreciate your kind kind words of flattery. It is nice to know that you were able to do all you needed to while staying with us. We are also pleased to see that the complimentary full American breakfast buffet helped you get a good start to the day. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely, Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: This is just a great hotel in every way.  The staff was so helpful when we needed anything, especially Eleanor, who helped out with some files we needed to print out on a last minute notice!  The property is lovely, and extremely well kept up; the lobby was even decorated for fall and is a great place to sit for a while.  The rooms are spacious and very well laid out for comfort and convenience.  Even a ceiling fan in the room!  The big bonus is the wet bar, with fridge and microwave right in the room, with a big counter top for the coffeemaker.  In addition to the couch and desk, there is a small table with two chairs.  The pool and patio area is very pretty, with a nice view.  I highly recommend this property.

The room was lovely.  Breakfast is wonderful.  Relaxing atmosphere.  Nice little beer and wine happy hour with light snacks.  We have never had a poor experience with any Ayres Hotel.  They are all so comfortable and beautiful.  It is such a plus having a refrigerator and microwave.  My niece wishes they had an Ayres Hotel in Minneapolis.
Manager Response: Dear PICTURE ME HERE!,  We are so pleased that you enjoy our hotels and come back on multiple occasions. Thank you very much for the compliments of our complimentary full American breakfast buffet and Manager's Reception, they are truly appreciated. It is so nice to know that you found your accommodations comfortable and beautiful. We hope to welcome you back another time in the near future, thank you again.  Sincerely, Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Stay - Chocolate Chip Cookie treats!
Summary: We stayed here for a night during a 2-day bicycle ride along the Santa Ana River Trail.  Couldn't be happier with the choice - the room was very large, the beds comfortable.  Bathroom was clean and well stocked, and the staff was friendly, efficient and helpful.  Although we were facing the freeway, we couldn't hear it which was great!  The pool/Jacuzzi were clean and nice - towels provided.  The location is a bit difficult for bicycles, but excellent for going out to eat on foot since we could walk to two or three restaurants easily.  We were treated to freshly made chocolate chip cookies in the evening when we returned from dinner--WONDERFUL cookies!  Breakfast was excellent with lots of options, hot and cold.  Based on this experience, Ayres will be my hotel of choice in the
Manager Response: Dear Pvfamily,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. We are so pleased to see that you chose our hotel for your Santa Ana River Bicycle ride. Thank you for your compliments on our complimentary cookies and full American breakfast buffet, it is nice to know you enjoyed both. We are glad to also see that you found your accommodations clean and worthy of a 5 star review. Thank you again and we hope to see you another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Nice lobby, great professional staff, large room with frig, microwave, bar sink, sofa, jacuzzi tub, comfortable bed and pillows, very clean, quiet, nice pool, good hot free breakfast, free Internet, easy parking, and great location.  Very satisfied and happy to recommend.

Summary Heading: Family, Fun, and a Lovely Hotel Stay
Summary: We came to Yorba Linda to visit with family and the Ayers Hotel offered a great location.  Moreover the room was spacious and the breakfast was outstanding!  The Front Desk staff were very friendly and accommodating,  I mentioned the air conditioner was very noisy and when we came back to the room (about 5 hours later) a whole new a/c unit was installed!  We plan on returning for sure!
Manager Response: Dear JR-visit1,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know how great your stay with us was. We are so pleased to see that you enjoyed your complimentary full American breakfast buffet, your compliments are greatly appreciated. We truly strive to provide the utmost accommodating and friendliest service possible, and are so glad that we succeeded in this goal with your visit. It is also nice to know that we were able to accommodate you with a new air conditioner as quickly as we did. We hope to see you in the near future so that  the next time you come to stay with us we will be able to provide you with a different room for better sleep quality. Thank you again for your kind words.  Sincerely, Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: We were visiting family nearby and were happy to stay here. The hotel is clean and friendly, offering a reception during the week and a full breakfast every day. It is located in the middle of convenient stores and (low cost) restaurants like Costco and Olive Garden.  Rooms are spacious and clean with a microwave oven and refrigerator. I like the wet bar which houses them. The bathrooms are above average boasting a large tub with water jets for relaxation. Air conditioning is adequate and there is normally an overhead fan in the room for those warm blooded types.  We were a bit disappointed with the room cleaning as they seemed cliquish and rude. When I called down to the desk to get my room cleaned they reacted quickly enough, but the lady who showed up was not happy.
Manager Response: Dear Joesph R.,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a kind review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience at our hotel. We are so pleased to see that you found your accommodations spacious and clean, and that you enjoyed the amenities. Our sincerest apologies if the cleaning staff did not provide the utmost professional customer service. Rest assured, this will be discussed with the team to prevent future situations such as this. Thank you again and we hope to see you in the near future.  Sincerely, Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The hotel is clean, we'll located, with an excellent hotel type buffet breakfast. The staff is courteous and attentive. Overall a good choice for the area. We would stay there again! There are several types of restaurants and shops within walking distance.
Manager Response: Dear Johnrob7,  Thank you very much for leaving a straight-to-the-point review of our hotel on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience here. Your compliments of the cleanliness, location, and service are greatly appreciated. It is nice to know you enjoyed the complimentary full American breakfast buffet too. Hopefully we will have another chance to wow you in the near future for a five star rating. Thank you again for your kind words.  Sincerely, Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Our second stay at Ayres Yorba Linda over two different years.  We have been  very very satisfied and pleased with this hotel experience. .  We have had no problems with, services, room comforts.  Breakfast is plentlyful, with many varieties.  Overall a quiet, friendly, convienent, affordable stay away from home..

This was my second time staying at this hotel. Last time I stayed was 3 years ago.  It seems the rooms look a little outdated from the last stay.  The jacuzzi tub was great!  The best was the breakfast in the morning! Overall, the hotel was average because the room wasn't as updated.
Manager Response: Dear Roylorena,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a candid review of our hotel on TripAdvisor to let others know about your stay at our hotel. We are so glad to see that you enjoyed the whirlpool tub and complimentary American breakfast buffet. We appreciate your comments on the room and will be sure to keep them in mind in our next refurbishment. Thank you again and we hope to see you in the near future.  Sincerely, Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The staff was friendly, at the Ayres Suites Hotel. The ambiance was beautiful, we enjoyed a full wonderful complimentary breakfast. I'll definitely stay there again and recommend this hotel to all my contacts. Also we found it important to have free parking Maria P from Chicago

Summary Heading: Great stay, great value, GREAT Hotel!
Summary: The staff was awesome and helpful upon checking in!  This is the first time I traveled alone for business and this hotel made me feel safe and comfortable.  I slept great the 3 nights I stayed and overall I'm very pleased with my stay.  I would stay again in an Ayres Hotel if I'm back in Southern California again.

Summary Heading: Luxurious, Affordable, and Quaint: Sensational R&R
Summary: This was the first time my boyfriend and I had booked our stay at the Ayres Hotel chain. As I'm sure you know (assuming you're traveled), opting to stay in a hotel that you're not at all familiar with can go either way: horribly tragic or blissfully satisfying. So it goes without saying that we were somewhat apprehensive about this relatively unknown venue. however, after reading several positive reviews, and discovering their high "star ratings" on nearly every hotel-booking website, we felt more confident in our decision. Not to mention, the hotel was having an amazing "special" that we just couldn't pass up: A King Suite (total upgrade) for 3 nights, free parking, free breakfast, daily managers reception with appetizers and beverages (complementary), and WiFi access INSIDE

I've been to this hotel several times over the past 3 years.  The staff is always super nice and helpful. It is clean.  The only reason I can't give it the full five stars is that I have to bring my own shampoo and conditioner which means checking a bag...they do provide an all-in-one but it dries my hair too much.

We were in Yorba Linda for a wedding and the Ayres Suites was one of the recommended hotels. We were very pleased with our stay!  The rooms were large, quiet, clean and very comfortable.  We slept great both nights--something that doesn't always happen when travelling. The breakfasts were included and were great--something for everyone's taste. We ate outside on the patio which was really pleasant. Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: VERY HAPPY TO HAVE FOUND THIS GEM!!
Summary: EXCELLENT VALUE FOR QUALITY OF OVERALL EXPERIENCE. My family and I had a great vacation stay. We have stayed in several 4 star hotels which were less enjoyable than this property. Quiet, friendly staff, very nice decor, larger than avg rooms with fridge, micro and wet bar standard. CLEAN-CLEAN-CLEAN, quality bedding, pillows and towels. FULL BRKFST BUFFET INCLUDED. This was a real treat. 6a-9a. It was as good as going to a brkfst restaurant. Saved us $50 daily vs dining out with fam of 4. Property located off of freeway, so 1 side facing freeway. We were on other side with decent view. Avg pool with nice temp. Did not use good sized jacuzzi. We will gladly stay here again and look frwrd to trying other Ayres properties. Hope was helpful to u.
Manager Response: Hi Tswartz1,  Thank you so much for taking the time to let others know about your experience at our hotel and for the 5 star review. It is truly a delight to see that our accommodations exceeded your expectations compared to previous 4 star hotel stays. I am glad you thought the hotel was clean and a good value, especially in the case of the complimentary American Breakfast Buffet. We do hope you will visit again soon and thank you for the compliments!  Sincerely, Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed at an Ayers in Laguna Beach last year so this year when I saw there was an Ayers in Yorba Linda I (we) jumped at the chance to stay with this wonderful "chain" again! Rooms are elegant but not overstated, CLEAN, quiet and also important to us since we have a very nice comfortable bed at home, the bed is SO comfortable I slept like a baby. Who can say that when staying at most hotels? The breakfast with cooked to order eggs and all the goodies to go with them was wonderful. Price, well you won't get ripped off here. Front desk staff was so very nice gave us recommendation on restaurant-the best prime rib we've ever eaten-just minutes away. Take your bikes, there's a bike route near by (staff will tell you where) and a park that is so beautiful to ride in.
Manager Response: Hi Dianna,  Thank you very much for your kind review of our hotel. We do our utmost to provide the most comfortable accommodations and warmest service to each and every guest; we are so thrilled to learn that we met that goal with you. I am so pleased to see that you found your Ayres Dream Sleeper Mattress comfortable and your room clean and quiet. Thank you for choosing our hotel to celebrate your 43rd wedding anniversary and congratulations! We hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely, Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: This was our our first time at the  Ayres-   and it was perfect -   thank you !!!   The best compliment we  can give you is to be  loyal customers - so when we sneak away for a few days off -  were coming to your location-  tens across the board -  see you real soon ...

We stayed here for 3 nights and were upgraded to the largest king suite. The rooms were huge and spotlessly clean with a very comfortable bed Breakfast buffet was plentiful with excellent bagels Staff were very helpful and pleasant. I would not hesitate to stay here again- good restaurants nearby like Wild Artichoke and lovely surroundings

If you're looking for a family hotel that's off the main drag, this is the place. And I mean that as a compliment. Though it's close to Anaheim and other locations in Orange County - it's a very quiet hotel that serves a steady business clientele but also families looking to get away. The rooms are huge, but could use some updating. It has a very pleasant lobby and reading area and the staff is extremely helpful. Stayed here for a week in June and couldn't have been more pleased with the service, location and price. The breakfast buffet was fairly repetitive but with enough choices to certainly get you off to a good start every day. Other than some fairly dated (but clean) rooms, have nothing negative to say and would gladly stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear marcusg123 -  Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. While I am pleased you found the location convenient and quiet and the cleanliness of the hotel up to par, I do apologize if your stay was not more exceptional. Our decor is European-inspired and we are constantly renovating and updating it as well as our various amenities. In fact, we just finished a beautiful lobby remodel last year. I understand that this atmosphere may not suit all guests but I am sorry it was not more impressive. We hope you will visit again soon.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Thick towels, beautiful rooms, comfy beds & pillows, exceptional service representatives.  Excellent value for the wedding block rooms.  Morning breakfast was more than we could ask for.  Thank you for being our home away from home!

We enjoyed our stay during our weekend stay at the Ayres as part of a large group that stayed for a wedding in town and received a special discounted room rate. Our room was spacious, immaculate and overlooked the Costco in town. Our beds were very comfortable and we were quite rested during our short stay.The hotel had a PC and printer in the lobby which allowed us to check in and print our boarding passes which helped save a bit of space and weight in our luggage.We particularly enjoyed the buffet breakfast that was served daily with a wide variety of foods including French toast, potatoes, bacon and eggs .Overall, we would stay here again if we were in town.

My new bride and I enjoyed the whirlpool thoroughly. The champaign and chocolates were a really nice touch. Breakfast was absolutely amazing! The only thing I can really say is that the front desk didn't know when I would be checking out, so she wrote it down... However, I got a call the next day at noon because there was confusion over such a simple detail. Overall, it was a great experience and would definitely come back again.
Manager Response: Dear joelwithsoul -  First of all, congratulations on your new nuptials. Thank you so much for allowing us to be even a small part of this special time in your life. I am so pleased to hear that you found the accommodations to your liking and the breakfast so impressive. We hope you will have the chance to visit again soon.   Safe travels,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: I booked this hotel for our team / parents (15 plus rooms) to stay for a tournament for 4 nights.  The rooms were spacious - extremely comfortable beds.  Large windows that left in plenty of light.   Breakfast was tasty and had something for everyone's tastes.  Freshly prepared eggs, potatoes, sausage and pancakes or french toast as well as fresh fruit, cereal, pastries and waffles.  The pool area was very nice and there is a BBQ on the premises as well.  The hotel is within walking distance of several restaurants (El Torito and Olive Garden plus McDonalds and Chik-Fil-A) and a market.  The hotel is located on the 91 and an easy drive to many OC locations.  Service was pleasant and the hotel was reasonably priced compared to other OC hotels that charge for parking and do not

We have been guests at Ayres Suites several times, and we can honestly say that we have never had a bad experience.  Rooms are clean an comfortable.  The staff is friendly and helpful. We have other choices in the  area but will always stay at Ayres Suites.

Our family has stayed in this hotel over the passed 8 years and just returned from a 8 night stay.  We love this hotel.  The staff treats you like royality.  The buffet breakfast has a wonderful assortment of hot and cold foods thats all delicious.  The pool and hot tub is sparkling clean. The rooms are quiet, spacious, and clean.  The decor and surroundings are beautiful.  An added bonus is there are restaurants located in the adjacent parking lots, which are nice after a long day of travel.

Summary Heading: Perfect Location and Staff so Helpfult
Summary: Great location in Orange County, away from the tourist "hoopla" but near enough to get ther easily.  The most spacious room I have ever been in.  Bathroom a little dark, but that is no biggie.  Great, friendly staff who are always there to help.  Buffet breakfast in the morning is high qualty,    Definitely will stay here again...

I am a business traveler and usually stay at brand name hotels.  I "took a chance" and stayed at this hotel and I was so impressed!  What a value!  In addition to being a great hotel, this one has a country feel with the back of the hotel facing canyons.  Even saw rabbits having dinner on the grassy area in the back.  Beautiful decor and I LOVED the ceiling fans!  Felt like home!

positives: very spacious room, great breakfast, beautiful surroundings, helpful staff, nice pool area negatives: carpet in rooms need cleaned (our feet got dirty walking on them!), took 2 days to get tissues replenished in our room for housekeeping to notice, did not stock with new lotion/shampoo daily-no real biggies I would stay there again if we ever get back out to CA.

My family and I have stayed here in the past and it has always been an excellent experience. This time we had only booked one night, but decided to stay for another because it is so well situated to everything. When I asked the front desk if that was possible, they said yes, and it was so easy! No hassles, no additional paperwork. The staff was great. Breakfast was also nice. Everythihg from waffles, french toast, muffins, bagels, eggs, sausage, fruit…you name it there were plenty of options. Our vehicle is safe, which is quite important to us, as we have had a break in at other hotels (none of them were Ayres :). The rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable.Olive Garden is just next door, BJ's Pizza is about 7 min away, the beaches, Angels Stadium, Disney…all very nearby. We will

This is a pleasant hotel and the rooms are clean and a bit bigger than average. On our most recent stay there however,  We were told via email and during a phone conversation that we had been upgraded from a double queen to a king suite ( why? I don't know).  I agreed to this upgrade when I phoned in after I received a welcoming email just a couple of days before our arrival date. Well, when we arrived and checked in we were given what is probably the worst room in the hotel.  A double queen (okay fine) but when I opened the drapes there was this big, ugly air conditioning unit blocking the window!  Ugh!  So just make sure that you tell them that you don't want room 219 and ask them exactly where your room is located...  The free breakfast is always good.  Scrambled eggs, make
Manager Response: Dear Adrian -  Thank you very much for your kind review of our hotel. While I am pleased you find the breakfast delicious and the hotel clean, I do apologize if the room was not up to your expectations and for any misunderstanding that may have been caused regarding a room upgrade. We are always more than happy to accommodate guests by switching them to a more suitable room should we be made aware of the issue. I am sorry if we were not able to do so in your case. Hopefully this experience has not soured you on our hotel and we will have another chance to welcome you.   Regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: This is a nice little hotel, comfortable lobby, nice rooms and a very friendly staff. Breakfast is adequate, pool and spa clean, plenty of parking. Only two problems - carpet in room was filthy, my toddler ran around barefoot in the room for 15 minutes and the bottoms of her feet were black! I also noticed the bottoms of my clean white socks looked as though I had been walking on asphalt after only 15-20 minutes. Also, a new shirt left hanging in the closet after checkout suddenly disappeared though I called an hour after leaving. Front desk said they would call me back but never did, three calls over two days and finally they said they simply couldn't find it. Oh well...
Manager Response: Dear Paddy719 -  Thank you very much for your review of our hotel. While I am pleased you hotel nice and the service amenable, I do apologize for the cleanliness and communication issues you encountered. What you describe in terms of the carpet is simply unacceptable as cleanliness is of the utmost concern to us. We routinely deep clean our rooms but would like to look into this matter and ask that you please contact us with the correct room number so we can resolve this issue. We hope you will still consider staying with us in the future.   Regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean, Clean, Clean and Great Breakfast
Summary: We stayed at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and wert so very pleased with our choice.  Not only was the entire hotel, including our room and bathroom, very clean, but the staff was extremely friendly and welcoming.  We asked for an exception to the norm and were immediately and graciously accommodated.  The decor is lovely, as is shown on photos on their website.  The bed and pillows were quite comfortable and the toiletries of a high quality.  The air conditioner was very effective and very quiet.  The breakfast food was wonderful and with a lovely selection.  The only tiny negative was that the coffee was too weak for our preference.  That is common at hotels, but we had hoped for a quality upgrade in the coffee that matched the rest of the quality experience.

We always stay at an Ayres when we can.  The rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet.  The free breakfast is great when traveling with kids.  Fair price for a nice room.  I would definitely recommend Ayres.
Manager Response: Dear DL -  Thank you so much for your review and for your continued patronage to the Ayres Hotels. I am thrilled you find your stays with us so consistently comfortable and that we are able to provide the type of service and accommodations that keep you coming back to us. We are very grateful for your  recommendation and look forward to welcoming you again soon.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: This is the second time I've stayed at an Ayres Hotel... Both times I've been much impressed with the quality of the accommodations, the ambiance of the setting and the excellent service from hotel staff.  This stay I was at the Yorba Linda hotel for two nites while in the area for a family celebration event.  It was a wonderful, restful retreat from hectic schedules.  The whirlpool bathtub was especially appreciated as a way to wind down.
Manager Response: Dear IdleGirl -  Thank you so much for allowing us the chance to welcome you a second time for two nights recently. How fantastic to know that you found the service amenable once and again and the accommodations so comfortable as consistency is exactly what we strive for. I am also pleased to hear that the jetted tubs available in our guestrooms helped ease you out of a stressful day. We are very grateful for your recommendation and hope to welcome you back for a third time.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: We loved the king bed with whirlpool tub. The breakfast was real eggs and not powdered fake eggs. Also had cook-prepared French toast or pancakes in addition to make your own waffles. I thought the room was a little stinky but my family didn't notice.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -  It was wonderful having the chance to welcome you recently. How wonderful to know you found your room so comfortable and appreciated the full American breakfast. We are very grateful for your review and hope you will visit us again should you find yourself in the area.   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: I'm finally going to check out today and I can't wait! After a 5 night stay full of gawking,rudeness and staring like my husband and I are Neanderthals because we happened to be tattooed and hispanic, I'm just over it.We are very polite, and well mannered individuals and being treated like the way we were treated is unreal , We just came from a 5 star resort on Oahu and didn't get treated like this! Its only Yorba Linda not Beverly hills!  Now as for the rooms They're spacious but someone needs to get on house keeping. My son woke up to a clipped toenail in his back our first night, we had no bedding(not a big deal) but had to request it twice, pubic hair all over The whirlpool bath tub, coffee was NEVER refilled during our stay, and house keeping barged in without knocking
Manager Response: Dear MeryAG -  Thank you for your candid review of our hotel. I am so sorry to hear that you found your stay so unsatisfactory. We happily welcome all guests from every corner of the world and every appearance, so I greatly apologize if for some reason our team members made you and your husband feel uncomfortable in any way. That was certainly never our intention or desire as we want each guest to feel as comfortable as possible. As to the housekeeping issues, what you describe is not acceptable and has already been discussed with the appropriate people to ensure against it in the future. I am terribly sorry that your stay was not more exceptional and hope you will reconsider staying with us or any of our sister hotels in the future.   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Ayres Suites - great front desk staff
Summary: Elegant lobby design, welcoming staff, solid breakfast and great rooms and location.  The value was very good.  I travel the world and stay in hotels everywhere - but this was the best front desk staff that I have ever encountered.  Tammy and Jennifer were very friendly and genuinely interested in how the day was going.  Tammy was a ray of sunshine in a busy week of meetings and made the hotel welcoming.  (Microwave the front desk cookies for 15 seconds for warm, gooey chocolate.)
Manager Response: Dear ColonelMills -  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest recently. We are always thrilled to know we stack up to all of the hotels you have visited. Your comments regarding Tammy and Jennifer are most appreciated and I will be sure to pass them along so these ladies know how much their warmth is appreciated. We are grateful for your review and hope you will visit again very soon.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The location is great, staff is tremendous, and the beds are cozy. Quite simply, it’s a great hotel right in the middle of everything. If you looking for a place that great to relax and is right in the middle of plenty of food and shopping, this is the place.
Manager Response: Dear Anthony -  Thank you so much for your kind review of our hotel and for choosing our hotel when you are in the Yorba Linda area. How wonderful to know that you find the service and accommodations welcoming and that our location proves convenient to your needs. We are thankful for your recommendation and look forward to welcoming you again very soon.   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: I had a quick trip to this beautiful area for a 2 day business meeting. I was booked into this hotel by my colleagues and can honestly say it was very pleasant and offers excellent value. The room was spacious and very comfortable. Staff were very attentive and friendly. I thought the WiFi connection seemed a bit patchy however. Although there's no bar on site there is a good Mexican bar/restaurant "within staggering distance" as the lady at reception put it! I'd like to come back for a longer stay and make more use of the extensive facilities.
Manager Response: Dear Jim -  And we would love to have you back for a longer stay! Thank you  so much for allowing us to welcome you for your recent short one, though. I am so pleased to hear that you found the location suitable to your needs and the accommodations and service welcoming. We are thrilled to have made such an impression and hope to welcome you back soon.   Thanks again,   Stephanie Rench  General Manager

Summary: Large clean rooms, quiet area, 24 h restaurants close by, friendly and helpful staff, great breakfast in the morning, close to Disneyland, what isn't there to like???   I was there for a wedding and decided to take an excrusion with the family to Disneyland. The staff was very helpful with a late check-in. If we return to the Anaheim area we are definitely going to return.
Manager Response: Dear rchang99 -  Thank you so much for your kind review and for allowing us the chance to welcome you! We love having the opportunity to make an impression on our guests by providing the best possible service and accommodations. We are thrilled to know you and your family had such a comfortable stay and hope you will visit us again very soon.   Safe travels,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Our go-to hotel in Yorba Linda/Placentia/Brea/Fullerton
Summary: We have family in Yorba Linda and for YEARS have been trying to find a good hotel to stay at during our visits.  We have tried at least a dozen hotels in the area over the years and are thrilled and relieved we finally tried Ayres Suites.  The rooms are comfortable, very clean, quiet, and roomy.  The pillows and beds are really comfortable.  I have a bad back, so a comfortable hotel bed is hard to come by.  The staff is friendly but unobtrusive.  The lobby and hallways smell like potpourri.  We didn't have time to sit down to breakfast but the selection looked good with eggs, sausage, fresh made waffles, and coffee.  My only complaint was there weren't many options for grab-and-go food (for example, some yogurt would have been fantastic).  While there are cheaper places to stay
Manager Response: Dear ToniPortland_OR -  Thank you so very much for taking the time to review our hotel and for making us your hotel of choice when visiting the area. To know we have provided such a consistently comfortable experience means the absolute world to us as that is our number one priority. We also appreciate your comments regarding "grab and go" breakfast items and will be sure to use them when we next revisit our breakfast offerings. We are grateful for your recommendation and look forward to your next visit.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: We stayed the the Ayres Suites in Yorba Linda this past weekend.  The Hotel was clean, quiet, friendly. and close to shopping and food. I would recommend this to anyone that needs a place  to stay.  They had all the ammenities except food to buy - snack bar or machines. Every morning there was a full breakfast with tables outside by the pool.

I stayed here before. I am alway supriced how clean it is. No speck of dust on light fixture and ceailing fans. Even around the picture frame, no dust. The rooms have a lot of space. The room also have fridge, mircrowave, and an extra bar style sink. The hotel has a nice hot breakfast. Restaurant right within walking distance. Employees are friendly. This place is just perfect. There are more good thing to say about this place. I come back here any time.

This was a great   family wedding/ reunion hotel for wedding at the Richard Nixon Library.They gave us a great rate for our guests.  Great hot  breakfast  when family could get together. They let us use the breakfast area for a casual evening get together for 30 of us hotel guests. Then the next morning an  adjoining room was open for breakfast that allowed us to  sit together, relax and chat. Very quiet, very nice rooms, free parking, very nice staff.

When we booked, we saw 3 stars. We were very pleasantly surprised to find the great hotel. There was nothing bad to say. The people were great, the room very nice, the bed comfortable, no noise even though it was on the 91 freeway. breakfast was a great choice & the people in the kitchen helpful & friendly.  We will use them again any time we can !

My wife and I stayed one night and were pleasantly surprised by the value for the price. We checked in late but were greeted by Myra at the front desk with a smile and very pleasant demeanor. She gave us a room on the canyon side which was very quiet. The rooms are clean and large; perhaps too large. They could fit a table and chairs in the unused space. Great restaurants next door, stores nearby and adjacent to the 91 freeway. The complimentary breakfast was good, but I prefer to have the staff take the used plates, utensils, etc. to the collection cart. I would suggest upgrading the toilets as they are reminiscent of an old motel, albeit clean and functional. Nice staff, as well.

Always very pleasant here, clean, quiet, friendly, good breakfast.  My only complaint would be the breakfast area gets very warm in the morning.  The earlier you eat the cooler it is.    I recommend staying here, and would bring my family here for vacation trip.

I have stayed at this property now a few times and their level of service and courtesy is consistently high. They are very conveniently located near a freeway exit and have comfortable large rooms. This hotel is a cut above. Try it.

Summary Heading: Good value if you need to stay in this area
Summary: We were visiting relatives in Yorba Linda and this hotel was very close to their house.  It is a perfectly adequate hotel.  Comfortable beds, large room.  The decor is a bit weird, a touch of Europe in the middle of So Cal!  I think it would have been better had they chosen to decorate in a more contemporary style but whatever.   The breakfast is better than average for this type of hotel, fresh scrambled eggs are a nice touch.  But non fat milk and yogurt should be added to the menu.   The "guest reception" on week nights is a bonus but a little chintzy.Beer and cheap wine, plus chex mix and chili???  If you're going to do something like this for guests, could spend a bit more and put out chips or something.   All in all a good value.

Summary Heading: As Always... So Comfortable and Nice
Summary: This has to be at least my third time staying at this particular hotel and each time I am so comfortable. My daughter flew in from South Carolina and we had three days here and it was great.  I am NOT a hotel person and each time I stay here, we are extremely comfortable.  Front desk is VERY accommodating and the rooms are very nice.  I would highly recommend Ayres Suites!   Oh and restaurants close by the hotel are perfect.  You could walk if you needed to.  And shopping is SO close!!!!

After traveling all morning and going to Disneyland all day and night I went onto Priceline and booked here. Myself, husband and 2 teenagers. Wow! Great sleep and a pretty good free hot breakfast. All of us Very happy! Thank u Priceline and Ayres hotel

I can really recommend this hotel.  An ok breakfast that was included, big clean rooms and a good bed. I had business close by so for me the location was good, but it's a long way from all the tourist attractions and LAX.

I have been staying in other Ayres hotel and this is one of the best. Love the room, very clean and spacious. Breakfast is good too. Location is nearby everything. Just simple the best Ayres hotel. Love it

I look forward to my trip every year for a men's  retreat at a local church to the  hotel. Clean is of major importance to me and  every time it is perfect.. the breakfast is  truly divine and  the  make your own waffle is pure pleasure. The beds are the best I always sleep like a baby, and  finally two great  restaurants on each side of the hotel. Absolutely wonderful a complete pleasure and  the staff always helpful and friendly.

We live in Hawaii an  our family lives in So Cal and we've stayed  her  at least 12 times  over the last 10 years. The staff  is friendly (same employees every time we stay!) the breakfast is decent an  the rooms are large  and tastefully decorated. There  is a fridge & ME in every room, a big plus for leftovers aggregating at either the Olive garden or El Torito borne of  which are within 150 feet of the hotel entrance. My only fear is too many people will catch on to this gem and Ayres will raise their prices! Ayres: We love you, don't ever change!!!!

Stayed on a Saturday night. We had the 4th floor king suite. Our room was facing the freeway. It was super quiet and you could not hear the freeway.  We will definitely be coming back soon. The decor was very nice and staff was very kind.

Nice hotel with large, clean rooms, very comfortable beds.  Breakfast is one of the best. All fresh items.  Price is right and it's conveniently located to major freeways.  Have stayed there many times and will continue to stay there when business takes me to the area.

This is a hotel that has it all. Great staff, decor, location and breakfast that is real! Most hotel breakfasts are prepackaged and they taste that way. They are fuel for the morning but that is about all you can say. At Ayres Suites the breakfast is as good as you wi=ould get going to a restaurant.

It was a nice clean room, plenty of parking and near an Olive Garden. They had a good little happy hour and nice fresh breakfast. It was a great experience for the price. I stayed one night with a colleague and we both approved of the whole stay. I did not use the internet, but it is free wifi and they have a shuttle service for local trips to the restaurants or Best Buy.

The rooms were very spacious and clean. A adequate parking, great breakfast, and location. Close to many great restaurants  The only negative is that my husband and i stayed. 6 nights on the 4th floor/ canyon view and the internet connection was sooo slow due to weak signal. After reporting the issue to the front desk, they referred me to tech support, but they were no help. We tried our laptops, ipads, and smart phones. After reporting the issue 4 days and having no help, we would not stay again on business. We then requested a lower level room but was told it woukdnt make a difference.  The hotel staff were very apologetic, but the issue was never resolved...even after 6 days.  One day we were told the internet was down but they were working on it....  With no business center

Summary Heading: Loads of character in a boring location
Summary: Located in a strip mall between an Olive Garden and a Mexican restaurant is this suprising gem of a hotel.  The rooms are enormous and the beds very comfortable.  I was tired and feeling bad but rested soundly here.  The bath is a jacuzzi tub that really works.  The pool in back is an after thought but we weren't there to lounge.

I spent 3 nights at this hotel on a business trip.  The rooms were clean, the breakfast was good, and the staff was very friendly.  I would definitly recommend it to anyone.  I really enjoyed the clean towels and the bed being made every day when I came in from work.

We stayed here for 2 months while our house was being rebuilt.  That being said, the rooms were paid for by the insurance company, but the accommodations were fantastic. Great staff, and loved the snack hour and cookies at night. Looked forward to it everyday.  Breakfast was great, but was a bit early for me sometimes, since I stay out late.

Summary Heading: Beautiful, friendly, spacious hotel and top-notch breakfast
Summary: Top quality hotel.  We needed a place to stay between hockey games in the area and found the Ayres Suites on Tripadvisor.  Our stay was wonderful.  Very comfortable and spacious rooms with refrigerator, microwave and mini bar area.  Excellent beds and sumptuous decor.  Whirlpool bathtub.  Easy to connect wifi.  The staff was all super friendly and helpful, greeting us with warm "hellos" everywhere we went.  Breakfast included was much more than the usual fare with so many choices of hot and cold including freshly cooked eggs, home-style potatoes, pastries, oatmeal, cereals, yogurt and delicious make-your-own Belgian waffles, which the kids loved! Pool and hot tub were perfect for a soak after a long day.  Coin laundry!   Inviting front lobby with fireplace and cozy decor.
Manager Response: Dear Whitney M -  We wish you could have stayed longer as well! Thank you so much for your kind review and for allowing us to host your stay. I am so pleased you found everything in order and that your visit was so comfortable. I will be sure to pass along your comments to the rest of the team so they know how much their warm service is appreciated. We hope to welcome you again very soon.   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: This was my first stay at an Ayers property.  I was pleased with the front desk service, the morning breakfast was pretty good and my room was clean.  However, we checked in and the bathroom lights and the vanity area lights went out.  We called the front desk and were directed to hit the resurge button on the light socket to turn the lights back on.  ( "this has happened before.  Don't worry."). After several attempts and no luck the front desk came to our room to try.  It failed for them too.  We were moved to the only room available- next to the elevator.  The same problem occurred the following morning.  Resetting the power surge button is something I have never had to do at any of my lodging experiences.  I found it rather bothersome and annoying.  Our room was located on
Manager Response: Dear Jonasann -  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel. While I am pleased you found the service helpful and breakfast appetizing, I do apologize that the issue with the lights caused you an inconvenience. Please know I am having the maintenance team look into this immediately to see what can be done to solve this problem. I understand that this can be very inconvenient and am sorry for this. As to the room servicing, the housekeeping team does its best to have all room serviced by this time, though occupancy does sometimes mean it will take longer to complete all rooms. Again, I apologize for this issue as I know it is best to come back to a comfortable and clean room. We appreciate your comments and hope you will still consider staying with us in the future.   Regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: A flight from Dallas to YL. We have stayed at larger and much more expensive places but this hotel is one of the best valueswe have come across in 50 years of travel. It all begins with a excellent GM an staff. Very friendly and great on customer service.

Summary Heading: Warm and Friendly Staff, Hotel Exceeded Expectations
Summary: My first stay at an Ayres property.  Happily, my family and I were quite pleased with the clean  and newish rooms, comfortable beds and a very solid (and free) breakfast.  But what most impresses me about the Ayres Suites YL is the staff.  Each and everyone we interacted with, including housekeeping and the kitchen staff, was friendly and genuine. This reflects quite well on the management and company culture as a whole--in that the employees truly like their jobs and actually enjoy interacting with the customers--a rare phenomenon these days, even in the hospitality business.

I loved the hotel.  clean room, great price, great people.  My only knock and the only reason it didn't give it 5 stars was because the shampoo is horrible.  I normally use suave, which is the cheapest you can buy.  My hair felt greasy by noon with this shampoo.  Easy fix, and you should do it soon.

Have stayed at the Yorba Linda property several times and each time it has been just great. The staff is friendly, room is clean and the breakfast is just awesome.  Suzanne at the front desk is just terrific, friendly, warm and welcoming. The location is great, right of the 91 and very convenient to most of the OC and South Bay as well as restaurants and stores.. Wouldn't recommend if you need to be downtown or Hollywood-ish as the traffic up there can be a real bear.  Only negative comment is that, while free, the internet service is a bit pokey and could use some attention.
Manager Response: Dear AndrewVo11 -  Thank you so much for making our hotel your choice in the Yorba Linda area. We are always thrilled to hear a guest has had an exceptional stay and love having the opportunity to welcome repeat guests! How wonderful to know you find your visits so consistently comfortable and the service impeccable. We greatly appreciate your review and look forward to your next visit.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: We have stayed here on numerous occasions, whether it was business or personal purposes.  I have to say if your looking for a local hotel to just have a getaway for a night or weekend, this is the place.  The beds are heavenly, plus they offer a reception hour during the week with wine, beer and cookies.  Plus every guest receives a great full breakfast daily, which is such a bonus. The staff is very pleasant and welcoming, just an overall great hotel!
Manager Response: Dear mmtillis -  Thank you so much for your kind words and for your continued patronage. We are always thrilled to welcome you, be it for business or pleasure. I am thrilled you find the beds so comfortable and the  staff welcoming. We are always grateful for a guest recommendation and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Beautiful from the outside but beware, our room had the stench of musty mold and the jaccuzi tub actually shot out black mold into the water when we attempted to use it.  Worst of all the hotel staff's response was "there is noting we can do about that"
Manager Response: Dear CREBusinessTraveler -  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel. I am so sorry that your stay with us was anything less than exceptional. We are diligent in making sure our guests experience the cleanest rooms possible and had hoped that our offer to switch guestrooms would resolve the issue, although we can appreciate that some guests might find this disruptive. As the move was declined, we had also hoped that the air purifier utilized during your visit would also assist in dissipating any odor. I apologize if the smell you describe caused any inconvenience and that we were not able to find a suitable solution during your stay. As to the mold described, I am very alarmed by this and was previously unaware of any issue. Please know I am having the maintenance team look into this immediately as this is completely unacceptable. Hopefully these issues have not soured you on our hotel and you will consider us the next time you are in the area.   Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: I was happy with the location of the hotel and the style.  The lobby is warm and welcoming with a fireplace and a nice area to sit and mingle.  They do have a "happy hour" but I never got there in time. I had never heard of Yorba so I was a bit concerned with how much would be in the area but they are right next to an Olvier Garden and an El Torita.  Also the rooms have microwaves and fridges for your leftovers. The rooms are large and spacious.  The downside is the bathroom.  The sink is outside the bathroom and the shower is in a jacuzzi.  It makes it difficult to get in and out of easily.  I'm not really sure that many people would use a hotel jacuzzi so I'm not sure why they have it.  The towels are great.  Big and soft.   They don't have room service but they offer a huge
Manager Response: Dear piggieConnecticut -  We appreciate your candid review of our hotel. While I am pleased the location and decor proved agreeable, I do apologize if the bathroom was not to your liking. Many of our guests greatly appreciate having the sink outside of the bathroom/shower area as it allows one person to shower while the other gets ready in the sink area. The Jacuzzi tubs are also generally well received by our guests and utilized often. We understand that every guest is different, though, and I am sorry if this element of the guestroom caused you any inconvenience. Hopefully you will still visit us again in the future.   Regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: We recently stayed at Ayers Suites in Yorba Linda. It is our choice whenever we are in this area. I was delighted to find that they have free WiFi. I had trouble logging in so I went down to the front desk for help. Without making me feel foolish, the front desk person not only told me how to do it but also did it for me. I really appreciated that. It is not difficult by any means.  They offer great homemade cookies during the week. I wish they would extend that to weekend visitors like they do with fresh apples.
Manager Response: Dear BrooklynDodgers13 -  Thank you so much for your review and for making us your choice of hotel in the area. It truly means a great deal to us that we are able to make the kind of impression that brings a guest back for repeat stays. I am very pleased you found the service so helpful and accommodating as this is exactly what we strive to provide our guests. Thank you again for your kind recommendation. We look forward to your next visit to the area.   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Didn't sing the wedding bell blues!
Summary: We stayed one Saturday as we were attending a wedding in Yorba Linda. I called to make my reservation and received the special rate even though it was less than 2 weeks prior to the date. The nite before our arrival, I e-mailed a request for pretty specific directions. Jessica, at the front desk, responded quickly and with easy to follow directions. We arrived early and our room was ready. It was spacious, on the end, windows on 2 sides with all the extras needed, if only we had needed them and were staying longer! Had a good breakfast the next day from very friendly servers, with a good variety of food to choose from.  Even though the freeway was close by, we never heard traffic. The wedding was terrific, too!
Manager Response: Dear Valerie -  It was an absolute pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you for staying with us even for only a short visit and for sharing your experience on TripAdvisor. How wonderful to know you received such a great rate and that the service provided proved helpful. Perhaps we will have the opportunity to host you again for a future event.   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Everything about this hotel is perfect! Staff, rooms and inclusive breakfast! Thank you for making my son's wedding guests so comfortable and happy! The fireplace is so beautiful. We sat around it for hours. Also loved the frig, microwave and spa tub in the room. Our guests from the Midwest enjoyed the lovely pool.
Manager Response: Dear Vikings55 -  You are too kind! Thank you so much for your positive feedback and for allowing us to be even a small part of your son's big day. To be described as "perfect" is just phenomenal and we are thrilled to have made such a lasting impression on you. I am also pleased our hotel established the perfect setting for your son's guests to mingle and enjoy themselves. Thank you again for your recommendation. We hope your travels bring you to the area again very soon.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Staff & rooms were great! The hotel had a wonderful breakfast and drinks in the evening.  The only issuse I had was the staff highly recommended renting a car to go to Disney & the beach.  If you're not used to heavy CA traffic, DON'T pay the money & get a cab!
Manager Response: Dear gAuGe14 -  Thank you for your kind words and for choosing our hotel for your visit. I am very pleased that the service and accommodations met your expectations. I am also appreciative of your suggestion regarding the rental car and will talk to the Front Desk team about discussing this option with guests. We are grateful for your review and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The hotel was clean, and modern. The staff was nice,and our check in girl was 'fun'. The rooms are very spacious. The beds were ok. Not to hard, not to soft. The room was clean, bathroom too! However... the AC was so loud we could not sleep. So we turned it off, and the room got so hot we could not sleep. We couldn't open the window for fresh air because we were right by the 91 freeway and they do night construction and it is loud too! So all that being said, if you are not going there to sleep, then it was a great value. If you really like your sleep and don't want to have a crabby day ahead, probably not so much on this hotel! Or i suppose they could supply ear plugs upon check in, you know... just in case!
Manager Response: Dear Beckinunez -  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. While I am pleased you found the accommodations clean and inviting, I do apologize if the noise issues discussed impeded your stay in any way. We understand that being able to sufficiently rest is essential in a hotel visit and are always happy to move guests to a more suitable room in the rare event that noise becomes a concern. We hope what you describe has not soured you on our hotel and that we will have the chance to welcome you again.   Regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The hotel is in a perfect location to sightsee.  This is my second stay at this hotel and it was exceptional.  The staff was friendly and very accomodating.  A full breakfast was included, as well as, drinks and a snack in the evening.  I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would highly recomend it to both business travelers and families looking for a comfortable place to stay.

Great stafff that greets you with more than a smile -family and friends is a way to view the staff. Location off the freeway gives great accessability to local areas but without the traffic associated with a freeway.  Dining locations are great around the hotel. The hotel is located near the Santa Ana River Bed for jogging and biking.
Manager Response: Dear Terry -  We appreciate your kind review and are thrilled you took the time to share your experience with fellow travelers. How wonderful to know the service provided made such an impression on you as we do our utmost to ensure each guest feels as welcome as possible. We hope your travels bring you to the area again very soon.   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: I’m not sure how to compare this hotel to others in the area. I will rate them based on what every hotel should offer. The staff was great. They always greeted you when you entered the lobby. They were always dressed with smiles.  They helped me get to the airport after AA changed my itinerary.  The breakfast was the standard hotel breakfast.  The happy hour needs great improvement.  Non-alcoholic beverages need to be offered. The snack (definitely not an evening meal) is the worst I have seen. It is placed on a small lobby table near the front desk. The kitchen area would be a better place for this. I know chips were offered but I couldn’t identify the food on the other days. This is my reason for a rating of 4. The rooms are extremely large compared to other national hotel

European feel hotel with very comfortable beds. Location is amazing, no noise. Staff is very good. Complimentary breakfast is of high quality. Free Internet, Parking. Would Highly recommend a stay at this hotel.

We've been stay here at Yorba Linda Aryes since it first opened . It's very clean, large rooms comfortable beds and a great staff. The free breakfast is wonderful too. We also love the pool and spa. We've stayed here in the summer and winter months and always  enjoyed our stay. An A+ hotel . Highly recommend Ayres hotel .
Manager Response: Dear Runnerwithkids -  Thank you so much for your kind review and for your continued loyalty to our hotel. To have earned such a long standing customer is an absolute honor and I am thrilled each and every one of your stays is comfortable and convenient. It was such a pleasure welcoming you again and we hope to see you back very soon.   Many thanks,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Ayras Suites in Yorba Linda Calif
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights to attend a wedding.  King size bed very comfortable, Very clean room and  facing the mts Little kitchenette.  Leather sofa and  large desk. . Very helpful staff.  Reasonable price and includes a great breakfast. Free parking.  Free use of the office computer.  We highly recommend this European boutique hotel. Marilyn
Manager Response: Dear BijonV -  We hope it was a wonderful event. Thank you so much for choosing us as your accommodations during this celebration and for sharing your positive experience on TripAdvisor. It is an honor to be so highly recommended by our guests, so we appreciate your kind words. We hope you will visit us again in the near future.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Clean, most comfortable hotel beds ever (all Ayres), very comfortabe pillows with a choice of pillows, excellent full breakfast, no additional "facility fees" , no parking fees, reasonable rates,  noise free and we were right next to the 91 fwy (albeit on the other side of the building.) Stayed at the Anaheim Ayers last summer for a trip to Disneyland and there seems to be very consistent, comfort, service etc. I highly recommend and will definitely be staying there again.
Manager Response: Dear Kelley -  Thank you so much for giving us the opportunity to welcome you to our hotel. We are always ecstatic to have the chance to host guests who have stayed at our sister hotels so we can show them that a stay at any of our hotels can be remarkable. How wonderful to know you found such value in your stay and that your overall experience was comfortable. We are so appreciative of your review and hope to welcome you back again very soon.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: We looked forward to our stay. We were very pleased.
Summary: We checked out a few of your hotels. We found that all were very clean and very friendly. It was a special occasion for us.   We were not disappointed. We chose your suites in yorba Linda because it seemed more what we were looking for. We want to thank everyone for a wonderful stay. We would come back for sure.
Manager Response: Dear Js_henderson -  What a kind review of our entire hotel chain! Thank you so much for your positive words and for giving us a chance to show you that a stay at our hotel compares favorable to your experiences at our sister hotels. We appreciate you allowing us to be even a small part of your special occasion and hope you will visit us again soon - whatever the occasion.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: We checked in early on a Wednesday after flying most of the night. The a/c started making a horrible clanking noise. We called down and maintenance showed up in less than two minutes. The gentlemen thought he could fix it quickly, we called down and talked to the front desk, they were already looking for a room to move us to. We were given a wonderful corner room. Loved the extra windows. The rooms are large, the beds are nice and the decor has enough extra touches to make it nicer than a basic hotel room. All of the staff was friendly, helpful and the housekeeping was top notch. The pool was kept clean and we found it relaxing. The breakfast was better than your basic continental fare. Don't expect gourmet but they have a nice breakfast room or you can sit outside near the

My husband and I stopped here to break up a long drive after a day of training for me. Great customer service - very attentive and responsive. We asked for a quiet room in the back on the upper floor, and that is exactly what they gave us. The bed was OK (hotel beds are seldom what works best for us - firm and cool), but we slept pretty good on the one here. The only odd thing was the low placement of the A/C unit, blowing right on the side of the bed. Fortunately it was on my husband's side and he could handle it! We're not fans of things frou-frou, but this was not gawdy.  Nice to have the fridge, microwave and sink area in the room. The jetted bath tub is big and the jets only have one setting: strong!  Wi-fi was a tortoise, though. It was not very reliable for much speed or
Manager Response: Dear L. Rutherford -  We were honored to be your short stopover! Thank you so much for your kind words and for taking the time to review our hotel on TripAdvisor. It sounds as if you found your overall stay pleasant, which is always wonderful to hear. We also appreciate your comments regarding the food selection during the weekday Manager's Reception so will be sure to review our offerings. Thank you again for your recommendation. We hope your travels bring you to the area again soon.  Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: This is a great place to stay for the business traveler. It is located next to two restaurants within walking distance...after a long day of driving in LA, I DON'T want to drive to dinner! The staff is friendly but not overbearing; there is a buffet breakfast included with the room rate. Rooms are clean and spacious. My only complaint is that the desk area only has one outlet and I need far more outlets for my numerous electronic devices to be recharged. It is still, one of the few places I stay when traveling to southern California. One other thing that was a plus...the air conditioner was quiet enough that didn't wake me when turning on and off.
Manager Response: Dear Sue -  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel and for choosing us for your stay. How wonderful to know that our location proved convenient and the service exceptional during your visit. I will be sure to share your comments regarding the outlets with our corporate Quality Assurance team to see if anything can be done to remedy this issue. We are very appreciative of your recommendation and hope to welcome you back soon.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Our stay at the Ayres Hotel in Yorba Linda was amazing!!! The staff were amazing. Very nice & helpful. Made our stay absolutely wonderful. The rooms are very clean, elegant & offer so much for the price. The breakfast is like no other. It's not just a regular old continental breakfast but more like a buffet of great fresh food. Very pleased with our stay & will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: So much more than we expected!
