Summary: My husband and I live in NYC, which means we have to find someplace to stay when home visiting in California.  There are times when we just want to stay by ourselves, rather than with family or friends, so we are always on the lookout for affordable and comfortable hotels.  We were very pleasantly surprised by the quality and atmosphere of the Ayres Suites at Yorba Linda.  Granted, the location may seem a bit remote for the average family on vacation in Southern California for the first time, meaning it is removed from the more "touristy" areas of Disneyland, etc.  However, for our purposes, the location was ideal.    We were very pleased with the room, which was quite large and contained a small refrigerator, microwave, and bar sink.  There is a Sprouts grocery store within
Manager Response: Dear MoMacG -  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you for seven nights recently. We revel in the chance to exceed a guest's expectations with clean, comfortable accommodations and friendly service, so it is wonderful to hear that we were able to do so during your stay. We are very grateful for your recommendation and hope your travels will bring you to the area again very soon.   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Our stay at the Ayres Hotel in Yorba Linda Ca.
Summary: Our stay in Yorba Linda Ca. was great. WE arived on Saturday Afternoon, We were greeted by the staff in a warm and friendly manner. (as always) It was our first stay in Yorba Linda, But we have stayed at several Ayres hotels. this one was just as good as the others we have stayed at. Disneyland was not to far, also the Orange County beaches are only 30 minutes away.  The place was spotless as always and the free breakfast was great. So overall I would recomend  the Ayres in Yorba Linda to anyone looking for a nice get away.
Manager Response: Dear Lowell P -  How wonderful to know we are able to meet the high expectations set by our sister hotels! Thank you so much for your review and for your continued patronage to the Ayres Hotels. It is fantastic to hear that the cleanliness of the hotel and the warm service were in line with what you expect our hotel collection to be. We are always appreciative of a recommendation and hope you will think of us the next time you are in the Yorba Linda area.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: very nice hotel; quiet; large, suite-like rooms, nice pool; outstanding breakfast, some of it freshly prepared, with real china and cutlery (no styrofoam plates or plastic knives and forks); would definitely stay there again
Manager Response: Dear AndrewE65 -  Thank you for your kind review and for choosing our hotel for your stay. It was wonderful to have the opportunity to welcome you, and we are thrilled to know that the accommodations and complimentary amenities (full American breakfast!) helped make your stay with us exceptional. We are so appreciative of your recommendation and hope you will visit us again very soon.   Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: What a surprise find!  We had gone to the Nixon Library in Yorba Linda.  Spur of the moment we decided to stay over.  This hotel was recommended to us and we couldn't have  been  happier with it.  Staff was wonderful, room was huge, beautifully decorated, and very clean  with a large oval whirlpool tub.  Plus it came with a buffet breakfast.  The lobby was lovely also with a fireplace and a small library.  Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear SanDiegoBrooklynGirl -  We were honored to be your spur of the moment accommodations! Thank you so much for taking a chance on us and for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. I am so pleased you found everything from the service to the accommodations welcoming and that your overall stay was satisfactory. We hope your travels bring you to Yorba Linda again so we get the opportunity to welcome you a second time.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Ayres Suites - Exactly what we were looking for
Summary: Stayed at Ayres with my kids and husband - to be near my family.  Great home away from home.  Staff was super friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and very quiet. Kids loved the morning breakfast.  Convenient location to family and many OC areas.  Highly recommend Ayres Yorba Linda.

What a great place to stay.  Absolutely the best beds I have EVER slept on in a hotel.  The bedding was wonderful as well.  The staff was pleasant, the morning breakfast was above and beyond my expectations.  Parking was easy.  The Lobby was comfortable.

Summary Heading: VERY VERY CLEAN ROOM , UV LIGHT INSPECTED . VERY NICE STAFF
Summary: had a 2 night stay and as usual i start by setting all my stuff on a non porous surface and out come the rubber gloves, black light and rubber gloves. obviously cleanliness is VERY important  to me. i did a very  thorough inspection of the room . this was one of the cleanest rooms i have stayed in , including more expensive  places . after a full inspection of every handle , every switch , the restroom , sheets  etc etc the room only showed a few small finger prints by the refrigerator the had obviously been cleaned but showed up under the light . if you want a clean room to stay in i would recommend this hotel. very very  clean !!!!   my second night i was wanting sushi  (walked down to the counter after reading too many reviews online )  and was greeted by a lady named tammy (

We stayed for our second time in the Ayres, Yorba Linda for 3 nights. This has become our favorite hotel to stay in when we are in Southern California. The hotel itself is very nice and the lobby inviting. The room we stayed in had 2 queen beds and the room was a nice size. The room and entire hotel was very clean and quiet. We had a lovely mountain view. The housekeeping staff kept our room sparkling and restocked each day. That was very important to us!  We enjoyed the pool-also clean! and checked out the work out room which was nicely appointed with a treadmill, eliptical machine, stair stepper and weight machines. They provided free wi-fi which was awesome but there was a computer with a printer free to use in the lobby if you didn't have your on PC with you.  We completely
Manager Response: Dear Mrs. H -  Thank you so much for your very thorough review of our hotel and for choosing us for your visits to the Southern California area. To be called any guest's "favorite" hotel is a hotel team's dream and we are so thankful to be your home away from home. It is fantastic to know you found each aspect of your stay, from the cleanliness of your room to the complimentary amenities, agreeable and that your overall experience was so remarkable. We appreciate you taking the time to review our hotel and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Safe travels,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Nice hotel, very typical Ayres hotel.  The A/C is in the wall (a little ghetto) but otherwise with the fridge and complimentary breakfast it was very nice.  The pictures on the wall in the lobbies and hallways were strange but I get what they were trying to do with the decor.  Also, the door didn't automatically close, it could be easily left open at any time. I would stay at an Ayres again, had everything we needed (including a very nice price).  Bed was comfortable and clean and the whirlpool tub was a nice touch (although we didn't use it).  Oh, one thing my boyfriend complained about was a door stop next to the closet.  He kept stubbing his toe on it moving clothes in and out of the closet.
Manager Response: Dear Boris4432via -  It was a pleasure welcoming you to our hotel. Thank you for choosing us for your stay and for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. It is wonderful to know you found your stay typical for our chain as we strive to create consistently comfortable hotel visits across the collection. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you again in the future.   Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the past 3 weeks and my family and I noted that it was clean, well-run, and provided great value for the money.  In town for a funeral, the hotel staff made sure my family and I were well taken care of.    The breakfast served each morning met expectations and the cookies each night were a nice way to end the evening.  The only issue noted - causing me to rate the property a 4 instead of a 5 - was that room #303 smelled a little like mildew each morning due to a minor ventilation problem.    Finally, the manager, Ms. Acosta was extremely nice and could be found most days making sure the hotel exceeded the needs of guests.  In all - a great place to stay when in Yorba Linda.
Manager Response: Dear 847to602 -  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to welcome you to our hotel. I am pleased we were able to make you feel so comfortable during what must be a difficult time. Thank you as well for your comment regarding room 303 as I am having my maintenance team investigate and correct the issue immediately. I also appreciate your comments in reference to Eleanor as she is an integral part of our team and truly cares about the guest experience. I will be sure to pass along your compliments so she knows she is appreciated. Thank you again for your review and we hope to welcome you again in the future.   Warm regards,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Our family stayed in 3 rooms for 4 nights at the Yorba Linda Ayres while attending a neices wedding.  The hotel was the perfect place for the out of town guests to stay.  Not too expensive but not a budget inn.  The breakfast was always hot and delicious, waffles, eggs, saugage, ceral, bagels and pastry's every morning in additon to either french toast or pancakes, the blueberry ones were my favorite.  The cook would even do fried eggs for you if you asked her. Every morning our group of 40 guests would talk at breakfast so catching up or getting to know see each other was easy.  You can eat inside or out depending upon the weather and your preference.  The beds were very confortable and the rooms VERY clean.  I dropped a contact on the bathroom floor.  After searching the whole
Manager Response: Dear Kathy -  Congratulations to your niece on her new union! I am so pleased that we were able to provide you with such an exceptional experience during this celebratory event. It is wonderful to hear that the cleanliness of the hotel was so impressive as our Housekeeping Team in exceptionally hard working, so I will be sure to pass along your compliments. We wish nothing more than for our guests to have a comfortable visit and appreciate you letting fellow travelers know we can provide this whether the group is small or large. We hope you will make us a part of your future plans to travel to the area!  Warm regards,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Stayed at the Ayres hotel Yorba Linda for 3 nights during our stay in Southern California.  We stayed there when we came down for our daughter's graduatiion from Cal State Fullerton.  The staff was great, the breakfast was wonderful and the room was extremely comfortable and quiet.  Plenty of resturants to walk to.  Overall, wonderful stay!!!!!!!!

Nice clean hotel with pleasant staff would be my first opinion. The rooms are suites with nice beds and a small kitchen with refrigerator. Bathroom with bubble bath if needed. The cons are that the rooms are not well soundproof as one can here from above or from the hallway. The breakfast is the most common, eggs and sausage, waffles, fruit salad, bread and cereals. Coffee or water for tea. No real fruits besides apples, no espressos, limited variety of cereals, not to mention the breakfast room being small but a huge television... No bar in the facility, and no mini-bar in the rooms. Finally, the pool was much too small to swim, only good to get wet. I had a good rate because f company rate, but not worth list price at $205. I would recommend this hotel for a short stay in

It was my first time staying at the hotel as I was in the area for a wedding.  The staff was extremely helpful, even arranging a shuttle service for a few of the guests to the venue.  My room was a "1 King With Sofa Bed" and I was delightedly surprised on the size of the room.  The room was clean as well as the bathroom.  Parking was not an issue.  I would recommend this hotel to a friend if they are staying in the area.

This is our second time staying at Ayres Suites in Yorba Linda.  The hotel and grounds are very well maintained and the breakfast here does not disappoint. There were so many healthy options to choose from which is usually not the case in other hotels.  Room was clean and beds were comfortable even though we booked a "KING SUITE" and got a queen side mattress on a King size headboard.  I guess that and the awkward bathroom door(person at sink will get pegged) are my only cons for this hotel.  Nice to have a fridge in the room.  Would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again as the location is ideal.

I've stayed there several times now. I always want to take time to understand if there my stay is a one time thing or business as usual. The Ayres Suites (Anaheim Hills) is a great place to stay. The staff is very attentive and makes you feel welcome. More than just a customer. The rooms are nice and clean and many restaurants near by. I would recommend to all my friends and business acquaintances. Rick

As a frequent traveler to Southern California I always look forward to my stay at Ayres Suites. The staff is the most courteous and accommodating that I have ever dealt with. The hotel is a quaint property with all the amenities a business traveler could ask for. The rooms are spacious and VERY clean. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Rooms are wide and with enough space, bathroom and toilet were clean, staff was very friendly and helpful... breakfast was okay and gym was small but fine (everything was working properly). Nothing to complain about...  I will come again!
Manager Response: Dear Bruno -  It was wonderful welcoming you as our guest. Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and for your very kind words. I am so pleased that we were able to provide you with the service, cleanliness, and amenities that made your stay with us so enjoyable. Nothing pleases us more than to know a guest has left our hotel satisfied and excited to return, so we look forward to your next visit.   Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Nice clean hotel with friendly and professional staff. Clean rooms. Whirlpool tub with shower in bathroom.  Bed was fine (not exceptional as suggested by another reviewer). Free wi-fi.   Cooked breakfast (waffles, eggs, pancakes, sausages) with cereals, fruit, etc. Several local restaurants and suburban stores near by.  Decor is as promoted, traditional/vintage British styling.  Overall a good value.  I'd stay there again if in the local area.

My friend and I attended a Christian concert and your hotel was in the perfect location!  We enjoyed visiting the shops nearby (Kohls and Taco Bell!).  The hot breakfast was delicious.  I LOVE that you have vending machines with snacks for purchase instead of a little shop, that way, you can go anytime during the day or night to get something to munch on!  Our room felt really big too!  My only thing I'd ask is that you put a sign in the hallways where the elevator is!  We walked by it three times!  You also charge $10- more for 2 queens instead of 1 King, but we did enjoy the AAA rate.  Thanks for the nice stay!  It's nice too that check out is at 12- so you don't feel rushed to leave in the morning.

My husband and I stayed here for six great days - the hotel staff is beyond friendly and very informative - the cafeteria staff was beyond brilliant and supplied a delicious breakfast every morning for the guests - nice selection of foods and very friendly atmosphere - the rooms are enormous and very clean, bed is the most comfortable I've ever slept in - the location is beyond perfect - not too far from LA and close enough for a comfortable drive to San Diego and Palm Springs - I would highly recommend staying at this hotel whether it's for business or just personal travel - this was our first trip to California and the Ayres made us feel very comfortable and welcome - if we ever visit the Los Angeles area again we will definitely being staying at the Ayres - To the Manager -

The Ayres Suites Yorba Linda was an excellent location to stay for a business trip. The breakfast provided was hot and yummy and diverse. The room was large, with plenty of room to spread out for an extended stay. The front desk was very accommodating and helpful when asked for assistance. Very nice!
Manager Response: Dear Dbtdds -  Thank you for your very kind review. Reaching the highest levels of service and cleanliness is of the utmost importance to the team at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda, so it is wonderful to know that we have provided the best possible hotel experience for our guests. I am pleased that you found everything so accommodating and will be sure to share your positive remarks with the team here at the hotel. Thank you again.  Warm regards,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Beautiful room, spacious, nicely appointed.  Beware there are some rooms that have a close-up view of a brick wall (mine).  So I kept the curtains closed.  Delicious hot breakfast served.  I did use the pool and hot tub.  Beware of the hot tub--the steps going in are slicker than slug slime!  I was already holding on with both hands and getting in with care, and I went down.  And I'm a petite, fit person.  So watch out.  Just make sure you get a room with a view and be super cautious getting into that hot tub and you will definitely enjoy your stay at this fine hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Fruitfan -  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you for letting your fellow travelers know about your positive experience. While I am thrilled that you found your overall stay comfortable, I am very sorry if the steps to the hot tub presented a problem. Safety at our hotel is of great concern, so your comments were immediately shared with our maintenance staff and the hot tub inspected and cleared of any potential safety hazards. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a business stay
Summary: Stayed here a few months ago for business for 3 nights.  The hotel was great, nice large comfty bed, the room itself was large and clean.  The bathroom was great - nice and modern.  Got to use the pool once, had a nice view from the pool area and the water temp was perfect.  No complaints.  Next time I'm visiting Yorba Linda I will def stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Isabel -  Thank you for choosing Ayres Suites Yorba Linda for your stay and for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. We wish for nothing more than providing the most comfortable hotel stay possible for all of our guests, so it is wonderful to hear that the accommodations and amenities assisted us in reaching this goal. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to your return.  Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: I have stayed at a few Ayers hotels over the last 4 months for business and I love it. They are great hotels. I had the same great service and amenities and Yorba Linda was no different. The staff were very nice and helpful, the room was great, pool and hot tub were fantastic and then there was the great breakfast in the morning. They also had a fitness center which I liked as well. I would surely stay there again:
Manager Response: Dear Laurie -  Thank you so much for sharing your experience on TripAdvisor and for your continued patronage to the Ayres Hotels. I am pleased to work for a hotel chain that provides such consistent service and proud that Ayres Suites Yorba Linda continues this tradition of excellence. Thank you for choosing our hotel. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again very soon.   Sincerely,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: One of the best choices for a hotel stay!
Summary: We recently stayed at the Ayres Suites in Yorba Linda for a mini get away in celebration of our 33rd wedding Anniversary. Everything was perfect - beautiful room, comfy bed, jetted tub, friendly staff, good location, free parking, free wi-fi, good complimentary breakfast with lots of choices.. and hotel is sandwiched between the Olive Garden and El Toritos... just walk over.
Manager Response: Dear Dia -  Congratulations on a wonderful milestone! Thank you so much for choosing to include our hotel in  such a special event and for sharing your experience on TripAdvisor. I am pleased that you found every area of the hotel comfortable and the service accommodating. Nothing pleases that team here more than to know we have provided the best possible hotel experience for our guests. Perhaps we will have the chance to welcome you on anniversary number 34.  Warm regards,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Coming to a new career promises new adventures ahead. With that said, your stay in an unfamiliar area could be interesting...to say the least. The staff at this hotel, no matter what time of the day or night, were always courteous and helpful to me. They allowed me to concentrate more on what I needed to accomplish..business meetings, trainings, etc. A real plus. And their complimentary hors d'oeuvres/cocktails were a welcomed sight after a long day of training. Great place, great price!
Manager Response: Dear Ryan -  Congratulations on your new employment! I am thrilled that we were able to provide a comfortable stay as your oriented yourself to your new position. We know it is important to have a convenient and agreeable place to rest after a long day of meetings and trainings, so I am overjoyed that we could accommodate you during your first time traveling on business. Hopefully we will be able to welcome you on return visits as well. Thank you again.  Sincerely,   Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Our room was exceptional beginning with the upgraded furniture.  The wallpaper was fabulous and color coordinated with the drapes (with cornice.)  The breakfast buffet has china plates and stainless flatware and has something for every taste.  The lobby is beautiful and welcoming as is the staff.  First class at a friendly price.  Wish these hotels were nationwide.
Manager Response: Dear LeitaLuetta -  Thank you so much for taking the time to let fellow travelers know about Ayres Suites Yorba Linda. I appreciate your kind words and am pleased to hear that everything from the rate to the accommodations to the complimentary full breakfast made for an enjoyable stay. I am privileged enough to work with a wonderful team, so I will be sure to share your comments with them as well. We hope to welcome you again very soon.   Safe travels,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: The Ayres Suites Hotel in Yorba Linda is nothing exciting but provides a solid accommodation for a business traveller.  Build an artificial fireplace in the lobby, put a sofa and some lounge chairs besides, furnish it with a library and call it "boutique hotel".  The rooms are big and the bed is comfortable. The bar in the room is a bit odd and the bathroom is not really appealing and rather small compared to the size of the room. Breakfast is included but nothing exciting either.  To conclude, it is just another roadside motel.
Manager Response: Dear Sveenz -  Thank you very much for your candid review of the hotel. While I was pleased to hear that you found your overall stay satisfactory, I apologize if the decor and breakfast were not to your taste. All 20 Ayres Hotels of Southern California were designed with a European-inspired flare that many guests find quite appealing compared to larger chain hotels. I will be sure to share your comments with the corporate design team for future reference in renovations and decor. As to the complimentary breakfast, we review our offerings very often and will take your comments into account. Again thank you for your review and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Regards,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary Heading: Comfortable, clean, friendly staff- great value
Summary: Before moving to the area, I stayed at this hotel multiple times. Never had a bad experiecne. Ayres Suites is a private, family owned hotel chain in southern California and particpate in Stash Hotel Awards program. The rooms are spacious, newly renovated, the bed is comfortable, large flat screen TV, a microwave and small frig. Free WI-FI.  Most of the bathrooms have jacuzzi tub,  There is also a small workout room and laundry room.  The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful.  They serve a hot breakfast buffet that has a good menu selection- no individual breakfast orders.  In the evening, a manager hour with beer, wine, and a simple appetizer like chips and salsa. Therte is a small swimming pool out back. Nearby restaraunts include Olive Garden, El Toritio, TJ Fridays,

This hotel is well reviewed.  Here is just another one saying, excellent.  Clean friendly comfy upscale modern, quiet.  Delicious breakfast.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat and am glad I did this time.
Manager Response: Dear Kaibacha -  It was an absolute pleasure having you as a guest. Thank you for taking the time to tell fellow travelers about the Ayres Suites Yorba Linda. I am so pleased to hear the accommodations, complimentary breakfast, and service were all to your liking. We look forward to welcoming you again soon!  Safe travels,  Stephanie Rench General Manager

Summary: Beautiful lobby! Hotel looks new wonderful rooms . Great breakfast  love that they are near a sprouts store  would stay longer if I could

This place ranks right up with many others at which we've stayed (Mariott properties, Radissons, Best Westerns).  The rooms were beautifully appointed, the front desk folks were super, and it was convenient to a lot of nice restaurants as well as the Nixon Library which we came to visit.  I highly recommend it for value and "nice-ness".

Summary Heading: Don't sleep on the sofa bed!
Summary: To be fair, I've stayed at Ayres Hotels before and had a great experience.  My husband was looking for something close to the Santa Ana Bike Trail, so I was happy to stay here.  Initially.  I was told that the only room available was 1 bed, plus a sofa bed.  I thought: how bad could it be?  The answer is BAD.  Being the mom, I got the sofa bed... and it was honestly one of the worst night's sleep I've had in the last 20 years.  And, truly, I"m not that picky about beds. Maybe kids wouldn't mind, but not adults.    I bring this up only because it seemed as if this is a favorite hotel spot on the 'weekend sports teams' circuit:  there was a girls soccer team on the weekend we were there... and the front desk confirmed this.  This means that on the weekends, it's going to be
Manager Response: Dear Miznina -  Thank you very much for your review of Ayres Suites Yorba Linda and for your continued patronage to our sister hotels. I am so sorry that your sleep with us was not as restful as it should have been. Our Quality Assurance department is constantly reviewing and replacing mattresses on both our beds and sofa beds that are found to be incompatible with the very high standards we set for our bedding. I will immediately share these comments with the team as we know that sleep is of the utmost importance when staying in a hotel, and it is our goal to ensure adequate levels of rest and relaxation for all guests.   I truly hope that you will return to the hotel and give us the opportunity to make your next stay remarkable. Thank you again for your review.  Safe travels,  Stephanie Rench Yorba Linda

Summary: I love the bed and pillows, very comfy.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  I do agree that a change in breakfast choices each day would be nice.  I was happy to see French Toast on our second morning there.  I wish we had Ayres in Northern California!

I initially got a good impression from the warm welcome of the front desk staff. But on my last day I asked for their shuttle service to the lincoln library, and was told they'd call back but never did. I can't imagine staying here longer than 4 days and being offered the same breafast choices everyday.

We love staying at the Ayres Suites Yorba Linda.  The hotel is top notch in every way--from the cozy lobby area, European decor, the beautifully framed paintings and fine furniture to the spacious suites with comfortable beds, coffee service, microwave, and refrigerator.  The hotel also serves a wonderful hot breakfast every morning in their cafe and also serve wine, beer and snacks from 5-7:00 p.m. in their lobby area.   In addition, there are several restaurants nearby, some within walking distance.  All the staff are very friendly and helpful and treat you like "family."  We travel a lot and always look forward to our stays at Ayres hotels....we wish there were more of them--especially in San Diego and L.A. county!  The Ayres Yorba Linda will definitely exceed all your

I have stayed at the Ayres Yorba Linda multiple times and I'm never disappointed. I love the cozy atmosphere with the classic tradition of an upscale country type home. The rooms are clean, beds are very comfortable. Complimentary Breakfast has a many choices. I will return next year.

We were in town for our daughter's wedding at the Nixon Library. The Ayres Suites was the perfect place for family and friends to stay. We found it to be very comfortable and inviting; the staff was most professional and extremely helpful - even helping to connect with last minute florists, etc. The breakfast is amazing! Will gladly stay again and recommend this place to anyone.
Convenient location and friendly staff.  Above average room at a decent price.

Never stayed at Ayers Suites before, but will certainly do so again. Stayed two nights for a Disney visit. Ideal location close to freeway, only 15 mins from Disneyland, though a long way across town from Hollywood & Santa Monica. The room was immaculate, the complimentary breakfast buffet selection was varied and abundant, and the facilities were all first rate. Took a chance, but followed tripadvisor reviewers' advice. Best accommodation experience in a good long while.

Thank you for the wonderful stay !  Hotel looks new  and staff was so warm. Even the breakfast staff were singing while cooking. All so noticed I believe the maintance man  greeting everyone in the morning with a great big smile.  Must be something in the hotel that makes everyone so happy.   Was here with wife and son visiting relatives in the area. Would stay longer just to enjoy that great breakfast. Great job Ayres family -

...your res request that is.  Unfortunately, I found this out after checking in.  I reserved a room with 2 queens for my mom and I under my cousin's wedding block of rooms.  After looking over the entire web site I was really pleased and sure we were going to have a nice stay and a great mom & daughter weekend with family. My mom was so happy.  Check in went well, up to our room we went and wow were we blown away to the site of a really ugly uninviting sofa bed - not even cloaked in a bedspread and 1 bed in our room.  Surely, there must have been a mistake.  Back down to the front desk we went where we were informed that the property was 100% full, there were no more rooms and that all they could do was maybe offer a discount or cancel my reservation.  Nice huh?  Great customer
Manager Response: Cindy -  Thank you very much for your candid review of Ayres Suites Yorba Linda. I am sorry to hear that you were unsatisfied with your stay.  We try to make every effort to guarantee room types for our guests. Sometimes, however, unforeseeable circumstances make it difficult for us to honor every request. Unfortunately, the construction team was unable to release many of our two queen rooms to us due to the construction at the hotel, which made it difficult to provide the desired room type in this instance. I am very sorry for any inconvenience and that this was not communicated more readily by our Front Desk.  Please know that I have spoken with our team to ensure these things will be handled with the utmost care for our guests and that no charge was incurred for this stay. Again, please do accept our apologies. I hope that you will reconsider staying with us in the future.  Eleanor Acosta Assistant Manager Ayres Suites Yorba Linda

Summary: This was my third stay at the Ayres Suites Yorba Linda.  This hotel is a great value, very clean and well maintained.  The complimentary breakfast in the morning is really good (best scrambled eggs ever).  The staff is extremely friendly and accomodating. The hotel offered free shuttle service and the gentleman who drives the van is so friendly and goes out of his way to accomodate you.  If I had to offer any suggestions, it would be to have a larger, better equipped workout room and unlock the gate to the jacuzzi at 6am.  I would definitely stay there again if I am in the area and would recommend to family and friends.

My husband was here on business, and I went along for the ride--and we were really surprised! The lobby is comfortable and sociable--with a reception every evening, the rooms are huge, spotless, and well laid out, and the staff was wonderful--gave me directions to all sorts of places I wanted to try out while my husband was working. We had come from the Sheraton in Anaheim for a different conference; it was nice, but not as nice as Ayres Suites--and more than twice the rate!

We have stayed at many Ayres and this was one of the best of the best. Fantastic staff, nice rooms, stayed in King Suite. Great access to freeways, stores, restaurants. Stayed on canyon side which had a nice night view.
This is a beautifully appointed hotel.  It's in a safe neighborhood, was quiet, and is near the freeway and shopping.  I would definitely stay here again.
This is the third time I stayed at Ayers Suites.  It is a great hotel and they recebtly upgraded their fitness center which was helpful.

Our stay at Ayres, Yorba Linda, was incredible.  We were there for my son's wedding and they really went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and help us with many details.  The staff just couldn't do enough for us, and we very much appreciated everything.  Having a ready hot breakfast in the morning was great and sooo convenient.  The rooms are incredibly comfortable and clean with a fridge, microwave and wet bar.  The tubs are whirlpool tubs!!  The beds are very comfortable.  We would definitely stay there again.  I wouldn't even want to consider staying anywhere else.  The location is also convenient.  There is shopping and restaurants all around.  Just a great place and a good value dollarwise.

My Nephew's wedding planner notified the Hotel a week in adb=vance about my Grand Daughter traveling on their shuttle. She is 3 years old. When the day came, they refused to ride her because they did not have a booster seat for her. Three possible solutions would have been to actually purchase a booster seat prior to her arrival, for general usage in the Hotel; advice me prior to arrival that we needed to provide a boostwer seat; or even have me sign a liability waiver prior to traveling. Instead, they made the problem mine. When I asked if they could assist, they would not. I felt very unwelcome at that moment and embarrassed, becasue they did not even take me to the side to explain. They simply kept saying there was nothing they could do in front of all other guests, making it
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review of Ayres Suites Yorba Linda. I am very sorry to hear that you were unsatisfied with your stay at the hotel.  We do our utmost to accommodate all guest needs and transportation wishes. As we rarely transport children needing a child seat, we do not have one available at the hotel. Our understanding was that a child was going to be present and we had assumed, unfortunately, that the child would be able to utilize the child seat that had been used to transport him/her to the hotel. I apologize greatly for this error and that we were unable to meet your needs.  Please know your comments are being taken very seriously as we strive to ensure that every guest leaves our hotel completely satisfied. Again thank you for your review and I hope you will reconsider staying at Ayres Suites Yorba Linda.  Eleanor Acosta Assistant Manager Ayres Suites Yorba Linda

Summary: Friends in Yorba Linda recommended the Ayres and when we return, we will definitely stay here again.  From the moment we arrived it seemed as if family was welcoming us.  All hotel staff members were extremely friendly and helpful!  The lobby and the entire hotel are decorated with extremely good taste.  The rooms are clean and roomy.  The breakfast buffet is well stocked with a variety of choices. Our only regret is that our stay was for only two nights.

This hotel lived up to what was promised!  It was very clean, the beds were extremely comfortable, the location was great, and the breakfast was very good.  Loved that there was a small fridge, microwave, and plenty of hot water in the wet bar (to wash the baby bottles). The room was quiet and we all got a good nights sleep after 2 fun-filled days in Disneyland (about a 25 minute drive away).  We stayed here because it was a few minutes from family.  I only have 3 minor complaints: 1) The carpets look a little worn - should consider replacing soon.  2) The vanity/sink in the bathroom was so high that my 4 year old couldn't wash her hands after using the facilities without help.  She could have benefited from a step stool, also the lighting was very dim.  3) I didn't care for the
We love this hotel it is close to our family and also to the restaurants and shopping that we both enjoy. Our grandchildren love to come and see our room and sometimes visit the beautiful pool.

My husband and I stayed here for a week long Southern California trip.  It is a nice area with lots of shops and right off the freeway, so it's easy to access anything.  Disneyland is a short drive away too.  We usually stay in the Disneyland area when we stay down here, but next time I'll come here again because it is quiet, comfortable, clean, there is a great breakfast buffet, free wifi, and free parking.
Hotel was clean and welcoming.  Room was spacious. Price was right.  Breakfast was adequate.

This was the second time we stayed at Ayers Suites. It was as good as before. we will choose to stay here again when we visit southern Ca. The room is very attractive and spacious. the amenities are better than some other places we've stayed. The reception dsek is always helpful and friendly.

We thoroughly enjoyed our two nights in a large, comfortable bedroom. Wet bar in room with frig, ceiling fan in addition to a/c, jacuzzi tub, decent breakfast, hot chocolate chip cookies and beer/wine in the early early evening, what's not to like? Only caveat--watch out for steps into hot tub/spa next to pool which were very slippery.

The accomodations are upscale yet priced reasonably.  The rooms are large and spacious.  The breakfast buffet was estraordinary with at least four fresh cooked (hot) entrees and fresh cut fruit (not the canned stuff with preservatives).  The pool and spa were clean and inviting and the fitness room was equipped well. The only problem I had was wireless internet speed and consistency and since I had no critical business to tend to, this didn't deserve a formal complaint.  I truly enjoyed my four night stay at Ayres Suites in Yorba Linda, CA.

Summary Heading: Can't wait to see our friends at Ayers and our new Grandbaby too!
Summary: My husband and I have stayed at the Yorba Linda Ayers Suites on numerous occasions in 2010 and 2011 and every visit has been enjoyable. The property inside and out is kept clean and in the best of repair at all times. If we have advised of a burnt out light bulb and a peice of loose weatherstripping on the automatic front doors to the Hotel, our report was acted on very quickly and in such a friendly manner. The location of this Ayers is supberb, whether you want to visit Disneyland, South Coast Plaza, or Fashion Island in Orange County, the trip to each will be easy. My husband and I especially enjoyed the FRESH breakfast included in the room price.  Fresh eggs, sausage, fresh fruit, coffee, milk  juice are just a few of the offerings. Love the bed! And just in case you are in

We stayed at this hotel in August 2010 with our two teenagers for family vacation.  This is an awesome hotel that is family friendly!  The rooms are large, clean and the beds are very comfortable.  Our room had a kitchenette area for snacks, fridge items etc.  The full hot breakfast in the mornings is just amazing - I have never seen this at any hotel I've stayed at before.  The pool area is also very nice.  Tons of easy free parking around the hotel (park in back where its quieter).  And there are some good restaurants on site including an awesome Mexican restaurant and an Olive Garden.  The hotel is close to Anaheim Stadium and Disneyland - takes maybe about 10 minutes by car.  However, be warned that the freeway in front of the hotel is always very busy 7 days a week so there

Summary Heading: This is it!  Don't waste time looking anywhere else!
Summary: Have tried other hotels in Yorba Linda.  None compare.  The service was friendly and went out of their way to help us. The lobby is beautiful and clean. The whole building is smoke-free which we love.   Rooms were large, clean, modern and the beds were very cozy.  Felt like we were at a spa facility.  Then you get to wake up to a SUPERB  breakfast buffy all included in your price. You can't go wrong!
The room was excellent, the staff extremely attentive, breakfast was delicious, and the convenience of the proximity to my brother's home was  very much appreciated.

Comfortable rooms, hotel is close to freeway, but not close enough to be bothered by traffic noises. Serves continental breakfast daily (from make your own waffles to toast, bacon & eggs) included in price of room. Friendly staff and chocolate chip cookies & wine reception in lobby.

Summary Heading: We had never stayed at an Ayres and would recommend it to anyone.
Summary: The stay was very good- large room, microwave, fridge and sofa.  The breakfast was good, but the bread and bagels were stale and the pastries were old and tasted like they had freezer burn- very nasty!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review on our hotel, we apologize that we did not meet your needs on your recent stay with us.  Your comments have been given to the housekeeping/kichen department. We hope to see you again. Thank you, The Staff at the Ayres Suites  Yorba Linda

Summary: Never stayed at a Ayres, it was better than expected, I expected a 2 star hotel. It is right beside an Olive Garden, my daughter was pleased. The room was clean, the hotel was quaint- it had a upperclass feeling to it. Check in painless. Morning buffet was ok. free parking, and internet a plus.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review on our hotel, we our glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, we hope to see you again in the future. Thank you, The Staff of the Ayres Suites Yorba Linda

Summary: My sister and I needed a place to stay in or around Yorba Linda after attending a family event.  We looked at the usual generic hotels, and then found the Ayres.  It is a gorgeous building with an elegant inviting lobby and our room was just beautiful and spotless with two queen beds.  Such comfortable beds!!  Everything was as beautiful as the pictures. We went next door to El Torito for dinner and then had a great nights sleep.  In the morning the hotel served a delicious buffet breakfast including french toast, sausage, hash browns, waffles, bagels....yummm.  The staff were all super nice and treated us like we were truly welcome.  I will absolutely stay there as often as I can!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are happy that you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope to see your again. Thank you The Staff at the Ayres Suites  Yorba Lina

Summary: Stayed at this hotel for two nights. Great staff, great room. Will be going back.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel, we our glad to hear that you enjoyed you stay with us, we hope to see you again. Thank you The Staff at the Ayres Suites Yorba Linda

Summary: We drove to Southern CA. to visit family who'd flown in from South Carolina.  I found the Ayres Suites online and decided to give it a whirl.  When we walked in the lobby was EXTREMELY pleasing and had great eye appeal.  Our room was very clean and very cozy and comfortable.   I would highly suggest staying at the Ayer's!  We told all of our family there if they had anyone coming to visit to have them stay at the Ayres.  And if we drive back for a few days, we will do the same.  And it's by several great restaurants for family gatherings!!!  Oh, and the FREE breakfast it offers in the mornings was a big, big plus too.. Just all around a really nice experience!

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, friendly people and great value
Summary: The hotel had what travelers like myself want:  clean and quiet room; free and tasty breakfast; treadmill; great location; very friendly staff

Summary Heading: Cheap and Cheerful- Good for a quick visit
Summary: I have stayed at other Ayres Suites and am usually a very big fan, however, this location lacked a few things. Just as an overall observation, the decor is beginning to look very outdated in both the lobby and the bedrooms and could use some sprucing up. Aside from that minor point, the biggest feeling I had was that the carpet in our room was not clean. I am not usually one to be overly phobic about these things but it looked dingy and when I walked on it it felt grimy and that is a huge pet peeve for me. It was really the only thing that wasn't clean in the whole hotel, everything else was very good, but carpet cleanliness is such a huge thing for me as I am walking around barefoot most of the time that it left a big negative impression on me.  Aside from that, the room was

Stayed with my wife & 3 year old son in December 2010.  Nice big rooms- bathtub is little old but has a Jacuzzi attachment (never used it though).Free wi-fi in the rooms, beautiful wooden furniture, microwave, mini fridge, coffee maker, LCD TV in the room. Comfy beds. Coin operated washing machine & dryer with washing fluid available on 2 floors near the elevators. Free beer & colas available in the lobby in the evening. Hot breakfast at lobby level- quite nice but repetitive after a couple of days. The hotel staff will drop you if needed to close by locations within limits. Very helpful reception staff.  Next door is olive garden (Italian) and El Torito (Mexican). A little further is Denny and down the hill to one side is McDonalds and other fast food places. Lots of shopping

Summary Heading: The best stay in the area
Summary: I recently stayed at this hotel and all i can say is "wow". This place made for a heck of a stay. The hotel staff was really friendly and full of holiday cheer. The room was fantastic; it looked brand new and the bed was amazing. The breakfast was the best free breakfast ive ever had at a hotel; It was just right and exceeded my expectations for a free breakfast. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great stay at a great price.

I recently stayed at this hotel and had a wonderful experience. The staff was very warm and friendly and check in was a breeze. The hotel and room were very nice and it felt like I was staying at home, not a hotel. Breakfast in the morning is the best free hotel breakfast I've ever had. All in all I will definitely stay again.
Easy on and off fwy access and really hot guy working down stairs. Everyone was very friendly. Enjoyable wine hour and free breakfast buffet was best I've ever had at a hotel

I flew to Orange County for business training in the Yorba Linda area.  The hotel was very clean, safe, quiet and extremely comfortable.  It has a great location and it was an easy trip o area sightseeing and nightlife when the workday was over.  I would highly recommend this hotel!

We recently stayed at the Ayres Yorba Linda -- it was fabulous. Great rooms- large and clean. Wonderful breakfast every morning but the best thing is their tremendous service. The staff are friendly, helpful and really make you  feel welcomed. I would definitely stay there again !
I had a wedding block for 10 rooms. it was very easy and they hotel staff were awesome and accommodating! Easiest part of wedding planning was using this hotel. Thanks Ayres YL!

Summary Heading: Very spacy rooms - right between LA and Vegas
Summary: Well I used this hotel for the 5th time - and having it as a business hotel - I must say I can recommend it - esspecially for the spacious rooms and that it is quiet under night. Breakfast is ok. There is an outside pool which you could not use in February. Right next to the hotel you find several restaurants. I recommend the Mexican Restaurant. If you look for more basic there is a TGIF close by.

What  a great place. I spent 4 nights for a business related trip accompanied by my girlfriend. I spent days in class while she lounged at the super clean pool and hottub. The hotel is very clean and they are constantly cleaning and painting. Beds are very comfortable with Jacuzzi tubs in rooms. Full self serve breakfast daily with so good waffles, hash browns, eggs, fruit, etc. All the amenities plus a wine and snack freebie M-Th 5-7. Fresh baked cookies in the evenings. This is a 100 year old family business with 20 hotels throughout southern CA with a luxury look and a homey feel. Don't forget the free shuttle to restaurants within a 5 mile radius. Loved it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel, we our glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, we hope to see you again.  Thank you, Ayres Suites Yorba Linda

Summary Heading: You DO NOT want to stay here
Summary: Clogged sink, lime scum shower head, horrible service, need i say more.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we apologize that we did not meet your needs on your recent stay with us.  Your comments have been given to front desk, maint., and houskeeping departments.  Thank you, Ayres Suites Yorba Linda

Summary: Spacious, clean, comfortable and well designed rooms.  Fairly well situated in Yorba Linda and Easy to get to.  Situated right between two restaurants (Toritos and Olive Garden).   Friendly staff.  The beds could be improved, in my opinion.  Something more like Hampton Inn.  Would return here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are happy that you enjoyed your stay with us. Hope to see you again.  Thank you, Ayres Suites Yorba Linda

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres Suites during our trip to Disneyland.  I was a bit worried it might be too far away, but it really wasn't.  It took less than 20 minutes to go to Disneyland.  At the end of each day, I was glad our hotel wasn't in the middle of all the madness surrounding DL.  There are also several close resturants, shopping and movie theaters.  Newport Beach is also less than 30 minutes away.  The hotel was quiet and we could only tell there were other guests there one night (the family above us came back around 10:30 and kids were jumping around the room.)  Our room was on the highway side, but we couldn't hear any traffic noise.  The room was big and very clean.  Housekeeping did a wonderful job making up the room.  The breakfast each morning was great.  Eggs, waffles,

Summary Heading: Inexpensive; Would Benefit From Better Management
Summary: Postives:   1. Relatively inexpensive.   2. Nice staff.   3. Easy On/Off from Freeway (22).   4. Near shopping centers/restaurants.   5. Good beds.  Negatives:   1. Reeks of disinfectant.   2. Air conditioning is ineffective at recycling air.   3. Restaurant is too small.   4. Free breakfast is too limited.   5. Cable TV offers too few channels.
Manager Response: Dear Tripadvisor Member,  We thank you for your comments on our hotel. It is important to us to recieve feedback from our guests on how we can improve our performance. We have reviewed this information with our housekeeping and maintainance departments.  Thank you, Ayres Suites- Yorba Linda

Summary: Stayed for 5 nights.  Pros:  - Excellent bed, had some superb sleep - Nice furniture - Good service - Excellent cleaning service  Contras:  - Slow internet access, although free - Breakfast is decent but way too american; considering that the Hotel pretends to be very much european-style - Bathroom is nothing special, even if the bath tube has got a jacuzzi function - Half of the rooms are facing towards the high-way, very noisy if you open a windoww.
Manager Response: Dear Tripadvisor Member, We thank you for your comments on our hotel, We are glad that you enjoyed your stay. Thank you, Ayres Suites - Yorba Linda

Summary: We stayed at Ayres for 2 nights in September and were thoroughly impressed.  Large spacious room, wonderful breakfast and friendly staff highlighted our stay.  The only problem we had was our TV remote did not have batteries, which the front desk promptly handled.
Manager Response: Dear Tripadvisor Member, Thank you for sharing your remarks on your stay, we are pleased that you enjoyed your time here. Thank you, Ayres Suites - Yorba Linda

Summary: We stayed here in August for 4 nights.  We got a really great rate on this hotel ($69/nite) and were extremely pleased with the hotel.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable.    It was right off of the freeway, but our room was on the "canyon side" of the hotel - noise was not an issue.    The room was a "suite" of course (all rooms are here) and so it was pretty spacious and convenient to have a little living area/kitchenette.  It was very hot in CA when we were there - the public areas (hallways, stairwell) did not seem to have the AC on, but it worked fine in our room so it was comfortable.  I would recommend this hotel and would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Tripadvisor Member, Thank you for your wonderful remarks, we are thrilled you enjoyed your stay and look forward to welcoming you back.  Thank you, Ayres Suites - Yorba Linda

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres Yorba Linda on the advice of a local resident when we were in Yorba Linda for a family wedding from July 10 - 12, 2009.  We were greeted and efficiently checked in by a very pleasant young lady, and our room was ready even though we were there just after noon.  The room (411) was large, very clean and looks like the pictures on their web site. It had a desk, dresser, full size leather couch and a bar area with a mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker and a sink. The king size bed was very comfortable and had feather pillows. Oddly, they do not have pay per view movies.  There is an included breakfast that consisted of two types of eggs, hash browns, assorted pasteries, breads, cereals, juices, two make your own waffle stations as well as other items. It far

Check-in was smooth; we were given a room with a canyon view at the back of the hotel and it was very quiet. We had a problem with very noisy guestsone morning, but after mentioning it to the desk staff it didn't happen again. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was spacious and nicely decorated. It felt like a much more expensive hotel. The housekeeping staff kept our room spotless during our stay and they respected the "do not disturb" as well as being immediately responsive to "service please." The manager's reception was a nice unexpected touch and the breakfast was very good.

I found the Hotel charming although it's near a Major Hwy I asked for a room in the back the canyon view was great and quiet. The first room I got had a bad ordor from the carpets or BO from the workers, so I asked to be changed to another room and it was not as bad as the first room and they did spray it down which helped. The room was fine, Hot tub in the rooms are great when you had a long day. Make sure you get some soaking salts for your legs and feet. Don't use bubble bath cause you will be overflowing in bubbles and the currants in the tubs are very strong. Breakfast every morning was the best I had in years! Fresh pancakes, waffles, omletts, etc. Coffee was good too. I stayed there for 4 nights and Yorba Linda can get a bit boring at night after the 2nd night. I was

The Ayres Suites in Yorba Linda provided a very quiet, peaceful retreat for us. We were very impressed with the entire hotel, from the attractive decor in the lobby to the cleanliness of the entire pool area. We reserved a junior king suite, with the canyon view. It had a microwave, refrigerator, and coffee pot in it. We were anticipating a flat screen TV as some of the other properties had listed it, but the Yorba Linda property is still in the process of renovating and up grading their rooms. The room had a large bath, but unfortunately, the Jacuzzi tub was too short, wide enough, but not long enough for one to stretch out. The canyon view was pretty funny!
